195001.name: Circus of the Stars (4e)
195001.description:
From publisher blurb:

Come one, come all to the greatest show in the world! Step right up ladies and lords to see the wonders of the natural and unnatural world! Trained animals from across the globe have been gathered for your amusement and examination! Strongmen, jugglers, acrobats, sword swallowers, and our exclusive flying clowns join exotic acts and foods from the four corners of the known world and beyond!

You, my friend have the privilege of witnessing the spectacle, the amazement, the wonder of the circus of the stars! Step right up and buy your tickets now before they're all gone! Limited seating is available and no one will be seated once the show has begun!

195002.name: Theomachy: New Blood Pack
195002.description: An expansion pack with 2 new pantheons: Aztec and Nightmare (Cthulhu Mythos). Available as an add-on on KS campaign.

195003.name: Curse of the Night Blood Orcs
195003.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the city of Davenshire the populace knows they had better be indoors before dusk. This curfew is not enforced by the city militia, but instead by the phantom-like orc raiders of the Night Blood Clan, who appear as silent as a shadow and as deadly as nightshade. The orcs have become a part of life in the city, but recently they have stepped up their raids and now they've gone too far, kidnapping a citizen! The city of Davenshire has put out the call for help in ridding themselves of this threat. Will your heroes rise to the challenge and unravel the mystery of the Curse of the Night Blood Orcs?

This module is intended for 7th level PCs

195004.description:
Like Madriga and her companions, your adventures do not stop with the end of the Dwarf King’s Quest. Mantica teems with dark places, great treasures and evil deeds, and this book will help you to construct your own adventures amongst them, whether you wish to create a hero to battle the darkness, or your own villain to rule the world.

Features:

Create a hero - Generate a truly individual Hero or Overlord from scratch, based on any model in your collection. The choice is yours, from name and profession to spells and songs!

Design the Dungeon - Conjure up your very own maps, objectives and backstory. From the cavernous to the claustrophobic, we give you the tools and tips to put together a unique challenge.

Level Up - Watch proudly as your Character evolves from the very first adventure, gaining levels, abilities, and above all great stories to tell! Will you master a discipline, or branch out and learn new skills?

Be Bad - Turn the game on its head by playing as an evil party, heading off to take down a ‘good’ Overlord and his band of so-called Heroes.

Explore - Between adventures, visit one of 13 different downtime locations to rest, replenish and more! Will it be Tavern or the Temple this time?

Play Solo or Full Co-op - These rules allow for a new and engaging single-player experience, in addition to a co-operative mode in which no Overlord player is required!

Tackle Uncharted Dungeons - Venture into the unknown and hold your breath as the map unfolds before you in this exciting variant where no-one knows what lurks around the next corner!

Your Dungeon Saga Awaits you...

195005.name: The Perilous Secrets of Wilford Manor
195005.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Perilous Secrets of Wilford Manor is First Volume of the Doombringer Saga Campaign Arc. This adventure module that can be used in any D&D 4e Campaign Setting.

"My son, Tulwen, with whom some of you are acquainted, has gone... missing," he states flatly, his deep voice low and tense. "I fear something may have happened to him, for he is nearly a week overdue in returning."

The Earl fixes you with a sad stare and says, "I would require... no, I ask you, as Tulwen's friend... to go and find out what happened to my son."

Something strange is happening in the sleepy hamlet of Wilford. No one at court has heard from the Baron in years. And now the young knight, Tulwen, sent to investigate is long overdue. A powerful Earl has sent you to find his son, which would seem a simple quest, but there is so much more to The Perilous Secrets of Wilford Manor.

The Doombringer Saga is a series of adventure modules designed as an entire campaign arc for Player-Characters from Level 1 to Level 30. Although the First Volume is created for the beginning of the Heroic Tier, the adventure is epic in scope. It will introduce Player-Characters to a world-shaking threat which will not only decide the fate of the Mundane Realm, but that of the Feyweald and Shadowmoor as well!

The Perilous Secrets of Wilford Manor Includes:

An engaging storyline that can be played as part of the Doombringer Saga Campaign Arc, or as a stand-alone adventure for five 1st Level Characters.
A back story complete with adventure "hooks" to introduce Characters to The Doombringer Saga.
8 Challenging Combat Encounters
3 Unique Skill Challenges
Nearly a dozen full color tactical encounter maps
New Monsters, Hazards, and More!

Tales from the Borderlands - Episode 5: The Vault of the Traveler

User Summary

All 5 Tales From The Borderlands episodes packaged together.

195007.description:
Dirty Cops: A Game for Scoundrels is a fast paced 2-4 player game where players work cooperatively against criminals, then stab each other in the back to gain the most money.

Games take place over 3-4 crime scenes, depending on player count, with each player taking on the role of lead detective during the course of the game.

Players choose how much they work together, making (and breaking) alliances with each other to survive the criminals (and other cops). Players also choose how ruthless they want to be with each other, allowing the group to set the tone for the game.

Cops, drugs, and guns...what kind of cop will YOU be?

The Other Side of the Galaxy
195008.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sorcerer's Scrolls Issue 43 Featuring: Exploitation! A complete role playing game about seventies' style exploitation adventures; new spells and monsters for D&D 4th edition; a scenario of fantastic historical horror in Tarrascon, France for use with any game system; the Stellar Expanse Setting for Traveller; new fiction by Dan Lambert and Jeremiah Griffon; and more!

195009.name: The Sorcerer's Scrolls (Issue 44)
195009.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sorcerer's Scrolls #44 is here! This issue features:

For Dungeons & Dragons 4th Edition:
Bloody Good Gear - new magical devices;
Feats of the Water Goddess - new feats for seafaring adventurers;
The Bagheera - A strange, pantherine vampiric race;

For D&D 4E, Castles & Crusades and other older editions: **Sorcerers of the Mountain Kingdoms - a campaign concept based on the Mountain God religion of ancient Tibet;
For D&D 3.5: Hazedlan - a campaign idea for use with the **Expanded Psionics Handbook!
For Traveller: The Sirianthus Sector - a variety of new worlds to explore and an introductory scenario, the latest chapter in the Stellar Expanses Universe!

195010.name: The Sorcerer's Scrolls (Issue 45)
195010.description:
From publisher blurb:

This latest 94 page issue of The Sorcerer's Scrolls features new fantasy and SF fiction, reviews, and gaming articles for Traveller, Dungeons & Dragons, Castles & Crusades and more!

195011.name: The Sorcerer's Scrolls (Issue 47)
195011.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sorcerer's Scrolls 47, the magazine of fiction and gaming.

195012.name: Invocation Frontiers
195012.description:
Real-time game, in which up to 6 players must simultaneously and continuously play cards to its own boards trying to defeat at least one of the different powers of any of the opponent's cards and take them. The effects of the played cards are instantaneous and change the powers and abilities of other cards in play.

It's a fast and frenetic game, that can be played even with kids.
The game is played in rounds until the deck is empty (more players means less time). When this happens, the players count the total strength of the defeated cards, and who has more is declared winner.
It can also be played in constructed deck mode.

195013.name: Gods Of Egypt: Secrets Of The Lost Kingdom
195013.description:
Think you can survive in a war between the gods? Challenge your courage, strength, and stamina in Gods of Egypt: Secrets of the Lost Kingdom.

Put your fighting skills to the test in this all-new action game, based on the upcoming film Gods Of Egypt. Play as Horus, god of the sky, and his human sidekick Bek. Together you'll battle against evil god Set and his otherworldly creatures.

Source: The Developer Website.

195014.name: A Curious Deck for Extraordinary Liars
195014.description:
This is the first of a series of games based on some simple rules... Here's the description from the back of the box:

A Curious Deck for Extraordinary Liars contains 56 peculiar cards depicting surreal and unintentionally hilarious Victorian art from ads and postcards dated 1880-1910.

Instructions for play:
The first player takes a card from the deck. The card holder may choose to describe what they see on the card or lie about what is on the card. It's up to the other players to determine whether the card holder is lying or telling the truth. Players are permitted to ask questions.

When all players have guessed Lie or Truth, the card holder announces the correct answer and reveals the card.

The player to the left then takes a new card from the deck and continues the game.

Players who guess correctly get 1 point.

The first player to 10 points wins.

195015.name: Mother Truckers
195015.description:
Mother Truckers is a CB jaw-jackin', blacktop fast-trackin', madcap dash across 1970s America for 2-4 players. The goal of the game is for your female trucker to make a name for herself by being the first to gain 12 Fame Points and show the boys you can outhaul, outdrive, and outwit every other gearjammer on the road. Put the hammer down as you pick up Commodities and deliver them to cities that demand them for Fame. Earn Action cards for your accomplishments and use them to dominate the highway as you become a truck driving legend! Just be sure to steer clear of old smokey...

On each turn, a player rolls the Movement Die and optionally the Speeding Die if they wish to attempt speeding. Speeding can allow for an extra Movement point per turn, but can cause wasted fuel trying to avoid the cops if they catch you.

The player may then split their Movement between physically moving road spaces on the map, refueling, and picking up or dropping off loads in cities. Each road space costs 10% fuel and players are towed to the connected city of another player's choice if they run out of fuel.

Contracts offer incentives to deliver certain types of goods or travel to specific regions for bonus Fame. Action cards spice up the game by creating risky scenarios for extra Fame such as Bar Brawls and Street Chicken. Or, play devious deeds against your opponents such as shooting out their gas tanks and stealing their loads. Naturally, all cards are flavored with classic 1970s CB jargon.

195016.name: Sabres & Sorcery
195016.description:
(publisher blurb)

Sabres & Sorcery is a traditional, pencil and paper role-playing game, based upon the excellent Sabres & Witchery RPG by Simon Washburne. Those gamers familiar with Sabres & Witchery, Labyrinth Lord, or pre-1990s versions of Dungeons & Dragons, etc. will have no problems understanding these rules. The rules of Sabres & Sorcery are simple enough for a 12-year old to grasp and meaty enough for a 48-year old to enjoy.

195017.name: Orbit (2011)
195017.description:
Oh no! The Space Program is in peril now there's NO MONEY ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD!! That won't stop two scientists from taking on the Orbit project, a no-budget exploration of our solar system.

Dodge through asteroid fields, and avoid nasty enemies intent on stealing cash, fuel, or just throwing slime in your eyes!

By collecting the money mysteriously floating in orbit around the planets, you'll give the project a cash boost, upgrading shonky systems and gaining new ships to move beyond the Moon - from Mercury to Uranus - as never before!

Orbit's research menu features almost 200 unique upgrades, plus there are hidden relics and blueprints to find, stat tracking, and 12 challenging medals to earn.

The launch pad is all set. Are you ready to get into Orbit?

Source: The Developer Website.

195018.name: Legend Tabletop Roleplaying Game System
195018.description:
From the introduction:

Legend is a fast-paced and finely balanced roleplaying game system, designed to offer tabletop gaming groups rules for playing the games that they’ve always wanted to play. Based on the successful and popular rules available under the Open Gaming License, Legend rebuilds and advances those rules to allow for testing, balance, and broad storytelling opportunities for unique and enjoyable characters and game worlds.

195019.name: Seadog Tuxedo
195019.description:
User summary:

Characters in this game are all penguins who are pirates (thus, the name). Characters have three Traits (somewhat like Attributes), including Pirate, Penguin, and Idiom. Pirate and Penguin balance the character's approach to seafaring and in many ways are opposites. Idiom defines everything else about the character.

Play is almost entirely narrative development, with players taking turns performing narrative creation. The game uses shots of rum (for the players) as a sort of narrative control.

The game was published as a series of numerous small posts to the contest forum over several days; it is thus fairly difficult to access the complete rules.

195020.name: Értem a pénzem
195020.description: The players are collectors of old money, and their aim is to collect more and more coins, old bank notes, bills, and assemble a valuable collection of them. They can also sell these collections throughout the game, to make an extra profit by the end of the game. The player who knows the most about the acquired art treasure's historical background, can make lavish benefits quickly, but who has less knowledge can also get one copy released for auction, with the help of an expert. Knowledge or tactics may prove better? Whoever collects the most forints by the end of the game, will be the most succesful numismatic and the winner of the game. The game was created with educational purpose, and its aim is to present and teach Hungarian history. Every thesis has five questions, specific fot that era, which must be answered correctly to win the subject of auction. If someone doesn't know the correct answer for the question, he/she can hire the other players as experts, who will get payment for the right answer from the principal. The biggest income can be reached by selling collections during the game.

195021.name: Palette Swap
195021.description:
Palette Swap is a 2-4 player logic puzzle game in which you are given a 'palette' of primary colors that you mix, match, and swap with your fellow artists in order to complete your schemes to win the game. If you're clever you can complete multiple schemes in a single turn, and close attention is rewarded if another artist creates the scheme you were after when it's not your turn.

On your turn, you may spend two of the five colors in your palette for their effects. Red allows you to match the colors your opponents have, yellow lets you mix your colors and theirs together, and blue lets you swap a color from your palette with one of another player's colors. Playing two primary colors gets you a secondary color, which simply combines the effects of the two primaries. Playing two secondary colors get you a black, which you must use on your next turn and costs you your secondary colors.

As you change the colors you possess and your opponent's, you will be able to complete your goals, all of which are based on actual color schemes such as split complimentary and analogous schemes. Accomplishing all five of your schemes first makes you the victor.

The game also includes cooperative rules for playing with younger children and rules for solo play.

195022.name: Una misteriosa scomparsa
195022.description: From the publisher's website: In "Una Misteriosa Scomparsa" ("A Mysterious Vanishing") your characters will roam Blan-Su-Naar, the Sand-Conquering Iron, a semi-desertic Level specialized in the production of weapons, searching for a distinguished Seroii who vanished. Of course, nothing is what it seems, and the issue at stake is a mystery involving a whole Race.

195023.name: Unspeakable Cults: The Starry Wisdom
195023.description:
From publisher blurb:

In our final issue of the year, we give the Hideous Creatures treatment not to one beast but to a whole cult — the “disliked and unorthodox Starry Wisdom sect.” Vile rites and terrifying symbolism unfold to shadow your Trail of Cthulhu game, along with alternate takes, investigative leads, possible echoes, and sinister scenario seeds.

195024.name: Agatha Christie's The ABC Murders (2016)
195024.description:
User Summary

Adapted from the classic Agatha Christie novels, 'The ABC Murders' is an adventure and investigation game, offering sharp-minded gamers the chance to step into the shoes of Hercule Poirot.

195026.description:
Pokémon Sun and Pokémon Moon (ポケットモンスター　サン・ムーン Poketto Monsutā San & Mūn?) are role-playing video games developed by Game Freak and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo 3DS. They are the first installments in the seventh generation of Pokémon games. First announced in February 2016 through a special Nintendo Direct, both Sun and Moon were released worldwide in November 2016, commemorating the franchise's 20th anniversary.

As with previous installments, each game follows the journey of a young Pokémon trainer (and the trainer's friends) as they train Pokémon. This time, the game takes place in the Alola region—based on Hawaii—with the object of the game being to thwart the schemes of the nefarious criminal organization Team Skull, all while attempting to challenge various Pokémon trainers of gradually increasing difficulty. Sun and Moon introduced 81 new Pokémon species, and includes new features such as Alolan forms of previous generation Pokémon, powerful moves known as Z-Moves, new, powerful creatures known as Ultra Beasts, updated battle and training mechanics, and improved polygonal 3D graphics. The games also adopted the previously introduced battle mechanic known as Mega Evolution, which was first introduced in Pokémon X and Y. Although Sun and Moon are mostly independent of each other, both feature largely the same plot, and while either can be played separately, trading Pokémon between the two games is allowed.

Upon release, the game received positive reviews from critics, and shipped over 10 million units worldwide within a week, becoming one of the fastest selling games in Nintendo's history. With 14.69 million copies sold worldwide by the end of December 2016, Sun and Moon are the third-best-selling Nintendo 3DS titles.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pokémon Sun and Moon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195027.name: Turtles Power Cards - Donatello
195027.description:
Pick a power on your card and compare it with the values on the other players´cards. The players win or lose cards on each round, and the last player with cards left wins the game.
This Deck is specifically dedicated to Donatello even if all the Ninja Turtles Characters are present

195028.name: Ninja: The Way of the Tiger
rpg: The Way of the Tiger Gamebooks
The Way of the Tiger Roleplaying Game
195028.description:
From the back of the book:

'I will vanish into the night; change my body to wood or stone; sink into the earth and walk through walls and locked doors. I will be killed many times, yet will not die; change my face and become invisible, able to walk among men without being seen.' This is the convenant of a ninja of the Way of the Tiger, taught to you by your slain foster-father Naikishi. Before you were ever known as Avenger, before your quest for vengeance would change the world of Orb, you were to face great evil in the idyllic Island of Plenty. You are the youngest of five Initiates of the Inner Circle challenging to become Grandmaster of the Five Winds. Your journey will lead you from ancient cities, across towering mountains, and into wild forests. There is evil stirring in these lands, determined to destroy you and your allies, and it shall turn your challenge into the greatest ordeal you have yet faced. THE WAY OF THE TIGER is the role-playing adventure classic now revised and expanded for today. You choose the skills and martial arts moves to defeat your enemy, gaining knowledge and honing your abilities to use in further books. ARE YOU READY FOR THE WAY OF THE TIGER?

195029.name: Pocket Neon City RUMBLE: Clash of the Gems
195029.description:
From the publisher:

Pocket N30N City RUMBLE (PK NCR) is a light dueling card game that simulates a fight between teams of mutant street fighters. Players use three fighters to perform a wide array of attacks, combos,counters,and super moves to beat the living gems out of their opponents. The match is over when a player has lost all of the gems on his or her fighters. A session consists of three matches, with the winner being the player who won two out of three matches.

195030.name: Fighting Fantasy: Talisman of Death
195030.description:
Fighting Fantasy: Talisman of Death brings the original 16m selling series of Fantasy Role-Playing Gamebooks to PSN for the first time!

The once peaceful world of Orb is in terrible danger. Dark forces are at work to unleash the awesome might of the Evil One. Your mission is to destroy the Talisman of Death before the dark lord's minions reach you. But beware! Time is running out...

This PSN-exclusive version of Fighting Fantasy: Talisman of Death also features a Tarot Card character generation system, and the classic dice-rolling rule set you know and love, with optional all-new Battle and Test Your Luck systems for bold adventurers to explore.

The intuitive Inventory system and an all-new Log Book help you easily track your progress through Orb's magical world, make this the perfect way to relive this classic series.

Go forth, brave adventurer!

Source: The Developer Website.

195031.name: Duæl Invaders
195031.description:
Duæl Invaders is a deliciously retro single-screen shootemup that lets you take control of two ships at once on the same PSP or PS3 controller!

In the depths of deep space a human colony is threatened by the Duæl Invaders; the reddest and bluest badguys ever to threaten a human colony. Star Command knows the only way to destroy red and blue badguys is to deploy red and blue heroes – that's where you (and your buddy) come in...

Using only the power of your red and blue player ships, a few power ups, and a simple-yet-innovative Aggro system called 'Skew', you must take on wave-after-wave of deadly enemies.

You score more points for shooting enemies of the same colour, but this also makes them VERY ANGRY! This simple rule is the key to staying alive and racking up massive high scores.

Throw in cool Dual (Co-op) and Duel (Versus) multiplayer modes that get your buddies involved and you've got an awesome retro-shmup with the weirdest name on the Store! Good luck out there Commander!

Source: The Developer Website.

195032.name: Snow Day!
195032.description:
User summary:

Snow Day! is a rules-light, lighthearted, primarily narrative game. Characters are children exploring an ephemeral winter wonderland that freakishly occurs in Hawaii. Characters are defined by a single Attribute: Age. Action resolution uses a single d20 roll. The game supports two categories of actions - Fantasy Actions and Reality Actions. To succeed on a Fantasy Action, the d20 roll must be equal to or less than Age; to succeed on a Reality Action, the d20 roll must be equal to or greater than Age. Much of the game revolves around the construction of fantasy snow monsters, imbued with fantastic capabilities.

195033.name: The Battle of Frozen Waste
195033.description:
User summary:

The game was published as a series of forum posts to a competition website. Posts were made over several days (interspersed with numerous unrelated posts), which makes locating all of the game slightly difficult.

Characters in the game are all heroes, and they are referred to as "paladins" though such is not a class. Instead, characters belong to an archetype, which is vaguely like a class. Play proceeds with the use of a bag of colored stones that are drawn during action resolution. Characters establish the meaning(s) of the various colors, and this may vary from character to character. Play proceeds in phased turns; the game master is called the "Ambassador".

195034.description:
Description from the publisher:

Stockpile: Continuing Corruption, the first expansion for Stockpile, the critically acclaimed stock market game of insider trading, contains four expansion modules that can be played separately or used all together for more strategic game play.

Module 1: Forecast Dice — Six custom dice offer more excitement by changing the market forecast round-to-round. Roll the dice at the beginning of the round and select the appropriate forecast cards. The dice cause the market to rise or fall on any given turn and ensures that no two games will ever be the same.

Module 2: Bonds — Bond Cards present a new, safe investment option for players. Purchasing bonds can provide a steady stream of interest payments every round. However, it comes at a price. The original money used to purchase bonds cannot be recovered until the end of the game. Be careful not to overspend or you might lose out on valuable stockpiles.

Module 3: Commodities & Taxes — Commodities & Taxes create much more tension during the game. Each round, players add Commodity or Tax Cards face-up to the stockpiles. Collect different types of commodities and dodge taxes to earn substantial end-game bonuses.

Module 4: More Investors — Stockpile: Continuing Corruption adds six new investors from around the world who have heard about massive profits being made, and they want in on the action. Each investor possesses a unique ability that opens up more ways to win.

195035.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game have several unusual abilities, including a near-immunity to permanent death and vast power. Primarily they are opposed by deity-level powers. The action resolution mechanic uses dice pool and and colored tokens (colored candies are suggested). Tokens can be expended to control (to some extent) the narrative outside of dice pools. The game is somewhat structured, with enumerated actions available to characters (typically Create, Possess, Assault, though there are others). Players may create play cards (using index cards) during play; they are used and potentially reused during the game.

195036.name: Sim City & Populous
195036.description:
User Summary

A release of the two most popular and successful simulation / strategy games.

Sim City is a city building simulation game. In Populous, the player builds and controls a whole world.

195037.name: Vietnam: Black Ops
195037.description:
User Summary

Slowly you come to ... in a small bamboo cell. A POW's fate on the inside is certain and escape is the only option. Your survival depends on it.

195038.name: Ace Armstrong vs. the Alien Scumbags!
195038.description:
Help legendary star fighter pilot Ace Armstrong defeat the Scumbag invasion of earth in this modern take on classic old-school shoot-em-ups, with an added 50s Sci-Fi twist and plenty of Scumbag-bursting humour.

Fly Ace through several action-packed levels, each featuring a huge boss with unique attack patterns to defeat!

Use Ace's mighty Recycl-o-Ray to suck up the essence of defeated Scumbags and use their own weapons against them. Can you turn back the Scumbags' tentacled tide of terror?!

Source: The Developer Website.

195039.name: Vibes
195039.description:
Welcome to a brand new era of rhythm! Let Vibes take you on a heart-pounding, button-bashing journey through a huge variety of music tracks.

Your accuracy, timing and finger speed will be taken to the limit in this unique test of rhythm. Follow the pattern of music and chase the big combos and high scores!

Amaze yourself by beating all the difficulty levels which push your fingers to breaking point! Do you have what it takes to become number one?

Source: The Developer Website.

195040.name: Stellar Attack
195040.description:
Stellar Attack expertly blends old-school deep space shoot-em-up action with classic puzzle gameplay. Use your skill and reflexes to destroy chains of coloured orbs and deadly gun turrets.

Eliminate orbs with your coloured lasers to expose the turrets and blow them out of orbit, but avoid the homing missiles and cannon fire that threaten your fragile ship. One missed laser could break your combo in this classic score-chasing action-puzzle game!

Source: The Developer Website.

195041.name: Fuba
195041.description: This game simulates a soccer game. The player who manages to get the ball into the goal of his oppenent wins the game. Movement of the pawns is determined by a die. The moving pawns kick the ball forward and end their movement one space behind the ball. One space can hold more than one pawn and the ball.

195042.name: Cubixx
videogameversion: PSN Downloadable "Cross Buy" edition (PS3/PS Vita PSP)
195042.description:
Use your laser to cut away the surfaces of a mysterious cube and free the energy within. Cutting longer lines and crossing multiple cube surfaces gives you bigger combos, but at far greater risk.

Can you brave this hazardous environment and complete all 20 levels? Old-school, highscore-chasing gameplay with a modern twist.

Do you have what it takes to top the high score table and become number one?

Source: The Developer Website.

195043.description:
The sun is shining in the Abysmal Woods where you’re strolling without a care in the world, your weapon at your belt, dreams of adventure in your head. On your path, you stop before a damaged dungeon door. It seems that great battles took place here, a sure sign of coveted treasure inside.

You recognize this dungeon from the ballads sung in your village! However, you’re not the only one who wants to enter, despite the warnings left around the entrance by the previous adventurers. Will you muster your courage to break open the door or will you let your opponents brave the monsters found inside? Let the adventure begin!

Welcome Back to the Dungeon is a simple and subtle push-your-luck game in which you’ll need to adopt a show of bravado or outwit your opponents!
195043.name: Welcome Back to the Dungeon
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 043 – Essen Part II Expansion Preview
Episode 5: The one about Essen Spiel 2016

195044.name: IceRunner: A Dweomerpunk Fantasy Setting
195044.description:
User summary:

This game was submitted as a series of forum posts to a competition website over the course of several days. Although the name of the game accurately reflects the heavy emphasis on the setting, the posts do provide a complete game mechanic based on multi-colored d6 and d10 rolls. In the game, tokens are used to track "ice", or magical power sources (though this is not required).

Most of the game focuses on the imaginative and complex setting which fuses a gritty medieval Feudalism with exploitative magical power centers - a sort of "cyberpunk" setting without the technology (or rather, with the technology replaced by magic).

195045.name: Thirty Six: 36 Stratagems
195045.description:
Strategy and conquest in Ming Dynasty China

36 stratagems is a game for 2-3 players, which is set in the Ming Dynasty era in China and neighbouring states. You are the leader of one of several rival families aspiring to become emperor of the entire region. You start the game in a capital city, with just an aspiring emperor, a scout and a small army. The aim of the game is to become the dominant dynasty by conquering and maintaining control of capitals, temples and prefectures. Each of these actions will help you in gaining the victory points needed to be the undisputed emperor and win the game. To be successful you will need to manage your budding empire carefully. Manage your economy through taxation and expanding your population, secure stability by maintaining cohesion among the political elite, maintain a strong military through recruitment of units supported by powerful generals and avoid rebellion by gaining popularity with your subjects. You face an uncertain destiny and will encounter many challenges during your reign including plague, piracy and looting. However, you are not alone in your quest, as to help you gain the power you so richly deserve and to undermine your pitiful and unworthy enemies, you can call upon the ancient Chinese wisdom enshrined in the 36 stratagems.

195046.name: Sandy Petersen's Cthulhu Mythos for Pathfinder
195046.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From publisher blurb:

New Rules, Lore, Statistics and Miniatures for Over 100 Cthulhu Mythos Monsters brought to you by Sandy Petersen.

195047.name: Tetris 2 + Bombliss
195047.description:
User Summary

As the title would suggest, the game features both standard Tetris as well as another similar game called Bombliss. Tetris offers three game modes: standard marathon (A-type), start with garbage (B-type), and rising garbage (C-type). There is also a two-player versus mode where clearing rows sends garbage to the other player.

Bombliss is slightly different from normal Tetris. Arranged on the board and in some dropped pieces are bomb squares. Completing a row does not clear the blocks in the row, but will trigger any bombs in the row which will destroy blocks. Different sizes of bombs will generate larger explosions. Bombliss is offered in standard marathon mode, a puzzle mode where a set board must be cleared using set piece drops, and a 2-player versus mode.

195048.name: Feast of the Father
195048.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Adventure for Expert Characters

Feast of the Father is an adventure for expert characters who happen upon Argron’s Dock during their travels. By interacting with the locals, the group learns festivities are to take place, and the townsfolk invite them to participate. Exploring the town and interacting with the unhinged people living her should provide ample warning of the danger lying in wait. The characters complete the adventure when they discover just what is truly going on and unmask the horror lurking behind the god’s mask.

195049.name: Lich
195049.description:
From publisher blurb:

A lich is an undead creature, typically a spell caster of some type that has who has used its magical powers to unnaturally extend its life. But not all lichs are the same.

How old are they? What species are they? Why did they become a lich in the first place?

All these aspects and more are covered in this volume of the CDG. The CDG (Creature Description Generator) range is designed with a fantasy setting in mind, but can easily be used for sci-fi or modern/horror settings.

The aspects covered:

Age - What is the apparent age of the Lich? At what age where they transformed into a member of the undead?
Condition - Lichs can range from being almost living, to virtual skeletons and this aspect gives you a few suggestions as to what that condition may be.
Death - When they became a lich, they had to die or have something similar to death applied to them. How did this occur
Lair - Where does the lich call home? Is it a grand castle or do they dwell in a cave behind a waterfall?
Personality - What sort of personality does the lich have? Are they, for a lich, kind or cruel and uncaring?
Phylactery - The phylactery is one of the hallmarks of a lich as it can house their soul or power source. What is the nature of this vessel?
Reason - Why did they become a lich in the first place? Was it through choice or was this state of undeath forced upon them from an angry god?
Servants & Minions - Does the lich any servants to add it or minion to boss around and do its bidding?
Species - The majority of lichs seem to be human males for some reason, but other species have found the path to lichdom as well, sometimes through choice. What species does the lich belong to?
Quirks & Features - Not all lichs are the same. Many have unique quirks and features that help stand out and be more memorable. Roll once on this table to find out what that can be. It might be something about the lichs phylactery, the fact they are female pretending to be male or something else entirely.

195050.description:
New Year, New Challenge!

Each year the greatest gnome tinkerer, Mastermind, takes on a new apprentice. Becoming this apprentice is a most coveted position, bringing with it the chance to learn skills and techniques that most only dream of; not to mention the prestigious work afterward. You will play as an up-and-coming gnomish tinkerer fighting for your place as Mastermind’s protégé at this year’s competition. Mastermind chooses this apprentice each year by their ability to finish a single task. It will be your job to destroy a Masterbot; a steamwork contraption Mastermind has designed and built to attack your workshop.


Play

Each player receives a game board, a player placard for tracking resources, a gnome character, and a starter bot they can build to help defend their workshop from Masterminds Masterbot.
Players take turns playing their characters and Mastermind. On Mastermind’s turn all the players decide the actions of the Masterbot attacking the player to their left , while the players attempt to defend their workshop from destruction. On the players turn dice are rolled to gather resources. Bots are then bought, scrapped, or built. If a bot has been built, the player then has the option to attack and try to take out Mastermind’s machine.


Objective

Players must succeed in destroying their assigned Masterbot before the competition can destroy theirs. Sounds easy enough, but the other competitors will try to sabotage you at every turn even while trying to destroy their Masterbots.
195050.name: Mastermind's Workshop
boardgamepodcastepisode: Interview Special #8: Tim & Dave (Medieval Interactions - Mastermind's Workshop)

195051.name: Borderland Provinces Players Gazetteer
195051.description:
From publisher blurb:

These are lands where the great tide of an empire is drawing back, leaving its old provinces to fend for themselves but still trying to hold its ancient grip upon them. Unlike the Sundered Kingdoms to the east, the Borderland Provinces are not plunged into chaos — at least, not yet.

It is an eternal truth that gaps left by the slow retreat of a decaying and decadent civilization are inevitably filled; either by young and vigorous new civilizations rising to offer new hopes and aspirations, or by a self-devouring maelstrom of war, pillage, plague, and barbarism. Such times are the knife-edges of history, where the deeds of heroes may shift the course of entire kingdoms. They are times of struggle and fear, times of desperation and wild hopes, times when legends are made.

And these times have arrived.

195052.name: Changeup
195052.description:
From publisher blurb:

He’ll throw the heroes a curve ball… Changeup!

A Power Level 11 Rogue, Changeup is an athlete whose enhancements are definitely not approved by any professional sports league. Changeup is an iconic character in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Changeup’s file is designated “Blue" to identify the technology he employs in his criminal activities. Outfitted with cybernetics and hi-tech weapons that suit his chosen theme of baseball, he is ready to challenge any hero who fancies themselves a skilled athlete. Changeup’s ego won’t let him lose to anyone, even someone with super-powers, and he’ll hold a grudge against anyone who dares to show him up. Heroes who despise the misuse of technology will want to put a stop to Changeup’s crimes, and will also be very interested in tracking down the mysterious source of his strange technology.

195053.name: The Serpentfolk Aspirant (Template)
195053.description:
From publisher blurb:

Known for their mastery over eldritch energies and espionage, serpentfolk find persuasive means to infiltrate nearly any society. As such these enigmatic serpents have ancient arcane means of molding other races into subservience required to further their own agenda. The serpentfolk aspirant is a template that can be used on any humanoid type, representing the serpentfolk's malefic tempation to bring others under their control through the promise of power and prominence. This suppliment includes both the template, spells used by serpentfolk to create these agents and a sample NPC.

195054.name: Feyhall
195054.description:
From publisher blurb:

The residents of Feyhall live barricaded underground within the caverns of an ancient fairy hold in the Fey-Cursed Hills above the Twyll River delta. While the plague infested hungry dead, threaten from without, these rogues and treasure hunters dig deeper looking for the source of the strange lights and music haunting their haven. Food is scarce and what few supplies available are usually stolen from travellers or other nearby settlements. It is a lawless place where residents must be constantly on watch for not only ghosts of dead feyfolk, but also a knife in the back from their so-called allies.

195055.name: Feats of Lashing
195055.description:
From publisher blurb:

The More Feats! PDFs introduce a single page of themed feats for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a full page of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!
Feats of Lashing includes nine new feats for warriors of the whip and chain: Chain Bludgeon, Deadly Snap, Explorer's Whip, Improved Deadly Snap, Lasher's Gambit, Lashing Flourish, Lash Specialization, Slashing Lash, and Snap Steal.

195056.name: QRF70 - Typhoon
195056.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The space craft introduced in this installment of the series is a 70 dT heavy fighter with a mixed missile and beam weapon loadout.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

195057.name: Madame Winter (M&M3)
195057.description:
From publisher blurb:

It was Natasha's dream to become the epitome of the fairytale. She had it all. Money, respect, and a mob boss for a husband. No one knows how she survived the plane crash that killed her dream or gave her fantastic powers. All everyone can agree on is that she has used these new found gifts to cut her way to the top of the crime family her husband once ruled. Beware the icy stare of Madame Winter!

195058.name: The Firebrands (Second Edition)
195058.description:
From publisher blurb:

Flames That Burn Brightly

We are the sparks that incite change, the embers that burn down armies and the blades that cut the strings of corrupt politics. The Ninja Crusade has targeted our kind and we are not the ones to back down. The future is ours to control and will be written in the blood of our enemies.

And Burn with a Righteous Fury

The Firebrands 2nd Edition is the first clanbook for The Ninja Crusade 2nd Edition. Experience the expansive territories, training methods and individual cultures of the Fire-Aspected clans: The Blazing Dancers, who live the dance of fire, and the Virtuous Body Gardeners with their fiery-tempered blades. All the secrets await within for the Izou Empire’s youngest clans.

This Book Includes:

Learn about all facets of clan life directly from prominent Dancers and Inks
New clan-specific, elemental and general jutsu, Fighting Styles and even Celestial Animals
Three new clans that work beside the firebrands: The Gracious Illustrators, The Grey Tigers and the Winds of Aion.
New Adventure included
9 new Pregenerated characters ready to jump into the action!

195060.name: Infinite Threats 04
195060.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a few alien critters to kill off in your Infinite Futures Games? Are your players bored with blasting droids and robots? Avalon is offering you new threats for your team to encounter, where each menace is a fully detailed creature, usable as part of the Fringe setting or in any game you are running.

Explore the danger of space with new threat expansions released for the Infinite Futures system.

195062.name: Trials of the Spider Witch
195062.description:
From publisher blurb:

In TRIALS OF THE SPIDER WITCH the characters are asked to investigate a haunted tower and bridge lost during the Border Wars to determine the fate of it's legendary commander. whiel the tower holds it's own perils, something even more sinister waits for them under the bridge in the depths of Darkdeep Chasm. Will the characters surive?

195063.name: Divine Hunters
195063.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deities, taken as a group, value their followers like a devil values souls. That is, followers are essentially currency and power for those with the divine spark. Unfortunately for most deities, followers possess free will; nothing gets in the way more of the best-laid plans. Most times when a true believer strays, a simple atonement spell — typically coupled with a suitable quest — is enough to steer things back toward the deity’s favor. Sometimes, though, the offense is so severe an atonement spell just isn’t enough. Some offenses are so severe, so drastic, that forgiveness is nigh impossible. The only recourse in these circumstances is to dole out swift and severe punishment. Most of the time, deities are loath to interact directly with mortals. To handle these special circumstances, they have an unusual breed of hunters called the nel’barzoth. Divine Hunters presents four new monsters, including a CR 22 mythic version, to hunt your infidels; it also presents the GM with rules for creating new versions.

195064.name: Horses of the Wild
195064.description:
From publisher blurb:

While most overland travelers only need use of a generic light or heavy horse as described in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook, some players might have use for a more exciting animal in their adventures. One that needs protection from theft or destruction. More expensive, yes, but well worth the extra coin. The equines included feature a wide variety of bonuses for a multitude of needs as the player desires. Other riders may want to learn new tricks to make their mounted combat shine. For there are bandits on nearly every road and the wilderness is full of dark and terrible creatures. Having a way to incorporate the mount in battle enables the character to shine.

195065.name: Ecology of the Troll
195065.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ecology of the Troll takes an in-depth look at this creature of myth and legend, proffering its potential genesis, special physiology, and psychology. New feats, equipment, and alchemical items aid characters in their hunt against the regenerating giants, along with combat strategies so characters can exit the fight victorious. The GM, too, has new options: G'Mash the Troll King, complete with background, custom magic items, and a full stat block.

195066.name: Ecology of the Basilisk
195066.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ecology of the Basilisk takes an in-depth look at this creature of legend, proffering its potential genesis, special physiology, and psychology. New spells, feats, and magic items aid characters in their hunt against the stone-creating lizards, along with suggestions on how to use existing feats and spells to the player's advantage. The GM, too, has new options, including an advanced mythic basilisk and rules for a naturally awakened basilisk — a new monstrous class progress that awakens the basilisk, giving it frightening intellect and allowing the GM to challenge her players in new ways.

195067.name: Town of Glory
195067.description:
From publisher blurb:

Grand Duke Iltobarus has taken a sudden interest in the Windreft, a remote area of dangerous wilderness made accessible by resolution of the civil war that has raged for decades in the Westmarches of Reme. He has granted lands and charter to a small group of settlers—good, loyal Remen everyone—to establish a new town there. These settlers will face danger, so the grand duke has called for brave and clever protectors to watch over the new town as it grows. That’s you.

To keep the town safe, you’ll have to be on constant watch for enemies, and there are many in the Windreft. Orc tribes control much of the nearby foothills, hobgoblins camp in the north, boggards infest the waterwoods across the river, gnolls hunt in the open plains, and trolls sometimes wander down from the Green Mountains. And if some scholars are correct, Glory sits right above a mythical subterranean world called the Kingdom Beneath.

The Town of Glory presents a new rules mini-system for building and growing frontier communities, giving players and GMs multiple options to add onto their existing game play.

195068.name: The Portalist
195068.description:
From publisher blurb:

On a battlefield where positioning is key, the portalist is king. By uncovering the secrets of leaping through hidden tears in the fabric of reality the portalist changes the rules by which ordinary melee is fought. Part warrior and part planar sage, the portalist keeps himself lightly armored and lightly armed, maximizing his ability to move in ways previously thought impossible. A true rarity, some portalists form a secret order dedicated to the mysteries of dimensional travel, while others are loners who study the secrets of teleportation on their own. Individual portalists are as different as the style of portals they create. Many are flashy, travelling through inter-dimensional wormholes with a cacophony of thunder and lightning, while others silently slip in and out of the world through tiny fissures near-invisible to the untrained eye.

195069.name: The Headhunter
195069.description:
From publisher blurb:

Headhunters are warriors who decapitate their foes — during or shortly after combat — and carry their heads as visible proof of their triumph. Some headhunters, the greatest among them, can trap a little of their victims’ essence in their heads, and can use it to replicate their foes’ unusual capabilities. Included in this product are a new prestige class, three archetypes, a new oracle mystery, and a magic item to protect the wary from having their head removed.

rpg: Fantasy Ice Breaker: The Dragon's Lair
195070.name: Fantasy Ice Breaker: The Dragon's Lair
195070.description:
User summary:

This rules-light game is intended as a storytelling mechanic for a single session, presumably to be used as an "ice breaker" at a party. Players generate a series of cards that are shuffled and subsequently flipped over to drive the narrative. Play is timed, and proceeds in turns of narration. There is no opposed action method - play passes to the next player who may elaborate as appropriate.

195071.name: Sing4: The Hits Edition
195071.description:
User summary:

Sing4: The Hits Edition is a simple singing game from Voxler Games and the now-defunct Crave Entertainment. Featuring 40 songs and videos from different artists, the game allows for 1-4 players to score points in various modes such as Practice, Duet, and Battle and also includes optional voice-changing effects. Retail copies of the game come packaged with a Logitech USB microphone.

195072.name: The Fall of Atlantis and the Dawn of Human History
rpg: The Fall of Atlantis and the Dawn of Human History
195072.description:
User summary:

The game is played in turns, each of which encompasses one year. During play an overall value (the Ice Value) rises by one point, leading inexorably to the collapse of Atlantis. Turns are played in five defined phases. Because of the length of game time in the turns, characters - powerful enough on a daily basis - are assumed to be able to accomplish quite a bit during every turn. Action resolution uses an action table and dice pools. The game has a traditional roleplaying feel but curious and intriguing mechanics.

195073.description:
The labyrinth in the magic garden is constantly changing. By clever rotating the magical hedges, players open new paths to mysterious creatures and precious treasures. Magic cards help to fulfill the tasks. Who masters the turns and finds his way out of the magic garden first?

A new twist at the changing labyrinth. This time, the paths are bordered by hedges, which can be rotated to change the paths.

Each player has a stack of cards that direct him to various places in the labyrinth. In his turn, the player moves his pawn along the path; he may also rotate one hedge before, during or after his move. If he reaches his current target, he turns his next target card face up. Otherwise, he gets a magic card as consolation.

The magic cards can be used during a players turn to aid movement. A hole allows to slip through a hedge. Two fairies allow to fly from one fairy spot to another one, ignoring the terrain in between. A player may use any number of magic cards in his turn.

After a player has visited the targets on his six cards, the other players decide which exit he needs to reach to win the game.
195073.name: Das verdrehte Labyrinth

195074.name: The Brotherhood (2004)
195074.description:
User summary:

This game, submitted in several posts to an online competition forum, is a fusion of a particular setting with a fairly lightweight rules system. The setting is a typical fantasy world, but one in which good has lost and evil triumphed. But the evil has subsequently become listless and without energy, yielding an overwhelmingly negative but banal existence. The characters - members of The Brotherhood adventure within this setting. Characters have basic attributes and several spell-like powers. Action resolution uses a d6 minus a d6, yielding a -5 to +5 spread that compares to a target difficulty. The dice must be of identified colors.

The game is ambitious and includes a brief bestiary and some advice for game masters. However, the rules are fairly subtle and probably would require an experience game master.

195075.name: The Culling
videogamehonor: 2016 Global Game Awards Best Survival Game of the Year Nominee
195075.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

In a remote island paradise, 16 contestants have 20 minutes to explore, scavenge items, craft weapons, build traps, hunt and kill each other.

195076.name: Barely Balanced
195076.description:
Barely Balanced is a quick game of daredevil antics and reckless stupidity in which you try to create an acrobatic show that would strike fear into the hearts of insurance adjusters everywhere.

Game play - Each round players start with a hand of 6 cards. The goal is to play tricks using the cards in their hand. Players my trade cards from the table or draw more cards from the deck. The player to play all their cards take the round, but all the tricks played by everyone are scored. Once a single player has taken 3 round the game ends. The player who has scored the most points over the course of the total rounds wins the game.

Game play was influenced by French Tarot and Japaneses Hanafuda and other classic card games.

The Barely Balanced card game is based on the Comedic/Acrobatic stunt show Barely Balanced.

Barely Balanced game was designed as promotional product for the group by designer Max Holliday. Max had been a fan of the acrobatic group for a few years, and while watching a show at the Bristal Ren Fair came up with the game. He proposed the game as soon as the show ended.

195077.name: Fear Fetchers
195077.description:
Fear Fetchers is a relatively simple d6-based role playing game where the players are Monsters who are out to gather fear by Scaring humans.

Most of the players will take on the role of Monsters: creations of darkness designed only to be spectacularly eerie. One of the players however will be the Monster Master, the evil S.O.B. that represents the monstrous overlords, the Scare-victims and everyone or everything else the players might encounter.

At its core Fear Fetchers is designed to be humorous. If at the end of the evening you’ve had a couple of good laughs about what happened at the gaming table, Fear Fetchers has done what it was designed to do. It’s possible to make the game dark and gritty, but that is up to the Monster Master.

source: "About" section from the PDF

195078.name: The Peanuts Movie: Snoopy's Grand Adventure
195078.description:
The Peanuts Movie: Snoopy's Grand Adventure is a side-scrolling platform video game based on The Peanuts Movie. The game launched on November 3, 2015 in North America, and November 6, 2015 in Europe for the Nintendo 3DS, PlayStation 4, Wii U, Xbox 360, and Xbox One. It was distributed by Fox Digital Entertainment, published by Activision and developed by Behaviour Interactive.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Peanuts Movie: Snoopy's Grand Adventure", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195080.name: WWF "Attitude in Review" Game
195080.description:
From the back of the box:

Take your knowledge to the mat with this fascinating trivia game about wrestling! Young people can play with the old "pros"... Everybody wins! - But there is only one champion!

800 World Wrestling Federation Trivia Questions. Go for that World Wrestling Federation Championship belt... Flaunt your knowledge... Display your acting talents... Pin you Opponents! Create your own "Dream Team".

At the end of the tournament - Claim the "Prize" (The best spot in front of the TV?) - Until the next match.

195081.name: Into the Woods
195081.description:
From the cover:

Three Low-Level Adventures for Mazes & Minotaurs

From the pages of the Minotaur webzine

195082.name: Tales of the Middle Sea
195082.description:
From the cover:

Four Maritime Adventures for Mazes & Minotaurs

From the pages of the Minotaur webzine

195083.name: More Tales of the Middle Sea
rpgseries: More Tales of the Middle Sea
195083.description:
From the cover:

Three Adventures for Mazes & Minotaurs

From the pages of the Minotaur webzine

195084.name: Against Atlantis!
195084.description:
From the cover:

An Epic Trilogy of Heroic Adventures for Mazes & Minotaurs

First published in issues 2-4 of the Minotaur webzine

195086.description: Click Clack Lumberjack Playmat helps players organize who has collected which pieces during the game. Only one is required to play the game. Dimensions are 20 x 20 x 0.25 inches.
195086.name: Click Clack Lumberjack: Playmat

195087.name: Agarest: Generations of War 2
195087.description:
THE THIRD INSTALMENT IN THE THRILLING AGAREST SERIES!

Following the huge successes of the number 1 Steam top selling epic SRPG, Agarest: Generations of War and its prequel Agarest: Generations of War ZERO, Ghostlight are proud to release the massively updated sequel to the series, Agarest: Generations Of War 2!

This sequel was previously only available on PlayStation® 3 but now comes to STEAM bringing with it a host of new features, visual improvements and an enticing blend of in-depth strategy and multi-generational storytelling!

Agarest: Generations of War 2 is set in a parallel world to the previous two Agarest titles and has a completely new multi generational story and universe to explore. So while existing fans of the series will of course see some familiar features and faces popping up, newer players will not need to have played the previous games to understand and enjoy this instalment of the story.

...One day, the world was enveloped by a mysterious blinding light causing terrible destruction. The central continent, from where the light is believed to have originated, fell silent and slowly, demons began to emerge and spread throughout the world like a plague.

Sometime afterwards, a young man by the name of Weiss, suffering from amnesia, encounters the enigmatic Eva who tells him that he has committed the sin of deicide. In order to atone for his crime he learns that he must become the "Vessel" in which the power of the divinity he slaughtered is to be stored. This power will be used to resurrect the one whose life Weiss stole, for those who betray the divine will pay for their sins in the space which separates salvation and damnation, as will their progeny...

New Agarest Universe: Roam freely and watch the story unfold in this newly designed Universe and battle colossal enemies in over 80hrs of compelling gameplay!
Revamped Battle System: Engage your ultimate warriors in a new faster paced combat system with real tactical depth and a wealth of character customisation.
HD Graphics: Enjoy the all-new environments, CGs and your favourite animated character portraits in stunning high-definition.
Mini-games: Engage in Bathtub, Shiatsu, and Massage mini-games!
Soul Breeding Returns: See your favourite heroines evolve over several decades through each passing generation.
Choose Your Path: It's not just the heroines you unite with but also the choices you make that will significantly change the outcome of the story.

Source: The Publisher Website.

195088.description:
Leprechauns Disle Dubh (Black Dice) Expansion adds a bit of light headedness and passing out to your game of Leprechauns. Just add the single black die to your game bag and have a laugh when your opponent is rudely interrupted.

Disle Dubh adds one 6 sided dice to your game of Leprechauns. Two of the faces on the die have new game rules. One called Pass out which stops the players turn immediately and Light Headed which causes a player to start his turn over.
195088.name: Leprechauns: Disle Dubh

195089.name: Legends of the Mist
195089.description:
Description from the publisher:

Amallian was an amazing kingdom, with lush forests, amazing coasts, cuddly martial artists, and the best Emperor known. The one downside of living there was the constant infighting of the clans. They not only disagreed about the way the empire was built, but the way they traded with their neighbors, too.

The clans didn't agree on much, but the Emperor decreed that there was to be no open fighting amongst them. This "peace" lasted for many years. Then came the storm of all storms. Sweeping many clans away, the Emperor was lost for solutions — but then in the Osae Valley, a mist had appeared, and those who entered it were transported to a new land. The Emperor decreed that all clans should venture forth and settle their new empire.

As they did, the oversight was little to none...which lead to the clans competing for the favor of the Emperor by any means necessary. Now the clans of Amallian race to win the favor of the Emperor by building her Empire, trading goods, and showing the most strength on the other side!

In Legends of the Mist, you take on the role of a legend from one of the four clans. By rolling dice from your pool, you can work to build the Emperor's new kingdom with new plots, fight to control them, produce goods from them, and gain wealth for your clan and the kingdom. Each die type has a different frequency of letting you perform these actions. The other clans will work to undermine you every now and again and since dice are assigned in secret, your planning and foresight are important.

Should you complete the objectives that the Empress gave you better than anyone else, you will be rewarded as the winner of her favor!

195090.name: Chanter (2004)
195090.description:
From the introduction:

All-that-is is not like our world - it is world rich in magic and teleology. Here things fall to earth not because they are drawn by Gravity, but because that is the place they are meant to be, the plants grow by their own magic, and the Sun hangs in the centre of the world because that is its place. All-that-is is shaped like the inside of an egg, its inhabitants can see the ground curve up and away from them. The year in All-that-is is defined by the procession of the sun - every 320 days it traces out a circle in a plane through the fattest part of the egg - and in its procession it brings seasons to the lands of the bulge, colder as the sun moves away, warmer as it returns. While the wide end of the world basks eternally in a continual and barely changing heat and the narrow end is unchanging in its cold and ice.

User summary:

This game is the winner of the Game Chef 2004 competition.

195091.name: Dilmun, the Islands of Dawn: Assault of the Black Ice
195091.description:
From the introduction:

Once upon a time, the islands of Dilmun were a paradise. Lying at the uttermost East, they basked in the life-giving light of the Dawn.

Then the Black Ice came. No one knows where they came from. Mysterious, insectoid creatures, they spread unearthly, chilling Black Ice as they assualted the islands of Dilmun. Paradise turned to war as the human inhabitants of Dilmun fought back, rising from their peaceful ways and forming armies.

But it was no use. The armies of Dilmun were decimated by the Black Ice. Green verdure ran red with blood.

You are among the last of those armies. It is up to you and your companions to stop the Black Ice before the green paradise of Dilmun is turned forever into a blackened, icy waste.

195092.name: Snow From Korea
195092.description:
User summary:

The game has a defined scope of encounters, determined prior to the campaign beginning. The game suggests ten or more encounters for a traditional game. Characters are all samurai that have three Facets (Attributes): Awar, Kenjutsu, and Tanka. Each Facet has a numeric value, distributed from a point pool. This represents the dice pool associated with that Facet. Opposed actions utilize opposed dice pool rolls where successes are counted and compared.

The game has an interesting structure of basic rules augmented by several optional rules, allowing groups to utilize as much or as little rules complexity as desired. The game was published in a series of forum posts, but a final "gathered" post puts all the pieces together with some clarifications and better flow. Additionally, the game subsequently was published in formatted HTML on the author's personal site (no longer extant).

195093.name: Whispering Fury
195093.description:
A Melodramatic Exalted-to-Wushu Conversion

From the introduction:

For those of you already familiar with Exalted, be unalarmed. This conversion doesn't do anything strange to the setting, though it makes some tweaks and adjustments. The idea is to get the Exalted setting to jive with [the] exciting [Wushu] game engine. So, none of the style and concepts are changed, though they are reinterpreted a little, just enough to keep things flowing.

User summary:

This product is a fan-produced adaptation of the Exalted setting to the Wushu Open mechanics.

195094.description:
Merchants of Medieval Europe
Game by Alex Fiks; Art Design by Daniel Chou; Published by CHOU! Games; Ages 12+; Players 3-6; Game Time 45-120 min.

Parts List: 130 coin pieces, 128 game cards, 35 white, 35 green, 25 black, 25 orange, 20 blue, 20 purple, 15 red, 15 yellow cubes, 8 colored discs, 6 pawns, 6 quarter mats, 1 manual.

Introduction
Become a poor merchant traveling across a section of Western Europe trying to make your living buying and selling regional goods for the best price at the whims of the fluctuating market.
Earn gold, borrow funds from the Merchant Bank of Europe, and accept contracts from wealthy nobles for rare goods from across the continent.
Can you bask in the glow of the most gold? Build a merchant house that will last for eternity, admired by princes and princesses while your merchant rivals suffer in silence surrounded by pestilence and disease for generations to come!

Gameplay
A Round
Every round has two phases. Phases are linear. A round ends when every player has taken a turn.
Market Phase
1. The first player flips a market card and places it on top of the market discard deck.
2. Players adjust the market good trackers to their new values dictated by the drawn market card.
Action Phase
1. The first player begins their turn and takes up to four actions.
2. Play continues clockwise until every player completes their turn.

A Turn
A player can take up to four actions per turn in any order and can repeat an action any number of times until they run out of actions.
A. Move their token: A player can move their token from a region to an adjacent region. Their token can be upgraded to move
farther for a one-time fee.
B. Accept a Contract: A player can accept a contract by drawing two cards and choosing one from the top of the contract deck. Its details can be kept secret or made public. Contracts can’t be discarded until completed.
C. Buy: A player can buy as many goods as they can afford from the resources stockpile, so long as they are in a region that sells the desired good and the good is in stock. Purchased goods are placed on the player’s cart/wagon mat.
D. Sell / Fulfill a Contract: From any region, a player can sell any number of goods back to the stockpile for their current market value as dictated by the Perimeter Market. Alternatively, they can fulfill a contract by selling a designated number of goods to a designated region, according to the contract card, at their current value plus a bonus as indicated by the contract.

Additionally, the following decisions do not expend an action and can be done during a player's turn at any time:
1. Upgrading from a cart to a wagon.
2. Incurring or paying back bank debt.
195094.name: Merchants of Medieval Europe

195095.name: Hellfrost Action Deck
195095.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Add a whole new dimension to your Hellfrost games!

The hellfrost Action Deck has been designed with all new artwork and includes rune effects which will enhance your Savage Worlds driven Hellfrost games!

The Hellfrost Action Deck includes 54 cards with all new artwork designed by Chris Kuhlman.

Grab your deck today and start your adventure in the frozen lands of Hellfrost!

195096.name: Minotaur (Issue 12 - Mar 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Another Twist in the Maze: Forging Your Own Legend
Maze Master’s Lore: The Whole Wider World
Mythika Gazetteer: Kandaria, City of Dreams
A Twist in the Maze: The Third Gender
Variant Classes: Bring on the Beastmen!
195096.description:
From publisher blurb:

This final issue includes a detailed gazetteer of Kandaria, the City of Dreams (and thieves), the Assassin class, fascinating background material on the history and cosmology of Mythika, new creatures, new mythic items, plenty of optional rules (including Beastmen character classes!) and two complete adventures!

195097.name: Frankenstein's Monster
195097.description:
From publisher blurb:

Frankenstein's Monster was created by Victor Frankenstein as an experiment in the creation of life. The monster itself is nameless; Frankenstein never saw fit to name his creation, and the monster's lack of identity is a source of despair for it.

8 feet tall, with yellow skin, the monster was hideously ugly. The towering, grotesque figure was shunned by all who see him.

Upon creating his monster, Frankenstein fled from it in horror and disavowed it. The monster was forced to wander the wilderness and eke out a meagre existence. During this time it managed to educate itself - no mere golem, this, the monster became eloquent and well-mannered.

195098.name: Merlin
195098.description:
From publisher blurb:

Merlin Ambrosius, adviser to King Arthur, sired by an incubus, is said to be wizard, druid, priest, prophet, bard, and madman.

Merlin was not a man of combat, although he certainly had the powers to punish those who would attack him - he could enchant his foes, cause them to sleep, summon the aid of dragons, and raise a deep fog; however, he was not one for flashy fireballs or bolts of magical energy. He saw his role as one of advice and influence, aiding King Arthur time and time again.

195099.name: Sarutobi Sasuke
195099.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sarutobi Sasuke was a legendary ninja; his name, "Sarutobi", means "Monkey Jump", and he was famous for his agility and speed. Orphaned as a child, and raised by a tribe of monkeys, Sasuke developed incredibly acrobatic skills, able to climb and jump like his adopted monkey siblings.

Later in life, Sasuke became leader of the infamous Sanada Ten Braves, a group of ten Koga ninjas who assisted the warlord Sanada Yukimara in many great battles. His arch-rival was the Iga ninja Kirigakure Saizo, an elegant man accomplished in the arts of magic.

A master ninja, Sasuke was accomplished in all of the techniques of the art of ninjutsu. He was able to walk on water, turn invisible, disappear in a cloud of smoke, survive falls from great heights, and was expert in the use of the ninja-to short sword and the metsubishi blinding-powder. He was a master of stealth, endurance, and acrobatics.

Sasuke fell in battle during the Siege of Osaka.

195100.name: Archangel Michael
195100.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Archangel Michael is the commander of God's armies; he led the heavenly host against Satan's forces during his rebellion. The patron saint of many who value chivalry, Michael's primordial feats of arms are glorified as "the first deed of knighthood and chivalrous prowess that was ever achieved".

A prince of light, Michael is described as the "viceroy of heaven"; the title that formerly belonged to Satan. Although furious in battle, Michael is the angel of forbearance and mercy, and presides over human virtue. Myth states that Michael, along with Gabriel, Raphael, and Phanuel, will be strengthened during the Battle of Armageddon.

195101.name: United Human Front Affiliation Guide
195101.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everyone thinks about the United Human Front (UHF) as some sort of domestic terrorist organization hell-bent on killing AMPs. The truth, however, is much more difficult. While there are outliers in the mix, the vast majority of UHF members are simple folk who want to make sure their world is not taken from them. The UHF will stop at nothing to keep humanity as the dominant species on Earth... even going so far as generic tampering. Affiliation Guide: United Human Front will give you to lowdown on whether you could be a part of the group or not.

Includes:

What is is like to be member of the UHF?
Learn what the UHF stands for and how far they are willing to go for humanity
New Character: Monet
New UHF-Only Power: Genetic Tampering
Complete adventure: Dark or Light

195102.name: Universal Adventures Treasure Pack II
195102.description:
From publisher blurb:

The glint of gold and silver comes from a mound of cobweb-covered bones and debris.

Through dark dungeons full of dangerous monsters and deadly traps your intrepid adventurers are prepared to journey in search of wealth and glory! Treasure Pack II brings you 9 Treasure cards you can use to reward your characters during their grueling adventures. Although designed to be used with mid-level Adventure Modules, such as The Blood Howlers of Black Willow Gorge or The Beast of Blackstone Tomb, these Treasure cards can be used during any adventure you choose. Add some new treasures to your fantasy adventure games with this bonus pack of Treasure cards.

195103.name: Rune Lords 6
195103.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seven Spectacular Mythic Monsters for your AP!

Mythic Module Monsters: Rune Lords 6 brings you mythic versions of all six monsters in the bestiary section of issue #5 in the official Rune Lords AP:

denizen of Leng
lamia, harridan (template)
lamia, hungerer
lamia-kin, kuchrima
rune giant
scarlet walker
wendigo




The Mythic Monster Manual and Mythic Monsters series from Legendary Games have greatly expanded the number of mythic monsters available for use in Pathfinder campaigns of any kind, but if you want to add a bit of mythic mayhem to the classic adventure paths produced by Paizo, Inc., the Mythic Module Monsters series is designed just for you! Rather than having to hunt through multiple books trying to find the odd monster here or there to enhance your adventure path experience, you'll find the monsters introduced in that AP right here, ready to pick up exactly the issues you need to enhance the mythic monsters in your favorite adventure! You can pick them up a few at a time or collect an entire series for your favorite AP!

195104.name: Monopoly: Kraków
195104.description:
Version of Monopoly - Kraków Edition.

The game uses all of the rules and values (prices, tax), money and pawns from the standard Monopoly game.

Changes:
- Names of places to buy (properties, utilities) were changes to the know places in Kraków
- Board is lustrated with photos from the city
- Community chest & chance cards have city related flavor texts

Extra:
- The game contains one Top Trumps card - Wawel Royal Castle

195105.name: Quests of Doom (Swords & Wizardry)
195105.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quests of Doom is an adventure book of 18 adventures and over 250 pages of old-school goodness. Along with updates from our third edition books (Demons & Devils, Vampires & Liches) we've collected some of the best authors in the business to add 12 more adventures to those initial 6 — 4 new categories of 3 adventures each — "Bugs and Blobs", “Giants and Dragons,” “Men and Monstrosities,” and “Elementals and Lycanthropes.”

195106.name: Cardboard Heroes: Dungeon Floors
195106.description:
Publisher Blurb:

107 Full-Color Rooms And Corridors With 124 Assorted Pits, Doors, Walls, Shafts, And Other Subterranean Architectural Paraphernalia Dungeon For Sale! Cheap! Make your games more visual and exciting! Fill your table with dungeon rooms and corridors . . . at a bargain price. The Cardboard Heroes Dungeon Floors are marked off with both square and hex grids, so they'll work with any game system. Infinite layouts, infinite dangers.

195107.name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 – Spitfire Mk. IX
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War
boardgameversion: Wings of Glory: World War 2: Spitfire Mk. IX: Beurling
Wings of Glory: World War 2: Spitfire Mk. IX: Johnson
Wings of Glory: World War 2: Spitfire Mk. IX: Skalski
195107.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Spitfire Mk. IX was designed and developed to compete with the Focke Wulf FW-190 which in some regards could out-perform and out-climb previous Spitfire versions. The Mark IX was based on the Mark V airframe with the addition of the new generation of Merlin engines allowed this aircraft to duel with the deadly German enemy. Great Aces that gloriously piloted this aircraft included George "The Falcon of Malta" Beurling, Johnnie Johnson and Stanisław Skalski. Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW2 Wings of Glory Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW2 Wings of Glory game product.
