In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards. Larger maneuver cards (63 x 88 mm) are included with this model, to handle the fast movement of this airplane.

195108.description:
H.E.A.D. Hunters is a card-driven miniatures game for two or more players. Each player controls their own 5.25" Hero of Every Age & Dimension (H.E.A.D.) Hunter Toy that stores all the components of the game in its head. Inside each H.E.A.D. Hunter is its own themed deck of cards, battle bases, measuring string and combat dice.

The starter pack includes Erik Thanessen (Viking) & Xeno X9 (Robot). Cards from other H.E.A.D. Hunters can be mixed and matched to customize the player's deck, matching their own play style.

Each character has a unique set of starting terrain as part of their deck that can be placed in a multitude of positions and layouts to create unlimited fields of battle. Once these are placed, the players draw and play cards to attack and defend against other Hunters as they move their toy around the table for position and opportunity; where you attack from is as important as what you attack with!

Game play continues until one Hunter is left standing, but be warned: As players take and inflict damage, unique character abilities are enabled which can turn the tide of the game. When the game is over, all the components fit back inside the head while the toy sits patiently (and attractively) on your shelf, waiting for its next opponent.
195108.name: H.E.A.D. Hunters: Starter Pack
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 025 – Gen Con 2016
GenCon Night 3
Strange Assembly 189 - H.E.A.D. Hunters
Strange Assembly 192 - Live From GenCon 2016

195109.name: Castle Bridge
195109.description:
From the box:

The original Five Suit Game.

Official American Rules for Five Suit Castle Bridge.

Originated 1933 by Ammiel F. Decker

195110.name: Einer freut sich immer
195110.description:
Each player has a set of four pawns that start in his or her side of the board. The goal is to move the pawns around the board to the "Ziel" section. Movement is determined by a die. All players move clockwise around the same board, so they may capture each others pawns. Whenever a pawn arrives on a space as the result of a die-roll, it advances by the number of spaces shown on that space. If a pawn arrives on a red space, it advances into an inner ring. The pawns have to circle the innermost ring, till they manage to enter their "Ziel" section. Captured pawns are returned to their player's "Start" section. The winner is the first player to move all pawns into the "Ziel" section.
This game was published about 1930.

195111.description:
Description from the publisher:

Elections of US America Election: The Card Game brings together the best snark of political website Wonkette with the game design smarts of game developer Auroch Digital’s ‘GameTheNews’ initiative to create the greatest social card game in political history, mostly because it’s the FIRST ONE IN HISTORY TOO! (Maybe.)

You as the player take on the role of a campaign manager backing a candidate(past, present or fictional). Each turn you have a choice, go for votes or play a Wonk card. Wonk cards will either up your candidate's Independant, Republican and/or Democrat appeal, or damage your opponents.

The player with the most voter points at the end of the round wins the state. Each state card has electoral college votes, to win a short game you need to be the first player to reach 70 electoral college votes with at least 4 state cards, or go for the long haul you need to be the first to 270 electoral college votes.
So, will you play fair and hope winning over the voters will get your candidate into the White House or sling mud like the best of them and go down fighting?
195111.name: Elections of US America Election: The Card Game

195112.name: Tales of the Rays
195112.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

The newest mobile Tales of game.

195113.name: Faithless and Forgotten, Part 2: Lost Colony of Taldor
195113.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1-5.

The Society’s excavations continue, now taking the PCs to the long-contested territory of Kharijite—Cheliax’s southernmost territory, where the great Arch of Aroden bridges the Hespereth Strait and establishes an Avistani foothold in Rahadoum’s backyard. There, an ancient Taldan ruin suggests that empire’s great Armies of Exploration traveled even farther than believed possible. Can the PCs uncover the site’s secrets—and in doing so reshape the Inner Sea region’s history?

“Lost Colony of Taldor” is the second scenario in the three-part Faithless and Forgotten campaign arc. It is preceded by Pathfinder Society Scenario #7–14: “Let Bygones Be” and followed by Pathfinder Society Scenarios #7–18: “The Infernal Inheritance.” All three chapters are intended to be played in order.

Written by Kalervo Oikarinen, RPG Superstar 2015 finalist.

195114.description:
From the publisher:

WizArt is a strategy card game for 2-3 players where you try to acquire knowledge from 3 different magic schools (the cosmic, the elemental or the temporal) in order to graduate as a mage faster than your opponents. To win the game, you must play cards and invest knowledge crystals. If you played well, you will then be able to level up at the beginning of your turn and acquire more power. Depending on the cards that you play, you will be able to use crystals of your opponents. If you reach mage level 5 or if you have eliminated all other players, you win.

WizArt is an exciting strategy card game with a lot of player interaction which is easy to learn but hard to master. It takes about 30 minutes to play and is suitable for players who are 8 years or older.
195114.name: WizArt

195115.name: Ecken-Schreck!
195115.description:
The players have to move their pawn from the starting point to one of the yellow or red spaces in the center of the game board. The red and yellow dice determine movement on the game track, while the green symbol die controls movement on the checkered center section by one or two spaces each turn. The results of the yellow and red dice are translated by each player's dice result card. Possible outcomes are forward movement (V), backward movement (Z) or no movement at all (Symbol).

The Corner spaces have the following meanings:
V - move forward to the next red triangle
Z - move backward to the last yellow triangle
Symbol - miss your next turn
black spot - return to the black starting space

The game was likely published in the 1920s.

195116.name: Cthulhus Ruf (Issue 8 - Nov 2015)
195116.description:
(user summary)
table of content:
preface
Die Vereinsseite
Die Flüstertüte
Summ, Bienchen, Summ! - A Cthulhu Now Adventure
Der Maschinenkönig - A Gaslight Adventure
End times - The Reaping
Geheimnis der Elemente - on natural medicine in teh 1920s
Hashima - a tale of terror
Stillgelegt - a crime scene for Cthulhu Now
NSC of the issue: the bottle collector

195117.name: OneDice B Movies
195117.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quick and easy role-playing in the world of low quality cinema

OneDice B Movies is a role-playing game set in the world of B Movie cinema. Vanquish the giant monster that is trashing your neighbourhood! Confront Nazis from outer space! Escape the clutches of the Eggplantosaurus! Meet the terrible Teenage Succubus! Marvel at the 50 foot Nurse! Tremble at the giant bees from beyond!

OneDice B Movies is great for one-shot adventures in the world of terrible movies. But you can also take on the role of a B Movie actor, appearing again and again in films you’re rather embarrassed about. Will you ever win an Oscar?

Contains everything you need to play, including plenty of B Movie “scripts” to get you going.

195118.name: Cthulhus Ruf Archiv (Issue 8  - Nov 2015)  - Das Reich des Maschinenkönigs
195118.description:
(user summary)
This was published alongside the regular issue 8.
It offers more information on the Machine King, a Gaslight entity.

195119.name: Traveller Core Rulebook
195119.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is Free Trader Beowulf, calling anyone...
Mayday, Mayday...We are under attack...
Main drive is gone...Turret number one not responding...
Mayday...Losing cabin pressure fast calling anyone...
Please help...This is Free Trader Beowulf...

...Mayday...

A brand new edition of Traveller is now available - based on the original but tweaked, finessed and updated through a massive months-long beta playtest by you, the players!

Traveller is a science fiction roleplaying game of bold explorers and brave adventurers. The Traveller Core Rulebook contains everything you need to create one of these adventurers and begin exploring the galaxy.

Spaceports, ancient civilisations, air/rafts, cold steel blades, laser carbines, far distant worlds, and exotic alien beasts – this is the futuristic universe of Traveller, the original and classic science fiction roleplaying game.

Come visit the future.

195120.name: Marches Adventure 1: High and Dry
195120.description:
From publisher blurb:

In High and Dry the Travellers are given a ship in which they can explore the galaxy for the rest of the campaign – the only catch is that they have to find it first.

Travelling to the quiet world of Walston, the Travellers will have to engage with the locals, locate their ship and repair it before they can return home. However, the ship has been left in the crater of a volcano, and there have been tremors rocking the surrounding area for quite some time…

High and Dry is the perfect introductory adventure for Traveller, full of exploration, character interaction and a truly explosive finale!

195121.name: Marooned on Marduk
195121.description:
From publisher blurb:

Set in the Sindal Subsector featured in the recently released Traveller Core Rulebook, Marooned on Marduk is the perfect introduction to the Trojan Reach and the new edition of Traveller.

The Travellers' shuttle to Marduk is damaged during an attack by raiders, forcing it to crash-land far from civilisation. With night falling and little prospect of immediate rescue the Travellers will be forced to seek shelter in nearby ruins, where they discover they are not alone.

If the Travellers can just survive one night on Marduk, rescue will surely come. At worst they face a three-way fight for survival… or perhaps they can befriend the xenophobic survivors and team up against the raiders.

What might the outcome of such an alliance be?

195122.name: X-17
195122.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Fight your way through an Alien Invasion.

195123.name: Traveller Referee's Screen
195123.description:
From publisher blurb:

With a stunning ship's cockpit facing the players, and every vital table for the referee, the Traveller Referee’s Screen is the perfect complement to a well-run Traveller campaign.

Fully updated to the latest edition and with all the important tables and charts, the new Traveller Referee’s Screen provides everything a busy referee needs at his fingertips!

195124.name: Hybrid Class: Shifu
195124.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hadoken!

In conjunction with d20PFSRD.com and Rogue Genius Games, the Four Horsemen created a new hybrid class designed to combine the monk's discipline and unarmed mastery, with the kineticist's power over the elements. The shifu has dozens of elemental strikes, infusions, and ki disciplines she can learn to make her unarmed attacks much more than just "improved!"

195125.name: Judgement
195125.description:
From publisher blurb:

Right. Wrong. I'm the One with the Gun.

Judge John Warden, a tough sentencer and enemy of organized crime, was made an example of when he sent several heads of mafia clans to prison for the maximum time. His family was slaughtered in front of him, and he was beaten, tossed in the river, and left for dead. When he emerged from the waters, consumed with bitterness and rage, he soon became something criminals began to fear. He became the final Judgement (PL 9)!

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

195126.name: Paper Sumo
195126.description:
From the publisher:

Ready, set, sumo! Japan's centuries-old national sport is the main attraction in this paper-based smackdown where creativity and competition collide. The result? Laughs guaranteed! There is an impressive assortment of 39 characters—from traditional sumo wrestlers to animals to monsters and other eye-catching creatures from Japanese lore. Additional characters can be created by drawing on customizable shapes. Then battle it out against an opponent's character on the sumo doyho ring. With each player tapping on his or her side of the doyho, the stakes are high until one of the characters falls and the other wins!

195127.name: La Sentinelle
195127.description:
User Summary

La Sentinelle is a scenario for Into the Dark

It is meant to be played in 4h by a party of 3 to 5 players.
The PCs are sent to investigate an extra-terrestrial signal into the end of known space. What happen next isn't really what they are expecting.

195128.name: At the Dawn (2004)
195128.description:
User summary:

This game presents a "legendary" setting of a time of legend and great power. Characters are the elves of mythology, possessed of nearly god-like powers. Characters have nine Virtues (roughly like Attributes), including: Truth, Honor, Loyalty, Discipline, Kindness, Industry, Responsibility, and Perseverance. Virtues have a numeric rating from 1-5, as well as a "Color" (a complex narrative element). The Virtue ratings are used as dice modifiers during conflict resolution which uses a modified d10.

195129.name: Hans im Glück
195129.description: Each player has to move his 16 meeples from his starting positions around the game board and over his launching pad (the five spaces of his own color) to the blue "luck" space at the center of the game board. Movement is done one space along the black lines or by jumping over other meeples, regardles if they're own or opponent ones. Each meeple reaching it's own launching pad, immediately goes to the "luck" space and is taken out of the game. The first player to get all his meeples on the "luck" space wins the game.

195130.name: Super Sharp
195130.description:
In Super Sharp, the player’s finger can cut anything! The goal is to use this power with skill to hit the targets. Although the number of cuts is not limited, solving a level under the minimum number of slices is rewarded by a star. Stars are used to unlock new levels.

We created 120 fun and challenging levels (8 worlds of 15 levels). They are based on several interesting elements such as ropes, motors, pins, or even inverted gravity.

Super Sharp is available on the App Store for $1.99 / €1.99 / £1.49. There is an optional In-App purchase to unlock worlds in case the player cannot get enough stars.

Source: The Developer Website.

195131.name: Broken Vows: The Dawn of the Final Judgement
rpg: Broken Vows: The Dawn of the Final Judgement
195131.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are recently deceased, living in the "hereafter". When alive, they were not particularly good people and the premise is they are heading to the final judgement and then to some version of purgatory or hell (the game has a distinctly Christian eschatology). But they don't want to miss out on the joys of heaven and thus attempt to cheat their way to a better outcome. Character creation focuses on narrative aspects of the characters' previous lives. The game uses a complex mechanic of paired die rolls compared to the mean value for the die pair; various results may impinge on future events through the use of future modifiers.

195132.name: Children of the North: Assault on the Frozen Isle of the Lich-Lord
rpg: Children of the North: Assault on the Frozen Isle of the Lich-Lord
195132.description:
User summary:

Characters in this rules-light game are defined by a concise narrative statement. They also have a single Attribute with a value from 1-10, selected by player fiat. This Attribute describes the character's "evil vs. good" axis, with a 1 being a "very good" character and a 10 being a "very evil" character, but one not so evil as to be reviled by the other characters. Action resolution uses a single d10 roll with results varying for characters depending on their Attribute and the type of action they are attempting. The game master determines whether the action is good or evil or somewhere in between.

The game is intended to explore the nature of good vs. evil, though it provides no suggestion of what might be meant by these terms. The game does use a credible mechanism for assembling the adventuring party from disparate individuals who may be antipathetic to each other.

195134.name: Ganakagok: Dawn Breaks Upon the Island of Ice
195134.description:
User summary:

This version of the game was submitted to the Game Chef competition in 2004 where it received a "runner up" award. The game subsequently was revised and commercially published. This early version uses several action resolution options that allow character to avoid failure - if they're willing to pay a price.

During the game posts and competition period the game name was offered in a few different formats - all capitals, or without the subtitle. The final post uses the full name noted here.

195135.description:
Description from the publisher:

Ancient Rivals is the first Force Pack in the Opposition cycle for Star Wars: The Card Game.

Throughout the Galactic Civil War, certain feuds and rivalries have defined countless conflicts. The Jedi battle the Sith lords, playing out the age-old struggle between the light and dark sides of the Force. The armies and navies of the Rebels and the Empire clash on planets and in the skies above them. The galaxy’s smugglers and spies struggle for supremacy against the scum that lurk in the shadows. These dynamic rivalries have shaped the Galactic Civil War, and now, with the the Opposition cycle, they will take their rightful place in Star Wars: The Card Game as well.

Ancient Rivals kicks off the Opposition cycle and simultaneously serves as an introduction to the new themes and mechanics that will be found therein. Here, you will find a host of cards that focus on the struggles between pairs of affiliations: Jedi and Sith, Rebel Alliance and Imperial Navy, Smugglers and Spies and Scum and Villainy. The Opposition cycle also introduces a host of new fate cards, including a new type—fate cards with an affiliation. Ancient Rivals also offers up a host of iconic characters: the heroes and villains of Star Wars: Rebels begin to appear in the LCG, joined by new versions of classic characters like Dengar, Han Solo, and Darth Vader. Immerse yourself in the epic conflicts and battles of the Galactic Civil War in the Opposition cycle, beginning with Ancient Rivals!
195135.name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Ancient Rivals
boardgamefamily: Star Wars: The Card Game LCG

195136.name: The Dance and the Dawn (2004)
195136.description:
User summary:

This version of the game was submitted to the Game Chef competition on the online forum. It received a "runner up" status in the competition and subsequently was reworked and commercially published. This original version is like the commercial version in general tone and mechanics, varying primarily in organization and being rougher in presentation. Also, it was published without art or substantive formatting.

195137.description:
Catacombs is an award-winning, cooperative board game set in the fantasy world of Cimathue, and you need skill and dexterity to master this fast-paced game.

One player (the Overseer) marshals an army of monsters while the others choose from six brave heroes who embark on a quest to save the town of Stormtryne from the threat lurking in the catacombs below. As the heroes explore, they must use their abilities, buy items, and recruit allies to help them defeat the monsters before facing the powerful Catacomb Lord, thereby saving the town.

In more detail, in Catacombs players flick wooden discs that represent the monsters and heroes. Contact with an opposing piece inflicts damage, while missiles, spells, and other special abilities can cause other effects. When all of the monsters of a room have been cleared, the heroes can move further into the catacomb.

Items and equipment upgrades can be purchased from the Merchant with gold taken from fallen monsters. The Catacomb Lord is the final danger that the heroes must defeat to win the game. Conversely, the Overseer wins if all of the heroes are defeated.

This third edition of Catacombs has all-new artwork compared to the earlier editions, but more importantly the keywords from the first two editions has been replace with iconography, the terminology has changed, and the third edition has new shot types, new card effects, and a different set of components (many of which have changed statistics) as well as wall pieces not present in earlier editions.
195137.name: Catacombs (third edition)
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 5 - Safranito & Catacombs 3rd Ed
Episode 38 :: Haspelknecht Review + Academy Games Interview
Episode 4 - A New Hope (Gen Con Preview)
Episode 69 - Brew Crafters
The Good The Board and The Seriously, I’m running out of material here: Episode 91 “Reimplementations”

195138.name: Oltréé!
195138.description:
User Summary

Oltréé! is a French medieval Fantasy RPG. It is designed to be a sandbox game where the PC patrol the land and the player collaboratively helps at the world building with the GM.

With a rule system meant to give an old school feel, Oltréé! provides modern tools for narrative story telling where the players take part into the world building experience.

This is the core set. Comes as a bundle that contains:
-144 pages booklet for the main rules
-36 booklet for the player
-1 screen
-1 folder with a map
-108 cards

Content is in French.

195139.name: The Sinking City
195139.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




“We live on a placid island of ignorance in the midst of black seas of the infinity, and it was not meant that we should voyage far.”
— H.P. Lovecraft, “The Call of Cthulhu and Other Weird Stories”

The Sinking City is a game of investigation genre taking place in a fictional open world inspired by the works of H.P. Lovecraft.
The player incarnates a private investigator in 1920s, who finds himself in a city of New England, Oakmont Massachusetts. It’s currently suffering from extensive waterflood, and its cause is clearly supernatural. The city trembles on the brink of madness.
Can you investigate this beleaguered town and untangle the tragic extent of its failings or will you be driven beyond madness yourself?

Source: The Developer Website.

195140.name: Le Compagnon
195140.description:
User Summary

Le Compagnon is a companion sourcebook for Oltréé!, a French medieval Fantasy RPG. It is designed to be a sandbox game where the PC patrol the land and the player collaboratively helps at the world building with the GM.

This book contains rules clarification, rules for the PCs fort, some factions, and rules to manage or create them. Also it offers new environments for playing, like urban, the abyss, the sea, each with their rules. Port épice (Spice port) conclude the book as a city for an urban setting ready to play in.

The soft cover book include 36 new cards.

Content is in French.

195141.name: Monster Hunter Academy
195141.description:
A monstrous board game encouraging kids & families to have imaginative fun with game play imaginative interaction!

A classic dungeon setting is the backdrop as players assume the roles of tough hunters bound and determined to do three things: to defeat as many monsters as possible, to collect treasure, and to make it out unscathed.

Players become bona fide monster hunters as they delve into dungeons filled with beasts and obstacles. At the beginning of each session, players choose one of three game modes in which they will compete. Treasure Hunt, Monster Hunt, or Dungeon Escape.

At the beginning of each session, players choose one of three game modes in which they will compete:

Treasure Hunt – Be the first to get to the treasure

Monster Hunt – Defeat all the monsters on the board, player with the most captured wins

Dungeon Escape – Be the first player to get to the finish exit

Up to 4 boards can be arranged in numerous ways based on the number of players. Obstacle tiles including corridors, pits, locked doors, and secret doors are added to the boards. The number depends on the game mode being played. Monsters are then added to the board.

Each player rolls a d10 for movement through squares that make up the dungeon boards. When they get to obstacles they must make an extra roll to get past them. Sometimes loosing a turn, or having to turn around and find another path. When players encounter monsters they must reference the Monster's card to see how to defeat them. Examples are an opposing roll of the the die, rolling an odd number, rolling 7 or higher.

195142.name: Clash Royale
videogamehonor: 2016 Global Game Awards Best Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2017 British Academy Game Awards Audience Choice Award Winner
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Cellular/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2017 SXSW Best Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
195142.description:
Enter the Arena! From the creators of Clash of Clans comes a real-time multiplayer game starring the Royales, your favorite Clash characters and much, much more.

Collect and upgrade dozens of cards featuring the Clash of Clans troops, spells and defenses you know and love, as well as the Royales: Princes, Knights, Baby Dragons and more. Knock the enemy King and Princesses from their towers to defeat your opponents and win Trophies, Crowns and glory in the Arena. Form a Clan to share cards and build your very own battle community.

Lead the Clash Royale Family to victory!

Source: The Game Website.

195143.name: Dawn of the Day of the Monsters
rpg: Dawn of the Day of the Monsters
195143.description:
User summary:

This game is very rules-light, featuring no dice and no actual resolution mechanic beyond narrative solutions. The game supposes the bulk of narrative creation will be performed by the players, while the game master will be limited to the role of "enforcing reality". Within this limit, the rules set is complete with numerous examples of play, a reasonably complete equipment list and even a usable bestiary.

195144.name: Dawnstorm
195144.description:
User summary:

In the game, one player assumes the role of "Albraxas," a defined creature, and the other players have more traditional characters. Albraxas uses different rules than the remaining characters; additionally, Albraxas is the opponent of the remaining characters. The role of Albraxas should not be confused with the role of a game master.

Characters have three Attributes: Backbone, Battle, and Blitz. These each have a numeric value distributed from a points pool; the value indicates the size of the dice pool associated with the Attribute. Play proceeds in turns and phases, with defined moves being available to players.

195145.name: Sherlock Holmes: The Devil's Daughter
videogamehonor: 2016 Global Game Awards Best Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
195145.description:
There'll be five new cases and an 'expansive landscape' you can freely roam around.

Source: The Developer Website.

195146.name: Here There Be Tiny Dragons
195146.description:
From the introduction:

Letters from the Flaming Crab is a monthly series of Pathfinder-compatible supplements. Each Letter focuses on exploring a different topic to give gamemasters and players new, exciting options that can be dropped into any campaign.

In this volume of Letters from the Flaming Crab you'll find new variations of the pseudodragon, faerie dragon, and tidepool dragon as well as new character options (for both characters and familiars) and a new type of wondrous magic item known as a dragonstone.

195147.name: Pesadelo: Regressão
195147.description:
User Summary

A cemetery filled with hostile creatures. A church that will not save you.

195148.name: Hiveswap
195148.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Based in the universe of his MS Paint Adventures web comic Homestuck, it will focus on a girl who is accidentally transported to the planet of Alternia—home of the troll species seen in Homestuck. It will be the first of two games, with a second, future installment featuring a male troll who was swapped onto Earth in her place.

The game was the subject of a crowdfunding campaign on Kickstarter, raising over US$2.4 million in funding. While development initially began with developers The Odd Gentlemen, it was eventually moved back in-house under What Pumpkin's own newly formed game development studio.

Act I was slated for release in Mid-2015, however this release date was delayed indefinitely.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hiveswap", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195149.name: DETHRONED: The Real-Time Combat Card Game
195149.description:
DETHRONED is what happens when a game developer is forced to play too much Mafia. DETHRONED takes the hidden-role genre and makes it faster, giving the power to kill in YOUR HANDS.

Simple enough for parties, meta enough for board game geeks.

A dynamic card game fusing Real-Time combat with the hidden-role genre.

No turns. No waiting. Just lies and murder!

DETHRONED, the whole game is a set that comes with 2 decks:
-Traitors and Kings & Guards and Thieves-

Each with their own theme, unique art, and lore. They can be played completely independently up to 4, OR together for up to 8 player chaos and fun!

Players first begin by going around the table claiming a role. Depending on the role you secretly got will help determine if you should lie about your role, though you never have to. After that, players continue discussing until 2 players vote to begin combat.

Once combat begins, players may attack each other at any point in time, until someone dies. Every time someone dies, combat is paused and a vote to end the game goes up. All living players must unanimously vote to end and to not vote yes, you have to attack another player, if you cannot then you're forced to vote yes to end. The game can only end in a stalemate (players reveal hands to prove such) OR after a player has died.

Once the game ends, roles are revealed and winners are determined based on the role's win conditions.

boardgameimplementation: The Hobbit: Motion Picture Trilogy – There and Back Again
195151.description:
From the publisher:

The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug provides a wealth of supplemental rules, which recreate the thrilling events of the film on the tabletop with your collection of Citadel miniatures. This 64-page, full colour, softback expansion for The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey includes:


8 brand new scenarios recreating the action-packed events in The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug.
Rules for linking your games with Thorin’s Company into a dynamic narrative.
Rules for fighting in the realm of Mirkwood, and 3 new Points Match Scenarios.
A gallery showcasing several hobbyists’ collections of Citadel miniatures, inspired by the warriors of Middle-earth and the events of the movies.
An ‘Eavy Metal masterclass of Gandalf™ the Grey.
Profiles and rules for the Good and Evil miniatures in The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug.
195151.name: The Hobbit: the Desolation of Smaug Strategy Battle Game

boardgameimplementation: The Hobbit: Motion Picture Trilogy – There and Back Again
195152.description:
The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey Strategy Battle Game is the tabletop game for two or more players. This free PDF expansion is packed with supplemental rules which enable you to recreate the thrilling events of The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies™ with your collection of Citadel miniatures.

This expansion includes two exciting new scenarios that recreate the pivotal events of The Hobbit: The Battle of Five Armies, allowing you to join in the adventure as Thorin’s Company concludes its quest to reclaim Erebor.

This PDF includes profiles and rules for a host of new Citadel miniatures allowing you to play games with our favorite heroes and villains from The Hobbit: The Battle of Five Armies, from the great and terrible dragon, Smaug, to the mighty heroes of the Free Peoples that form the heart of the White Council.

The updated army lists enable you to field the warring hosts that fought in the climactic Battle of Five Armies on the tabletop, from the valiant survivors of Smaug’s attack on Lake-town to the majestic Elven host led by Thranduil, King of Mirkwood.
195152.name: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies Strategy Battle Game

195153.name: The Dwarven Delve
195153.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Tweak & Toss "adventure" is a rather simple set-up/problem for the party to deal with. The design is deliberately vague in several areas to make it easy to integrate with your current campaign. Perfect for when the party goes "left" when you expected them to go "right", any GM/DM/Judge can easily drop this into the current campaign.

The idea behind this Tweak & Toss is that the local region has experience some sort of tremor or earthquake. A group of traders has not been able to rendevouz with their Dwarven & Elven counterparts and would like the party to track them down.

195154.name: The Amalgam
195154.description:
From publisher blurb:

Long ago, Centurion and the Raven were simultaneously exposed to the Human Duplicator’s Doppelganger-Ray Gun. The result was the super-powerful being known as the Amalgam. With the powers of Centurion and the cunning of the Raven, the Amalgam suffers bouts of dim-witted confusion that make him one of the most dangerous beings on the planet.

195155.name: Loma Slife
195155.description:
From publisher blurb:

Intergalactic bounty hunter and all-around troublemaker, Loma Slife stirs things up wherever and whenever she shows up. She’s violent, prideful, and loves to find and claim new technology--especially weapons--to use when hunting down whoever (or whatever) she’s been hired to bring in!

195156.name: The Waxman
195156.description:
From publisher blurb:

Waxman has the ability to sculpt his own flesh just like he does his beloved wax sculptures! More than that, his touch allows him to sculpt or melt the flesh of anyone he chooses. Now a mad outcast, Waxman preys on the living in order to give him raw material for his wax creations.

195157.name: Cybertronic Source Book
195157.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stealth and Steel

The youngest and smallest of the corporations, Cybertronic is less than a century old. Few know much about this enigmatic, technologically advanced new player on the scene, but few doubt how quickly it has made a place for itself in the new order of the Solar System.

Cybertronic’s methods are secretive, but highly efficient, and many do not trust this newcomer, for it dabbles in technologies that were banned long ago…

Human Resources: What kind of person would embrace Cybertronic? Discover the mysterious structure and culture of the Fifth Corporation, and the employees that work within it… both human and machine.
Secret Origins: Uncover the secrets of Cybertronic’s founding, and the hidden purpose of the corporation.
Technology: Explore the sophisticated technology of Cybertronic, which allows their employees to be both more – and less – than human.
Character Creation: Expanded rules for the backgrounds and professions unique to Cybertronic, as well as options for AI and Neoclone characters.

195158.description:
Fight the Dead, Fight the Living

Fight to survive in the abandoned streets of a post-apocalyptic world infested by unnatural creatures hungry for your flesh.

Scavenge for scarce supplies whilst battling against the dead and the living alike; there are no laws, there are no rules, only the fight.

Project Z is a skirmish wargame for 1 to 3 players taking control of Survivors or a Street Gang fighting to survive against the environment and an ever-growing horde of Zombies. Project Z is a fast and easy to learn game containing 39 detailed self-assembly plastic models, rules, counters and specially designed dice and cards.
195158.name: Project Z: The Zombie Miniatures Game

195159.name: Conversions to 5th Edition D&D
195159.description:
From Introduction:

This document provides guidelines for converting characters and adventures from earlier editions of Dungeons & Dragons to the fifth edition.

Conversion of D&D material is more art than science. The aim of conversion is to arrive at something that feels like the older-edition version, rather than at an exact replication. The guidelines in this document are intended to help you create what you want, not to force your choices along particular lines

195160.name: Pathfinder Map Pack: Marsh Trails
195160.description:
Publisher blurb:

Don't Follow the Lights!

Will-o'-wisps beckon the unwary to wander swampy labyrinths until the bones of previous travelers drag them down into the muddy depths. When adventurers venture into a soggy fen, the Game Master shouldn't have to draw every tree root and mossy embankment. This Pathfinder Map Pack provides beautifully illustrated 5" × 8" map tiles that can be combined into a variety of islands and wetland paths. Inside, you'll find 18 richly crafted map tiles, including:

- Boggy Crossroads
- Backwater Island
- Embankment
- Eroded Path
- Mossy Curve
- Sediment Crescent

Game Masters shouldn't waste their time sketching maps whenever characters explore a treacherous marsh. With Pathfinder Map Pack: Marsh Trails, you'll always have dangers ready if the adventurers step off solid ground!

195161.name: Rooster Rush
195161.description: Rooster Rush — first released as Gaijin Dash! — is a party game in which players need to cross multi-lane roadways and avoid oncoming vehicles. Observation, risk-taking, and speed are the three skills you need in order to keep out of the hospital!

195162.description:
Plague Inc: The Board Game is a strategic game of infection, evolution and extinction for 1-5* people - based on the smash-hit digital game with over 85 million players. Can you infect the world?

Each player is a deadly disease and they must battle against each other to spread their plagues, develop new symptoms and ultimately wipe out humanity.

Starting with Patient Zero, you spread your infection across the world by placing tokens in cities - earning DNA points and preventing other players from becoming dominant. Players choose which countries are placed on the board but you must be both climate resistant and connected to a country before you can infect it. Eventually, as countries become fully infected - you try to kill them using the Death Dice.

Each player’s unique pathogen can be upgraded by evolving trait cards onto an evolution slide (with DNA points). At the start, your disease is weak and unspecialised, so you will need to add new symptoms to make it stronger. Choose carefully and plan ahead in order to react to the changing world and exploit opportunities created by other player’s actions.

A simple nosebleed could accelerate things early on, whilst diarrhea will help you thrive in hot countries. Sneezing can infect new continents by air but Total Organ Failure would allow you wipe out multiple countries each turn.

As countries start to fall, use powerful event cards to alter the balance of power. You might try to eradicate a dominant player by bombing their diseased cities, or hold the Olympics to cause huge numbers of infected people to travel to a healthy continent.

When the world collapses, who will be the ultimate plague?


*5 players with 5th player expansion
195162.name: Plague Inc.: The Board Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: 10. Devon Dice are joined Christoph from Meeples' Corner shop
30. Devon Dice podcast: Not Too Busy To Play Games
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 019 – 10 Reasons to Buy a Game

195163.name: Trick of Spy
195163.description: Trick of Spy is a trick-taking game in which the player spies try to identify the only face-down card in the game.

195164.name: Test Drive II: The Collection
videogamecompilation: California Challenge: Test Drive II Scenery Disk
The Supercars: Test Drive II Car Disk
Test Drive II Car Disk: The Muscle Cars
Test Drive II Scenery Disk: European Challenge
195164.description:
User Summary

Test Drive II: The Collection is a compilation of Test Drive II: The Duel and all (four) released add-ons:

Musclecars
Supercars
Californian Challenge
European Challenge

195165.name: Saami
195165.description: Saami is a semi-cooperative game in which players need to eliminate threats while trying to improve their own personal position in the game.

195166.name: Torchbearer (2003)
195166.description:
From the introduction:

Torchbearer, besides being a specific game with a setting, is a simple, flexible System that can be used for many different kinds of games. The next two Chapters describe the System in its entirety. Where I have described several different rule-options, the one that the default Torchbearer game uses will be listed
first.

User summary:

The rules set presented in this product is exceptionally difficult and recommended only for quite experience players. Nearly every rule is optional, and most rules have a few variants. Action resolution uses a complex mechanic based on levels of difficulty (a very simple Action Table, similar in concept to Fudge difficulty levels) compared to dice pool rolls using specialized dice (standard d6 can be used instead, however).

195167.name: A Slight Mistake: Players Book
195167.description:
User summary:

The Players Book provides a basic setting overview and rules for character creation. Characters have a complex variety of Attributes, placed into Attribute Groups. Characters also have Skills that can be improved through play. The game suggests characters select a type (roughly like a class in concept) to help define which Skills should be selected together, but this is not enforced by the rules. Skills are placed into Skill Groups though these primarily are organizational and not restrictive. Characters may also have a variety of feats, talents, and flaws (Traits) - including some which confer magical abilities.

The remainder of the volume includes the game mechanics, which are based on percentile rolls. The game is quite detailed with numerous rules for various special circumstances. There is a heavy focus on combat and the clear intent is to involve the characters in frequent person-to-person combat, highly favored over other styles of combat available in science fiction settings. Equipment lists, for example, include things like daggers and bows.

195168.name: A Slight Mistake: GM's Guide
195168.description:
User summary:

The GM's Guide recapitulates the basic game rules and provides extensive information on magical spells that may be available. Several character builds are provided. The bulk of the product, however, details the setting of the vast Dyson Sphere in which the game takes place (including several maps).

The product occasionally refers to the game as A Slight Mistake in the Code though usually uses only A Slight Mistake.

195169.name: Under the Overpass
195169.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 16 x 30 inch Battlemap of a space Under an Overpass , it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“We don’t know anything. Please just leave us alone.”—Paul

Under the Overpass is an exterior map of two support walls and nine columns for a highway above, a railway in the east, and an area in the west with three couches and a bed that are used by the homeless to sleep with the highway above sheltering them from the rain.

Under the Overpass is intended for use in modern or post-apocalyptic games (the scattered debris on the map gives it a ruined feel). It could even be a down on their luck superhero’s hideout.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

The People under the Overpass: A local gang has lost a drug shipment. Supposedly it was lost on a rail route. The gangers traced the drug shipment’s path by backtracking along the railway. They found a small community of homeless people next to the railway under the overpass. They questioned them, but they didn’t have any answers. The gang members didn’t like that and proceeded to beat on the spokesman of the homeless, Paul.

John, a member of the homeless community has an uncanny knack for knowing when the trains were coming. Almost like an internal clock. When Paul was attacked he threw himself at the gang members and tossed them on the railway into the way of an oncoming train. The result was two dead gang members and a call from the train operator to the police about the accident.

The player characters arrive on the scene as local law enforcement such as police or detectives. They are here to question the homeless. However, when he sees the cops, Paul runs for it. The gangers are angry about the death of their members and send a hit squad to kill the bums which arrive shortly after the cops chase after Paul or start their initial questioning of the homeless witnesses…

195170.name: World of Conan
195170.description:
From the designer's website:

Conan hack for Vincent Baker’s excellent game “Apocalypse World”

195171.name: A Slight Mistake: Character Sheet
195171.description:
User summary:

The Character Sheet is implemented in Microsoft Excel as a workbook. It provides color-coded cells for data entry and uses a variety of formulas to calculate derived values. The workbook does not use macros or code. It features several sheets but unfortunately does not have a print function (individual sheets must be printed via Excel).

195172.name: Schnell ins Nest
195172.description: The players have to move their four cubes from the diagonaly opposite corner to the nest of their color. Movement to a neighboring space is achieved by tilting the cube by 90 degree, thereby changing the Image on the top of the cube. The movement can be continued in a straight line as Long as thre are unoccupied spaces. If two cubes are sitting next to or pass each other, the stronger image kills the weeker one (hunter - Fox - weasel - chicken - frog - gnat). The strongest Image is the hunter but he can be killed by the weakest, which is the gnat. Killed cubes are removed from the game. Cubes that have entered their own nest must show the correct animal on top to be saved. A saved animal counts 3 points and the cubes on the board of the last player count 2 points at the end of the game.

195173.name: Paper Quest
195173.description:
User summary:

Paper Quest is a rules-light storytelling game that uses a structured approach to generating an open-ended narrative. Traditionally, game play does not utilize a game master (though if the group prefers, one can be used). The action is driven by cards and resolution can be settled by the use of a simple dice roll. While any type of story can be told using the system, probably most will have some type of fairytale or fantastic qualities emerge.

One interesting aspect of the game allows for optional items to replace the pack of French playing cards as the narrative driver - noted options include dice, rune stones, Legos, "boogers", or even rocks.

195174.name: Extreme Assault
videogamedeveloper: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
videogamepublisher: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
195174.description:
Players would first choose a pilot (difficulty) to be as, and then attempt to complete a set of missions in an operation area. The number of operations the player could do, depended on the difficulty, with the higher difficulties having more access; the number of operation areas in the game total around six. Each mission is often introduced by briefing with the player given information about what to expect, or what to destroy. Each operation area has a boss at the end that the player has to overcome.

During the course of the game, the player can find power-ups, ranging from ammo for the main guns, ammo for secondary weapons, or energy for the Sioux/T1's shields, and even pick up an extra gun for both vehicles' main weapons. Weapons range from a fast hitting "Razor" gun, a laser cannon, missiles, smart bombs, and more. Enemies ranged from helicopters, tanks, rocket buggies, flying robots, and stationary guns. Environments that the player deals with include wide open valleys, a volcanic island, a massive underground base, and the ice fields of Greenland complete with an alien city. The player often operates from the cockpit of the vehicle they are in, but can look around or even switch to 3rd person view.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extreme_Assault Extreme Assault]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195176.name: Patchwork (2015)
195176.description:
From the introduction:

The three games in this collection grew out of different interests and odd turns taken by conversations with friends. Pilgrimage has multiple roots, ranging from The Canterbury Tales to a battered copy of James White’s Dream Millennium my parents picked up for me at a yard sale when I was a kid to chats with Johanna Haas about doodling and Silas de Marques Lima about games and therapy. Pine Grove owes its origins to Facebook and the radically different ways in which old friends remember our hometown. Saturday Knights is an ode to the attic in an old Victorian house where we played games when I was in high school, and the strange temptations and distractions that lurked beyond the game.

195177.name: Pathwork II (2016)
195177.description:
From the introduction:

As I was putting together these games I realized that in different ways each one deals with memory. Fall Lineup grew out of nostalgia. When we were kids we loved gimmicky shows like Automan and Small Wonder. Previews for Manimal captured our imaginations; my best friend was so terrified by them that he couldn’t go into a dark room for a month. A year or two ago we were talking about some of the shows and I realized that even though I could easily find clips online that seeing them again might ruin my memories of them.

The House of Unusual Size explores lost memories. Inspired by Gaston Bachelard’s The Poetics of Space, a version of the game originally appeared as part of the 2013 National Game Design Month 24-Hour RPG competition. Johanna Haas provided editorial and moral support when this came together during Thanksgiving, and the folks at Gaia House in Carbondale, Illinois, gave invaluable advice. Silas Marques de Lima deserves special praise for introducing the game to group therapy sessions for teens in São Paolo. His descriptions of their experiences inspired me to revisit the game.

Pen in Hand deals with a form of personal and social memory that evolved into a source for historians. I used to work as the director of a nineteenth-century house museum, and while doing research and reviews and I ran into repeated references to the autograph books kept by young women. The ways in which people used the books—and particularly the ways girls and young women used secret books to mark levels of connection—has fascinated me ever since.

195178.name: Cabell Manor
195178.description:
User summary:

Cabell Manor presents a rules-light haunted house adventure. No game master is used; the players take turns creating a shared narrative experience. Play proceeds in turns. During each turn a player rolls the dice and narrates a segment of the adventure depending on the roll. Players also draw cards (from a custom deck) and respond to the events on the cards. The composition of the deck changes during game phases.

Note the card deck itself is provided as a print-and-play component of the game (and makes up the bulk of the document).

195179.description:
Shiba Inu loves sitting on the roof, staring at the sea, imagining that his master will make him a new dog house, imagining that there will be pork chops for lunch. Wait! Did someone just say pork chops? Shiba Inu is now drooling and jumping up and down on his roof...

In Shiba Inu House, players race to place cards properly in order to create doghouses for the shiba inu that match the patterns shown on their goal cards. After eight rounds, the player with the highest score wins.
195179.name: Shiba Inu House
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 96- Railroad Revolution

195180.description:
Deep in the Pocket Universe, the balance of power is shifting. Seventeen newly discovered planets are being colonized and tapped for crucial resources. Shifting alliances and stacks of galactic credits influence battles for control. Can you claim universal rule in this 4x wallet game from Button Shy?

In Universal Rule, players battle for control of the universe in this pocket-sized 4X style game. You can colonize new planets, explore new areas on those planets, gain credits based off of the resources that the planet produces, or attempt to destroy other planets that threaten your existence. Other players can follow, but at a cost. The first player to show their true dominance through victory points wins the game.
195180.name: Universal Rule
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 38 :: Haspelknecht Review + Academy Games Interview

195181.name: Divide
195181.description:
Divide is a character-driven, science fiction action/adventure game with a modern take on isometric adventures of the past. Search for clues that reveal new insight into the story, interact with fully realized characters, and combat enemies by hacking out of sight, or launching a direct assault.

Source: The Developer Website.

195182.description:
In the game of Fantasy Stables you're trying to make it in the horse business. Your friends will now be your rivals as you compete to see who will end up on top. The object of the game is to collect the most money in cash, horse value and bonuses. Bonuses are awarded for collecting certain groups of horses. They add another level of strategy to the game. Game play is very easy and intuitive for horse people but no horse knowledge is needed to play.

Everyone begins the game with money and horses to start the fun right away. There are several suggested winning scenarios for you to choose from for one hour of play to days of fun. All the turns are cooperative but competitive to keep things lively!

Collect and show horse cards featuring fabulous pictures of real horses in 8 equestrian sports (Dressage, Driving, Trail, Western Pleasure, Western Performance, Racing, Cross Country and Hunter Jumper).

Add horses to your stable at public auctions where everyone can bid. Bid as high as you dare – you know the range but the horse’s actual value is kept a secret until the winning bid has been paid!
Everyone can enter the shows and choosing the right horse will give you an advantage but anyone could steal the win if luck is on their side.

There are random and yearly horse expenses to watch out for so manage your salary and show winnings well. All the players get a real-life horse job (vet, farrier, trainer etc.) who are paid the expenses to keep those interactive too!

Horses are unpredictable so you never know what will be around the corner – wins or losses!
195182.name: Fantasy Stables: Regular Edition

195185.name: Avalon Newsletter (Vol 2, Issue 7 - Mar 2016)
195185.description:
Avalon Newsletter
Volume 2, Issue 7
March 2016

Note the first page repeats the same article and most of the same design elements as Volume 2, Issue 6.

195186.name: Bird of Happiness
195186.description: Bird of Happiness is a simple deck-building game in which players try to collect happy birds, some of which will provide special help to the players. Watch for the four-leaf clover as well since those can also aid you...

195188.name: Mostly Evil
195188.description:
From their Evil Lairs / Parent's basement players rule Cityopolis by fear, defeating wave after wave of superheroes with their diabolical creations! Who will defeat the most heroes and rein supreme... from jail when they get caught because... well... Superheroes are awesome like that.

Players get a hand of cards from which they will play or discard 2 per turn. For example minions, like Florence 'Hard Nut' McGee, could be placed on the field and players can start to create fiendishly clever weapons like the Poisonous Death Lamp. Alternatively they could play event cards such as the "Publish a photo of your rival stroking a Kitten" to reduce the fear gripping the city. Finally they could get bored and call up a Superhero to help the city... Then later use them for target practise. Superheroes start a set distance from the City and move closer after every round. If they reach the city they start to reduce the fear count which acts as the game timer.

Reducing fear and calling up Superheroes nets players kudos worth VP's at the end but defeating Superheroes earns you Capes which are worth more VP's and after all you are Mostly Evil.

195189.name: Dawn-Winds
195189.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are defined by a variety of Traits that are vaguely like Attributes but often much broader in scope. Also, the values associated with Traits vary through play. Some Traits are individual scores but others are shared "pool" Traits for all characters. Likewise, the game uses two shared dice pools during play. The game presents a detailed and intriguing setting with several complex elements. The game also is notable for being one of the lengthier submissions to the online competition.

195190.name: Thumper
videogamehonor: 2015 AzPlay Awards Best Game Design Nominee
2015 AzPlay Awards Best Music/Sound Nominee
2015 AzPlay Awards Most Re-Playable Game Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best Music/Sound Design of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best VR Game of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Innovation of the Year Honorable Mention
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Visual Arts of the Year Honorable Mention
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best VR/AR Game of the Year Honorable Mention
2017 SXSW Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
195190.description:
It is played by pressing buttons in sync with the beat, while a beetle speeds down a track in fantastic worlds.

Source: Wikipedia, "Thumper (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195191.name: Diamonds Are Forever
195191.description:
User summary:

This structured storytelling game takes place in three distinct phases, each with a defined purpose and setting. The phases move the story through planning a big heist, executing the heist, and dealing with the aftermath. A standard pack of French playing cards drives the action; cards are placed in three diamond patterns, face-down, and then flipped over to determine "what happens next"; that event then is narrated. Each suit and value has a particular meaning to assist in driving the narrative.

195192.name: Ice (2004)
195192.description:
From the introduction:

Ice is a game of story telling, role playing, decision making, and resource management. When you play Ice, no matter your role in the game, your job is to entertain your fellows. Remember this. It will improve your gaming experience. In a game of Ice, one player is the referee and has a number of special duties. The other players are each primarily concerned with operating their character in the shared game world. Both the referee and the other players will sometimes: act "in character" when portraying the behavior of their characters, generate outcome statements during conflict resolution that will guide narration, describe scenes in which one or more player-character appear, provide input to any and all other players about each of these aspects of play or anything else -- typically in the form of "it would be cool if this happened" statements, and manage character resources primarily (but not solely) during conflict resolution. The referee's additional duties include: managing narration, adjudicating statement generation during conflict resolution, interpreting conflict outcomes, and awarding resources to the other players.

User summary:

Ice was partially developed under the working title Diamonds Are Forever; the title was change when the working title was used by another submission in the competition.

195194.name: Horizons
195194.description:
In Horizons, you are a star faring species taking the first steps into a new galaxy. Find new stars, explore new worlds, collect valuable resources, and secure allies to gain the most ground in expanding your empire! Build colonies and resource collectors to hold onto control in various, and increasingly crowded, star systems. Do you have what it takes to manipulate the resources at your disposal and control the galaxy?!

Ages: 14+ Players: 2 – 5 Time: 15 minutes per player

How to win
The player with the most points wins the game.
Players score points by gaining knowledge, exploring new worlds, completing missions, and placing structures to gain majority control on each star system.
See the Scoring Side of your Scoring / Icon Player Aid cards for more information.

On Your Turn
Take 2 Actions: You may then take any 2 of the actions listed below. You may take the same action twice.
Explore: Draw and play a world from the bag. Take one knowledge.
Adapt: Activate a Habitat and/or take the top ally from any stack.
Build: Build a collector or colony.
Harvest: Gain 1 resource per collector you have built.
Conspire: Draw two mission cards or 1 Ally & 1 Mission card.

The game ends when a player places their last colony.

Score Victory Points for Controlling star systems, unspent knowledge, and completed Missions

195195.name: Monster Rejects
195195.description:
Monster Rejects is a ridiculous card game where a racist, homeless, senile, slutty and other reject monsters battle in four different realms.

The game is a modified, more strategic version of Crazy 8's combined with reject monsters and f*cked up mechanics.

195196.name: Whispers in the Door
195196.description:
A Snow From Korea Variation

From the introduction:

In Nihon, the summer is long, and dry, and hot, and all the men are abroad, seeking snow to cool the brows of their wives. But the courts are not silent; the halls are not still. The samurai ladies and the retainers of the daimyos are still about, weaving secrets.

The characters in Whispers in the Door are samurai ladies whose husbands and lords are abroad; in the absence of the men it falls to the wives to hold together the power of a clan, through deft manipulation of people, even men.

It is your job as a player to make sure your samurai retains the family's honour and assets, and to gather Secrets, which are the strongest avenue to power in the courts of Nihon.

195197.name: Four Walls and a Funeral
195197.description:
User summary:

The game presents a stark and bleak roleplaying setting of life in a prison. Characters have a Fight Points pool that decreases (only) during play. Characters also have and use a variety of coins during play, indicating things such as years of sentence, convictions, and reputation. While the characters may assist each other from time to time, they do son only in their own best interest. The game is not necessarily competitive but will likely involve competitive scenarios. Characters also have a race (an actual race) that limits their access to certain prison gangs and social structures.

195198.name: The Ghost and the Peddler
195198.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Ghost and the Peddler is a short adventure for three to five characters of level 3 to 5. You can play it any time the PCs need to travel through scarcely populated land for a few days.

Jack Flanagan is an apothecary traveling around the world to help those in need. Ever since his father died, Jack has felt unusually busy. The people around him experience strange accidents and suffer from unlikely diseases and parasites. Jack believes the ghost of his father is haunting him.

Will your PCs be unfortunate enough to meet Jack and travel with him?

195200.name: Dice-Match RPG System
195200.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game have three Attributes - Body, Mind, and Special. Each has a numeric score designating how many dice are associated with its dice pool. Action resolution uses dice pool rolls with results of 6 counting as one success. Multiple successes are needed for more difficult tasks. The game also uses a rule of matching dice results for exceptionally difficult situations (e.g., n of a kind).

The Special Attribute can be decomposed into specific Skills if desired. Characters acting together can pool their dice into "one big pool" for an action.

195201.name: Spell Thief (2016)
195201.description:
From the introduction:

Magic was all but gone from the world. For thousands of years, men and women lived happy, simple lives through cooperation and ingenuity. Societies flourished. Economies grew. The Kingdom of Aldur was born. But in a deep, dark cave under the Hog’s Tooth Mountains, an explorer found a tome which contained the basic elements of magical manipulation. The Spell Codex, as it became known, was divided by a committee of wise men and women after much arguing over who bears responsibility of such a tool. Over time, pages became lost, others destroyed, and some squandered away in private collections. At best, we operate from copies of copies of copies.

Since the discovery of the Spell Codex, a strange thing has happened to the kingdom. Men and animals have become tainted with magic. New creatures have brought fear to our villages. Monsters have ravaged cities. We must fight this threat using any means necessary.

195202.name: Oath of Blood: A Ravenloft Paladin Archetype
195202.description:
For Vampiric Paladins

From the introduction:

You are a monster, fated and infected by a vile curse that transformed you into a creature of nightmare. By some means—whether by the lifedraining attack of an elder vampire, an ancient doom laid upon your family, the foul magic of a hateful enemy, or even by seeking immortal power yourself through ancient rites and alchemical formulas—the curse of vampirism fell upon you. Rather than falling to it completely, however, you called upon the oaths of a paladin's fealty, and swore to use your dark nature in the service of a cause. The divine nature of your oath holds your curse at bay, but you are still infused with the power of darkness. Having already experienced death, you are a lethal creature of the night. Normal emotions have become alien to you. Only cold, gnawing hunger remains. As your power increases, your supernatural nature comes to the fore—but will your humanity pay the price?

195204.name: Heroic Fantasy
195204.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your hand-picked crew of warriors and wizards explores a multi-level labyrinth strewn with glittering treasure that's guarded by hordes of slavering monsters - and other adventurers! ~ Heroic Fantasy is a game where you buy a party of characters (human, dwarves, elves, fairies, or even trolls and giants) and attempt to explore a maze of rooms where monsters lurk and treasures lure.

195205.name: Goat Lords
195205.description:
A competitive card game about thieves, monsters, magic, bombs, and mostly goats.

The goal of Goat Lords is to gather the biggest goat herd. You do so by stacking pairs of matching goat cards in front of you and stealing opponent's goats before the draw pile runs out.

Knowing how to play your cards, when to hold 'em, and who to attack greatly affect how many points you end up when the last goat is played.

195206.name: Megaton Rainfall
195206.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




A superhero must save the world from an alien invasion.

Source: Wikipedia, "Megaton Rainfall", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195207.name: Castle Torgeath: Descent into Darkness
195207.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Trapped in the dungeons of an ancient castle, you must find your way out while fighting off starvation and slaying monsters.

195208.name: Slime Rancher
195208.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Slime Rancher is the tale of Beatrix LeBeau, a plucky, young rancher who sets out for a life a thousand light years away from Earth on the 'Far, Far Range' where she tries her hand at making a living wrangling slimes. With a can-do attitude, plenty of grit, and her trusty vacpack, Beatrix attempts to stake a claim, amass a fortune, and avoid the continual peril that looms from the rolling, jiggling avalanche of slimes around every corner.

Source: The Game Website.

195209.name: BuySellorHold?
195209.description:
BuySellorHold? is an intelligent and fun-filled action-packed game of strategy that helps players to learn about the Stock Market in an enjoyable and stimulating way.

Throughout the game, share prices move after Government announcements, world news and company statements, and you will have to decide what to do. Real-life events such as buying a house, tax refunds and work bonuses also make a difference, as does luck, since the throw of a die changes share prices for all players.

Three types of game:


The Introductory Game – the basic game, simplified with fewer features to help people get more familiar with the game.



The Beginners' Game – the addition of a few more features such as share dealing from outside investors, 'Life' events and portfolio valuations during the game.



The Advanced Game – this option takes the game to the next level, and is ideally suited to people who have got to grips with the game and are looking for the ultimate challenge.

195210.description:
The first official expansion for the Legend: History of 1000 Miglia game. Not only it introduces 18 brand new cars, but it TOTALLY reimplements the base game: new dashboards for the base game cars are included in the expansion, so you can play the base game using the new rules.

IMPROVEMENTS:

Now cars are balanced on the base of a yearly budget each player can use to buy the car, the driver (who gives bonus on racing) and spare parts.

Cars are more accurately designed and feature different and peculiar curve speeds so they do not ride the track in the same way and the difference between cars fast on straights and those faster on winding roads is much more significant and influences the fate of the race.

12 Single tracks and races have been included to play the game in one session, as well as the chance to race the entire Mille Miglia in one session of approximately 3 hours.

Using the single tracks, drivers can play the Italian Racing Championship and evolve their racing team year by year purchasing new cars and drivers.

No more calculations or writings, yet the same accuracy. Now the time track is kept with the use of a in-game clock.

Several others improvements to balance and make the game more fluid and enjoyable.
195210.name: Legend: Winds of war 1934-1940

195211.name: Killing Pawn
195211.description:
From the publishers webpage:

CHESS WITH BULLETS

There are certain things shadowrunners know. They know Mr. Johnson will not tell you everything. They know sometimes the things you don’t know can kill you. And they know that one of the keys to survival is staying one step ahead of the opposition — or, in times when you are working for a devious Mr. Johnson, not falling too many steps behind.

The corporate enclave of Manhattan is the scene for some high-stakes manipulation that will test just how skilled shadowrunners are. Killing Pawn is a Prime Mission, a higher-level challenge designed for characters that have already triumphed in a large number of regular Missions and are ready for something tougher. Runners will have to think fast and shoot even faster if they want to come out ahead in this game — or at least not get captured in the first few moves.

Killing Pawn is for use with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition.

195212.name: Brain Blasters
195212.description:
From the back of the box

The infallible recipe to become the ultimate Brain Blaster.
(The Brain Blaster: A Lilliputian Magician, Guardian of Knowledge)

The "Brainstorming" Potion

Ingredients:

1 ounce of visual memory
2 pinches of logic
1/2 thimble of tenacity
1 zest of humor

Mix all of the ingredients and get ready to rack your brains. After having drunk the magical beverage, you are ready to confront IOZU. The coveted title of "Brain Blaster" will be yours if you manage to reconstruct puzzles that appear on the screen.

A little advice: If you begin to weaken, drink a bit more of the magic potion.

195213.name: Volfiev
195213.description:
From the back of the box

Volfied…

The ultimate Taito smash-hit coin-op conversion!
Skill, strategy and extremely quick reflexes
Amazing simple in concemt
Incredibly addictive gameplay

Incredibly detailed colorful backdrops on every screen
Each level features a different, massive "Boss" alien
Special bonus blocks give your ship extra powers including lasers, power-ups and time-stops
Use your planning skulls and put them into quick action!
16 levels of challenging gameplay crammed with masses of enemies
Hidden bonuses to discover

195214.name: Monster Lab Card Game
195214.description:
In Monster Lab you play as a Mad Scientist trying to defeat your fellow Scientists by collecting Spare Parts to Build Terrifying (Or Terrible) Monsters, equip them with Items like the Pig 'O Nine Tails and send them off to fight your Opponents Monsters in order to collect enough Specimens to win the game.

Monster Lab is a funny card game based around the horror trope that plays quickly, with mad cap back and forth action as players build ridiculous (or incredible) sounding Monsters by combining parts as they try to win, Send their Monsters out to fight where the better a Monster is built, the more dice they can roll in the fight, or play Actions to mess up their rivals and steal their points such as Traps, Sabotage and Grave Robbing cards, while trying to avoid Monster Hunters that appear randomly in the deck trying to destroy their Lab.

It plays like a mix of Munchkin, Exploding Kittens and Epic Spell Wars, whilst creating a mechanic and play style all its own.

195215.name: Brink of Consciousness: Lonely Hearts Murders
195215.description:
The Lonely Hearts Killer is a mysterious figure who kidnaps and murders people that have suffered heartbreak. This monster must be brought to justice, and only you can do it.

The detective investigating this killing spree is joined by an old friend, who is desperately worried that his missing daughter, forlorn from a love gone wrong, has become the Lonely Hearts Killer's latest unwitting victim.

Who is responsible for these heinous murders? And why is this fiend only targeting those who are unlucky in love? Together you must unravel the intrigue and put a stop to the whirlwind of crime that has paralyzed this Victorian town. Will you be able to find out in time to save your daughter?

Source: The Publisher Website.

195217.name: Travel Olympic Challenge
195217.description:
From the rules:
Two people or a carload take the Olympic Trivia challenge. Test your knowledge by competing head-to-head with family and friends. Learn how the Olympic Movement inspires everyone around the world in friendly competition.

User summary:
In Travel Olympic Challenge, players take turns choosing a category of Olympic trivia (such as countries or events). The player must then choose to try for a bronze, silver or gold medal. The player is then read a question by another player. If trying for gold, the player must answer with no hints. For silver, the player must choose an answer from three choices. For bronze, only two choices are offered. A correct question wins the medal, which is marked on a scorecard. A player's turn ends after a correct or incorrect answer.

On subsequent turns, players may upgrade medals already won by answering another question from the same level already won (e.g. a second silver medal in a category upgrades the player to gold in that category). The first player to win a gold medal in all five categories wins.

To shorten the game, it may be played with a certain number of rounds or a time limit. In this case, gold, silver and bronze medals score 3, 2 and 1 points, respectively. The player with the most points wins.

195218.name: BLOKD
195218.description:
Your new favourite game to play with friends and family

BLOKD is an easy to play board game, the rules are simple, you have to block your opponent to win, at each turn, the player has the choice to move his cube or to block a square, the cube can be moved like the 'queen pawn' in chess game, any empty square can be blocked.

You win the game when you block your opponent, in other words when all the squares around the opponent's cube are blocked and he can't move his cube any more.

195219.name: Desert Wastes
195219.description:
From publisher blurb:

Davae Breon Jaxon's Cinematic Environs begins a new series of suppliments designed to help GMs paint vivid cinematic scenes for their players in a way that gives the environment its own unique character.

These environs can take a mundane encounter or location and turn it into an epic scene that the players will be talking about for year to come.

This second in the series deals with Desert Environs. It discusses the effects of scorching heat, unending sand, sunstroke and generally lethal conditions one is likely to encounter in the shifting dunes, salt flats and badlands of your world.
