195326.name: Space Mining Station
195326.description:
From Introduction:

The space mining station is an old and venerable institution,
having provided valuable material resources to planetary civilization for decades. It’s never-ending mission is to strip the ores and minerals out of asteroids, moons, and dwarf planets alike. It is hard and often thankless work, taken for granted by those who can afford the goods only made possible by the tireless efforts of the miners. But the promise of decent pay is too much for so many who come from the lowest classes of planetside cultures, and those who yearn for a long vacation after their work is done.

But all is not what it seems. There are three distinct cultures amongst the station’s inhabitants — management, miners, and robots — and they each have their own schemes and plans. Indeed, it is perhaps a miracle than any actual mining even gets done at all!

195327.name: Unium
195327.description:
User Summary

A simple abstract with good strategy potential, you are presented with figures that you must trace out completely without crossing over your line. Later neutral tiles (that can be used or not) are added.

195328.name: TRENCH SOLDIERS: A Solitaire Game of Combat in the Trenches of the First World War (1914-1918).
195328.description:
INTRODUCTION: TRENCH SOLDIERS is a solitaire game of Combat and Survival in the muddy trenches in France or Belgium during World War I. The player assumes the role of an Infantry Soldier during the grueling and miserable tour in the Trenches. As a Soldier, you are a member of a Rifle Platoon responsible for securing your Sectors of Front by successfully taking enemy positions and defending yours with the least amount of casualties. As you survive and gain experience, your Soldier will improve his attributes and gain skills to help him further survive the horrors of War in the Trenches.
GAME OBJECTIVE
The objective of TRENCH SOLDIERS is to successfully survive a Tour in the trenches along the Western Front during World War I. A Tour consists of a number of Rotations in the Trenches. The Player can play a Short Tour (1 Rotation), an Average Tour (2 Rotations) or a Long Tour (3 Rotations). Each Rotation consists of making a Rotation Deck of 20 “Trench Life” Cards and once all Trench Life Cards have been drawn and resolved, the Rotation is over and the Player totals his Rotation VP and adds it to his Tour VP. Once all Rotations have been completed, the Player totals his Tour VP and then compares it to the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success. Players can choose to play as the Germans, French, Commonwealth (British, Australian/New Zealanders or Canadians) or the Americans.

GAME FEATURES: TRENCH SOLDIERS features plenty of colorful Game Counters and Game Mat. The Game provides plenty of grim themes associated with the War in the Trenches. Counters include Infantry Soldiers, HMGs, Flamethrowers, MK-IV Tanks, A7 Tanks, FT-17 Tanks, Pillboxes, Aircraft, Sub-Machineguns and Light Machineguns from the various Combatants. In addition to the standard Western Front Campaign Scenario there is, also, a Gallipoli/Palestine Campaign with supporting Terrain Markers and Counters for the Ottoman Turks.

TRENCH SOLDIERS can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net

195329.name: Planet Diver
195329.description:
User Summary

Akin to an endless runner game, you dive down a shaft, avoiding hazards (or deliberately striking them if your speed is high enough) and taking in perks. There are additional problems, like rock falls to avoid, as well as bosses. Upgrades and costumes come with victories, which are more dependent on meeting certain conditions than survival.

195330.name: Doppelt und Dreifach
195330.description:
Doppelt und Dreifach is an abstract card game by an anonymous author. It consists of cards numbered 2-15, with higher numbers being rarer. Each player holds six cards at the beginning. In clockwise order, players play one card each. If it is higher than any other card currently on the table, the lower card is discarded and the player who had played it has to draw a new card. However, if two or more players play the same number, the card values are cumulated. When it's a player's turn and their card is still in front of them, they can discard it without redrawing. First player(s) to get rid of their cards wins.

Doppelt und Dreifach was anonymously sent to various people in March, 2016. The rules or the box give no hint at the identity of the designer, publisher or point of origin. In July, Friedemann Friese revealed that he was the designer (https://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/210813/futschikato-story-...).

195331.name: TYPHOON-ALERT
195331.description: In TYPHOON-ALERT, each player owns a randomly chosen area in East Asia and tries to avoid damage caused by typhoons, which form continually during the game. The goal of this game is to survive typhoons and earn/keep as many life points as possible.

195332.description:
When we reach 221B Baker Street, Watson greets us. "Holmes is abuzz this morning, he’s waiting in the lounge."

"Ah, there you are at last gentlemen, have you read the paper?"

We shake our heads. "Direct your attentions to the article 'Mysterious death at the embassy.'"

Holmes pauses while we read...

So begins "The Diavolo Case," Yann Gentil's second extra-case expansion for Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective.

Available for download on the author's website (in French).

And translated into English by BGG Forum members and freely available in the Files section.
195332.name: L'affaire Diavolo (Fan expansion for Sherlock Holmes Détective Conseil)

195333.name: GUJA HUNT!
195333.description:
GUJA HUNT! (好獵手) is a board game designed for parties, featuring simple rules, that's fast paced and full of interactive game experiences. It combines elements of ice age civilization and modern sports with a bright art style, allowing the player to enjoy a leisurely, humorous, and fun board game experience as a primitive hunter.

《GUJA HUNT! 好獵手》是一款針對派對場合設計的桌上遊戲，強調簡單的規則、明快的節奏以及互動性。結合了冰河時代背景和現代運動元素，搭配上鮮豔明亮的美術風格，讓玩家在原始獵人無厘頭的狩獵行動中享受輕鬆、幽默且歡樂的遊戲過程。

195334.name: The Deepmarket Deception
195334.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 3-7.

When the Pathfinder Society claimed the Hao Jin Tapestry in Tian Xia, it seemed as though the Aspis Consortium's influence there had ended. An anonymous informant recently identified an Aspis resurgence in Goka's Deepmarket, and Venture-Captain Amara Li hopes that a small, well-trained team can ferret out the villains and prevent any greater atrocities. Can the PCs traverse the Deepmarket's treacherous politics and tunnels and neutralize the Consortium's local ringleader?

Content in "The Deepmarket Deception" also contributes directly to the ongoing storyline of the retired Lantern Lodge faction. Content in this scenario also ties into a special metaplot element from Pathfinder Society Special #6–98: "Serpents Rise". Players who have completed that special event are encouraged to bring its Chronicle Sheet when playing this adventure.

195335.name: Thralls of the Shattered God
195335.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 5-9.

After two years of blood and bravery, the Fifth Mendevian Crusade has struck a terrible blow to the Worldwound’s demons and reclaimed lost territory. The Pathfinder Society, as one of the crusade’s partners in this endeavor, has earned the right to explore and salvage what it can of the lost Sarkorian sites under Mendev’s control, and it has identified one ruin as a priority. In fact, the site seems to actively call to one agent in particular, a scarred survivor of abyssal experiments. Venture-Captain Jorsal of Lauterbury has asked the PCs to accompany this agent into the wasteland, where perhaps she might learn how to control her demonic half—or purge it completely.

Content in “Thralls of the Shattered God” also contributes directly to the ongoing storyline of the Silver Crusade faction.

195336.name: WORKERS!
195336.description:
WORKERS! (工人危機) is a game of observation and balance. In the game, players take turns placing wood and workers — and disturbing the other players — until someone makes the building collapse!

WORKERS!工人危機 是款闔家歡樂的小品遊戲，規則簡單、節奏快速且心機幽默，讓人忍不住一局接一局！遊戲中，玩家輪流擺放木條與工人，確保平穩的同時干擾其他玩家，直至有人弄倒建築出局！

195337.name: Safari Fun
195337.description: Safari Fun is a children's spin-and-move board game given away at McDonald's restaurants. The game consists of a single sheet of thick paper with various punch-out elements that serve as the spinner, game pieces and 3-dimensional scenery. Play is standard for this type of game, with players moving along a track from start to finish, with some spaces that may move them forward or backward or cause gain or loss of a turn. Some spaces also call for the player to complete an action such as waving arms to chase away flies or pretending to swim across a river. Others feature animal facts. The first player to reach the finish wins.

195340.description: The snake cheerfully creeps over the intersection. But suddenly, tromp, tromp, tromp someone trudges down her back. Whose feet were those? Players mimic the animals' movements using their fingers and gands on the backs of the other players. Whoever guesses the most animals can cleverly imitate the animal's walking style wins the game.

195341.name: Defend Your Life
195341.description:
Command human body sentinels in epic battles against powerful enemies. Brace yourself and fight to Defend Your Life!

Defend Your Life! offers many strategies how to win battles. Combine special tower abilities, upgrades and use mighty powers to defeat enemies in various ways. Each fight can be different.

Source: The Game Website.

195342.name: Thieves and Cops: Blink to your Victim
195342.description:
Thieves and Cops in the lonely roads of the town. Will you be the next victim? A quick game about observation and bluff for strong nerves.

Thieves and Cops is a card game.
On each round, the players are in charge of a certain character (Cop, Thief, Victim or the Watcher. With just a simple blink of the eye, the Thief, with the help of the Watcher, tries to steal as many Victims as he can, before he gets caught by the Cop. The players are awarded with money cards, depending on the character they have on each round. The first player, who gathers 600 pounds, will be the winner of the game.

The Thieves and Cops: Blink to your Victim has an original gameplay that keeps players across what course of alert. Easy to learn it, zero time setup , fits in your pocket! A game for large groups that guarantees your fun!

The player, who has the Thief card, sees all players discreetly in the eyes and blinks to the one who he believes that is the Victim so that he can steal him. The Victim that has been stolen waits for a while and then he announces that the Thief stole him, reveling his Character card. The Thief continues to steal the Victims, trying to avoid the Cop.
The round ends when:

The Cop catches the Thief.
The Cop catches the wrong Thief.
The Thief steal all the Victims.
The Thief steals the Cop man.




When something of the above happens, the players that have won, gain Money cards, and a new round begins. All the character cards are gathered again, shuffled and handed out to the players for a new round. The players, who have gained the money cards, put them aside until the end of the game.

Goal of Each Character

Thief – Tries to steal all the Victims, without the Cop finding him or to accidently steal him.

Watcher – Observes all the players during the game, trying to understand who the Cop is. When the thief blinks to the Watcher, he announces to the rest who he believes that the Cop is, trying to help the Thief. If his prediction is right, he will get at the end of the round Money cards. The Watcher is not a Victim.

Cop – He has to find out who the Thief is. When he finds him, he reveals his card and announces the Thief. If he finds him, he gets rewarded with Money cards and all the Victims that have been stolen get compensated with Money cards. If he doesn’t find the Thief and catches a Victim, the Thief wins and the Victim gets compensation.

Victim – When the Thief steals a Victim he waits until the Cop catches the Thief, so he can get compensation, otherwise he won’t get any money cards. When the Cop catches the Victim, instead of the Thief, he will get compensation.

195343.name: Supreme: Pizza Empire
195343.description:
User Summary

You take orders, cook, and deliver pizzas. You re-order ingredients, re-model the restaurant, and play occasional minigames to kill cockroaches or clean up the kitchen.

195344.name: Diamonds In A Neighborhood
boardgamepublisher: ガーデンゲームズ (The Garden Games)
195344.description:
User summary:
隣接のダイヤ (Rinsetsu no Daiya) is 'Diamonds In A Neighborhood' in English.

Diamonds in a Neighborhood is a territory-occupation game for two players, which uses traditional playing cards. Players are assigned one of two sides, Spades or Hearts, which is determined by auction results. They try to score points by taking Diamonds, Clubs, and honor cards. This game is handed out as an added bonus when purchasing a Garden Games product at the Tokyo Game Market Spring 2016.

Publisher summary:
トランプで遊ぶ２人対戦陣取りゲームです。プレイヤーはスペード陣営かハート陣営となりますが、どちらの陣営を担当するかはオークションで決定します。取得されるダイヤ、クラブ、絵札が得点になります。このゲームは2016春のゲームマーケットのガーデンゲームズのおまけとして配られる予定です。

195345.name: Robert Mensah's Sins Of The Father
195345.description:
User Summary

You play Tim, a twelve year old going thirteen who has to go looking for his father in Hell after discovering an old chest.

195346.name: Hallux Rigidus; Thunder Bridge
195346.description:
Setup
Each tile has two sides, the top is a normal bridge section. The flip side is a broken bridge section.
Lay 16 to 20 tiles in a row (side by side), with the dark edges being the sides. The broken bridge tiles may not be facing up on the first three tiles (from the left) and may not be placed next to one another. Following this guideline place as many broken tiles face up as you wish, across the table; representing the span of the Thunder Bridge.
Each player chooses a token and places it on the second tile from the left (so there is one open tile behind the tokens – to their left).

Starting The Game
The oldest player takes the die and rolls it, then play continues clockwise. He or she may move (to the right) the number of tiles the die displays, or may help other players move (to the right) by offering to share the number displayed with another player(s).

You may not end your turn on a broken tile. You must roll a number large enough to leap across (or fall into the chasm below -ending the game; everyone a loser).

Once each player has rolled the die and moved appropriately, one person (the youngest) rolls the die representing Thunder Bridge; the roll of a 1 or 2 causes two tiles to fall away into the chasm. The roll of a 0 or 3 causes one tile to fall into the chasm (remove them from the play area). Any player tokens on the lost tiles fall into the chasm below - ending the game; everyone a loser.

Continue playing until everyone is safely across the bridge (or any player is lost into the chasm).

Winning The Game
The first player to get off the last bridge tile to the right (while assuring everyone else is safe) wins the game.

195347.description:
User summary:

This product is the compiled version of the Colours of Magic series, previously published as individual components. Contents of the compiled version and the serially published version are identical except for pagination. This collection includes:

195348.name: Hallux Rigidus: Jeremy's Raceway
195348.description:
Objective:
Be the first racer to cross the finish line.

Set-up:
Place racer tokens on start (checkered area). Shuffle deck and place as many as you choose face down
onto the track in the empty spaces.

Play:
Roll both dice, move forward the number rolled. When landing on a space with a card, turn it over and do whatever it specifies unless the card has no immediate function. Once a card is turned over it stays visible for the remainder of the race. A player who is sent to that space is not affected by the card but all who land on it during their regular turn must do as the card specifies.
When a double is rolled that racer may move any another racer back the full amount or two racers back half each.
If a card specifies “closest racer” all closest on the same space are affected.
Sometimes a loop in play is created... stop on the last space before the loop is created.
Pit Stop: When your racer is required to move back you may move into a pit stop, possibly cutting
short the number of spaces you have to move backward. Only one racer may occupy a pit stop.
The pit stop is considered a safe zone.
Safe Zone: When on a safe zone you cannot be moved by another player for any reason.

195349.name: Dark Years
195349.description:
User Summary

Tehran is in the grip of fear following a series of grisly murders.

boardgamedesigner: Kei Tsukahara (つかはら けい)
195350.name: The Longest Night for Detectives
boardgameartist: Kei Tsukahara (つかはら けい)
195350.description:
User summary:
探偵たちの長い夜 (Tantei Tati no Nagai Yoru) in English literally means The Longest Night for Detectives.

In this game, players are detectives staying in a cottage on a snowy mountain, and a murder happens there. Players have to find out the truth of the murder within a limited time. The game is for three players only.

Victory condition
Before the game ends, players must identify the victim, scene, method, and criminal who committed the murder. The first successful player(s) scores one point. Play three games and the highest scorer is the grand champion.

Investigation and deduction
Each turn, you name a person, method, and scene, and see whether other players have those cards or not. Other players place the named cards in front of them face down. You may see the identity of only one of them. Repeat this process until you are sure which cards involved in the murder (not in any player's hand), then record your answer secretly.

Publisher's summary:
◇概要
雪の山荘でおきた殺人事件をゲーム化したものです。
殺された人物と殺した人物が分からないという状況にあります。
プレイヤーは探偵となり、事件の真相を制限時間内に突き止めます。
◇勝利条件
伏せられた4種類、5枚のカードを全て言い当てられたら勝ちです。
3回遊んで1番多くの勝利コインを集めたプレイヤーが優勝します。
（被害者：2枚、殺害場所：1枚、凶器：1枚、犯人：1枚）
◇調査と推理
調査パートで「人物・凶器・場所」を探り、推理パートで披露します。

195351.name: Delphian Tides
195351.description:
From the introduction:

This is a game taking place in the modern day world. In contrast to that setting it tells the tale of those beings charged with bringing about the end of days. These beings, called doomcryers, are born into the world in a nearly human guise.

They are given the power needed to bring about the end of all creation. Not all of them are in line with the end of days. Nothing in creation or Celestia can force them to do their part in Armageddon. Many of these doomcryers rebel and end up embracing the world, into which they were born. These dark heroes have become connected to humanity and now embrace creation. It is these doomcryers that are the focus of this game.

User summary:

The item includes Shadows & Fog, an introductory scenario, as well as several pre-generated characters.

195352.name: Burn The Heretic
195352.description:
You have joined a sinister cult. You must learn how to greet the senior figures, called the Keepers, and condemn Heretics.

Game play consists of turning face-up cards from the Acolyte deck, which show the characters in the cult. Four of the characters will be Keepers. This deck also includes random Revelation cards which change the Keepers and the way to greet them, and causes characters to be condemned as Heretics, or pardoned.

The penalty for making an incorrect response or being too slow to make the correct response is to collect the face-up Acolyte deck. The winner is the player who has collected the fewest Acolyte cards after two rounds.

195353.name: Pacific Fury: Guadalcanal, 1942
195353.description:
Pacific Fury simulates the naval battle for Guadalcanal in 1942. Originally published in Japanese by Bonsai Games, this represents the English version produced by Revolution Games.

The game is area movement where task forces are defined by each player (hidden) and placed in boxes (1 to 7) in incremental order. Each task force is then deployed in according to the number in each box.

The Americans start with control of Guadalcanal and it is up to the Japanese to wrest control.

195354.name: The Climb
videogamehonor: 2016 Proto Awards Best Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Proto Awards Most Transportive Game of the Year Nominee
195354.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

A journey back in time.

195355.name: Cobra (II)
195355.description:
User Summary

Cobra is a game by Loriciels for Amstrad and Atari ST (the Atari edition is called Cobra II) in 1987. The game is a shoot'em-up seen in a 3D view sideways and above. You play as cobra and also have the character Lady as your sidekick. You run around in a large building shooting different enemies and in the end the boss Salamandar. The aim is to rescue Cobras captured friend Dominique.

195356.name: Warlock's Journal (Issue 25 - Feb 2016)
195356.description:
Warlock's Journal
Issue 25
February 2016

Unknown Underground

The object of the contest (for February 2016) is to describe a mysterious underground place.

195357.name: Universal Adventures Search Pack II
195357.description:
From publisher blurb:

As you search through the dusty, cobweb-shrouded chamber, you discover a hidden catch between to worn flagstones.

Hidden compartments, cracks in walls, piles of bones and debris, wealth can be found most anyplace and so can danger! The Search Pack II gives you 9 Search cards you can use to determine what a character discovers when they search a dungeon area. The cards can be used with any Universal Adventures set or Adventure Module or added to your own adventures.

195358.name: Acid Swamp
195358.description:
From publisher blurb:

Many have ventured into the dense jungle that lies between the ocean and the mountains. Most discover to their peril that the jungle soon gives way to an acid swamp. Sadly, most travellers succumb to the noxious fumes and corrosive pools, and their discovery perishes with them.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 20 map depicting a jungle filled with dense vegetation and pools of acid and slime.

195359.name: Acid Swamp Ruins
195359.description:
From publisher blurb:

Many have ventured into the dense jungle that lies between the ocean and the mountains. Most discover to their peril that the jungle soon gives way to an acid swamp. Sadly, most travellers succumb to the noxious fumes and corrosive pools, and their discovery perishes with them.
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 20 map depicting a jungle filled with dense vegetation and pools of acid and slime. There are also overgrown ruins of ancient buildings deep in the swamp.

195360.name: Sanctum Secorum (Issue #10 - Mar 2016)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
195360.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is a great deal of new material to bring to the table based on this story. We have a class inspired by materials we covered last episode, as well as a veritable cornucopia of gargoyle themed materials.

Below is a list, by category and author, of what has been added to the Dark Acquisitions page by the Keepers of Mysteries, based on this show. Further contributions from friends of the library will also be found there as they arrive.

Character Classes

Deep-One Half-Breed – Joe Salvador
The Gargoyle – David Baity

Monsters

Gargoyle, Graven by Bob Brinkman

Spells

Imbue the Stone by Jen Brinkman

195361.name: 8 Seconds
195361.description:
8 Seconds is a press-your-luck dice and card game for 1-8 players about the action and excitement of bull riding in a rodeo. Roll your dice and match your moves to the moves of the Bulls. But beware the rodeo clowns! There are only two on staff, so if you roll a third Rodeo Clown you'll have to fill in and you won’t score your Bull!

Components consist of 8 dice, a deck of 28 Bull cards, 30 Foul Tokens, and 8 reference cards.

Dice can have one of five different values on each face: Turn, Buck, Kick, Blank, or Rodeo Clown. Rodeo Clowns are kept, Blanks are rerolled, and everything else can either be kept or rerolled.

There is also a deck of 28 Bull cards. Each Bull requires 3-7 dice to be placed on it. Players must match their dice rolls to the moves indicated on the cards (turns, kicks, and bucks) in order to successfully ride the Bull. At the start of a player's turn they draw three Bull cards and then roll the dice. They can reroll dice as needed, according to the rules, until they either get Bucked Off (have three Rodeo Clowns, or too many Rodel Clowns to successfully ride a Bull), choose to Dismount, or successfully Go the Full Eight Seconds. After each roll, including the initial roll, the player must discard one of the three Bull cards, until they are left with just one Bull to try to ride. If they successfully ride a Bull before getting Bucked Off they'll get to collect that Bull card and earn the points indicated.

Throughout the game players can also earn Foul Tokens that let them reroll Rodeo Clown dice, add Bulls to their lineup, reroll without having to discard a Bull, or earn extra points at the end of the game.

The game goes until one player has successfully ridden three Bulls, and then everyone else gets a final turn. The winner is the player with the most points in Bulls and Foul Tokens.

195362.name: Street Rod Data Disk
videogameversion: Street Rod SE free online distribution
195362.description:
User Summary

An expansion disk for Street Rod which allows the game to be played using a different set of classic cars. The Data Disk replaces the second Street Rod floppy disk, completely replacing the original set of cars with a new collection. Because the Data Disk merely replaces the data for the game's original cars, you cannot race the Street Rod cars against the Data Disk cars.

Although advertised as adding 25 cars, it appears that the data disk only offers 23 new cars. These include: 1955 Chevrolet Nomad wagon, 1959 Cadillac Eldorado convertible, 1934 Ford Woodie, 1939 Pontiac two-door coupe and 1948 Chrysler Town & Country convertible.

195363.name: Superfight: PAX South 2016 Promo Pack
195363.description: This is a set of nine cards for Superfight that was released at PAX South 2016. Each swag bag contained 1 random card.

195364.name: Welcome to the New World
195364.description:
User summary:

This game focuses heavily on the setting, which is "Binary Five", a prison world to which the characters are transported for conviction of crimes. There are no characters attributes beyond whatever descriptions and history players care to create. The game is played in phases; the rules recommend telling the stories in cut scenes placed in reverse chronological order. Action resolution is nearly entirely narrative. Two decks of custom cards are used to resolve conflict.

The custom cards are not provided, though their values are noted. One deck contains fifteen "color" cards, with faces of specified colors. The other deck contains forty Assertion Cards with four sets numbered 1-10. In addition to using cards for conflict resolution, they can be traded for other in-game advantages as players see fit.

195365.name: Pathways (Issue 56 - Mar 2016)
rpgissuearticle: 20 Things to Loot From the Wizard's Body
195365.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Pathways covered in Blood!

How can you say to no to even more FREE Pathfinder content. A monster template, oracles of blood, bloodstones, Dungeon Dressings for wizards pockets and graffiti, plus a subterranean spell showcase, as well as episode #21 of the Path Less Traveled Comic by Jacob Blackmon. If you say no, Steven D. Russell and cover artist Bob Greyvenstein, will let the Sayona scorpionfolk bathe in your blood!

Rite Publishing brings you Pathways, a free 'zine packed with plenty of Open Gaming Content you can bring to nearly any table. You'll find articles by Steve Helt (of the Four Horseman), Aaron Phelps (Martial Arts Guidebook), Steven D. Russell (Book of Monster Templates) and Creighton Broadhurst (Raging Swan Press) plus an interview with the force behind Advanced Arcana, Alex Riggs of Necromancers of the Northwest.

195366.description:
What started it all is NEW again and then some! Advanced Tobruk, nominated for 'Board Wargame of the Year' is getting its first makeover in over a DOZEN YEARS and things are heating up in the desert ... the war is breathing again outside of Agedabia ... and breathing new life into Erwin Rommel's quest vs. the Desert Rats. Expansions will bring battles ranging from Beda Fomm to El Alamein!
ALL new counters with camo galore to go with desert sand! New maps with the LARGEST HEXES IN THE HISTORY OF THE SYSTEM in a completely scalable game set that can be expanded literally into infiinity. New overlays to go along with the set, new color AFV Cards, wrecks on the back of all vehicles, all in 3/4" size, all scenarios re-done for the new materials and in COLOR > plus new play aids in desert themed colors, folding > ready for ACTION!
Ownership of the ATS Rulebook 2014 and standard system markers is required to play.
This is a VERY LIMITED SPECIAL EDITION ATS MODULE that you can get, here, by ordering as long as this page is up. Each copy contains:
>> 7 sheets of color die-cut counters, all NEW in Olive Drab, new leaders, and more!
>> A Full set of scenarios depicting the Battle of Gazala > new takes on the core scenarios 1-8 with the new boards and overlays!!
Play Aids and AFV Cards in COLOR.
Color folio with charts on inside, a first!
A complete complement of expansions, Gamers Guides coming, just for the new generation!
195366.name: Advanced Tobruk 2016

195367.name: Ultima: The Second Trilogy
videogamecompilation: Ultima IV: Quest of the Avatar
195367.description:
From the back of the box

Experience fantasy role-playing's most distinctive and award-winning series in this special three-game collection. ULTIMA The Second Trilogy follows the spellbinding tale of the Avatar in the software industry's most richly detailed and challenging story. The setting is medieval Britannia, but the stories are timeless and involve universal issues that explore the essence of virtue.

First, there is the pursuit of spiritual enlightenment in ULTIMA IV, where your personal ethics are tested in a treacherous struggle to demonstrate the eight virtues of Avatarhood. Then, in ULTIMA V, you rely on your new-found strengths and skills to oppose a tyrannical leader who warps the virtues you uphold through his twisted legislation of morality. Finally, in the epic concluding chapter of ULTIMA VI, you, the Avatar, must resolve the cultural conflict between a race of hostile creatures and your own. It all adds up to a relentless test of character in a world where things are not always as they appear, and evil is not easily defined.

- Three games, totaling more than 5.5 megabytes, provide unbeatable, long-term play value. You may never see it all!
- Visit thousands of colorful places and characters, search towns, castles and villages, converse with merchants and mages, all as you walk, ride and sail across Britannia.
- Explore magic, combat and deception - weave hundreds of magical spells, watch axes and arrows fly in combat, discover clues and solve mysteries.
- The character you create is transferrable through all three parts of the Avatar's story.
- No previous Ultima experience is required to play or enjoy this Second Trilogy.

195368.name: Wing Commander II: Vengeance of the Kilrathi - Speech Accessory Pack
videogameexpansion: Wing Commander II: Vengeance of the Kilrathi
195368.description:
User Summary

The Speech Accessory Pack is an upgrade for Wing Commander II adding pre-recorded voice acting.

195369.name: Three Worlds of Advanced Dungeons & Dragons
195369.description:
User Summary

Three Worlds of AD&D is a compilation of three different RPGs in separate campaign settings (Ravenloft, Oriental Adventures and Al-Qadim) under the AD&D ruleset.

195370.name: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons 3-Pack
195370.description:
User Summary

This compilation contains three AD&D licensed games:

Heroes of the Lance
Dragons of Flame
Hillsfar

195371.name: RAPCON
195371.description:
At the same time with TRACON 1.5, another version appeared that simulated in particular the military precision approach phase from the same producer and with the same file and simulation syntax, under the title RAPCON . This version, remained the unique ever PC simulator for this type of approach known as well under the term GCA for Ground Control Approach. Although it starts as a normal Terminal Area Control, at the moment a flight is put on its final track, by pressing the F2 key, the aircraft was transferred to the GCA position and the screen was changed to the equivalent Precision Approach Radar one, while the rest of the traffic was actually 'frozen', meaning that you could continue control this single aircraft and after landing, you could then move over to the previous Terminal Area Control to keep on with the rest of the traffic that had stayed at the moment you moved to the GCA position. All the commands for this particular type of control were available additionally to the standard ones for TRACON.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tracon II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195372.description:
Krazy Wordz - Nicht 100% jugendfrei!
Das ultra-witzige WortErfindeUndErrate-Spiel.

"A party game in which you make up fictitious answers from available letters and must then guess which of the words might be meant to be a name for a newly discovered planet" (Win 489)

The secret task of each player is to invent a new creative word by use of several different letter-tiles (vowels and consonants). Then all players have to guess which of the created words will fit to which of the tasks.

Finally, the best guesser and word-creator will win the game.
195372.name: Krazy Wordz

195373.name: BOO
195373.description: Two players battle for the graveyard in this spooky, strategy game. Players place cards to flip as many ghosts of their color face-up. In the end, the player with the most ghosts of their color, is the winner!

195374.name: Please, Don't Touch Anything
195374.description:
User Summary

A retro pixel-art puzzle game in which you find yourself in front of a mysterious console and a screen showing a city in profile. The operator of this console has gone on a bathroom break and specifically instructed you not to touch anything. But the big, red button in the center of the console demands your attention.

The game has 25 endings depending on how you interact with the machine, and the challenge revolves around trying to find all of them.

195375.name: Obduction
videogamehonor: 2017 SXSW Gamer's Voice: Best Indie Game of the Year (Single player) Nominee
195375.description:
Obduction is an adventure video game developed by Cyan Worlds. Obduction is considered a spiritual successor to Cyan's previous adventure games, Myst and Riven. In the game, the player finds their character transported to strange alien worlds but with human elements within the settings. The player must explore and solve puzzles to figure out how to return home.

Internally, the game was developed with the mantra of "Myst in space"; comparable to Myst's Ages, the player explores different alien worlds, with means to travel back and forth between them similar to the Linking books. Though they initially wanted to move away from being too Myst-like, treating the title as a spiritual successor, they found that during development they were naturally brought back to structuring the game similar to Myst. The game will include three non-player characters (NPCs), which originally were planned to be rendered and animated within the game's engine, but by March 2015, Cyan decided to return to the use of full-motion video of live actors that will be incorporated into the game, in the same manner as they used in Riven.

Source: Wikipedia, "Obduction (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195376.name: State of Jefferson: The 51st State
195376.description:
From publisher blurb:

State of Jefferson: The 51st State is a story roleplaying game about the people of Northern California and Southern Oregon living off the grid in America’s ‘51st State.’ Characters are farmers and loners, removed from the digital world and doing everything they can to live free from cumbersome state laws and taxations. But, is this place safe from modern day carpet baggers? Can folks truly live in harmony with nature? State of Jefferson explores the crossroads of modern living colliding with notions of true freedom.

Protocol is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters together into dramatic situations. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start points, characters, and finales. Players take on the roles of directors outside the action and characters inside the action, using the ebb and flow of four different scene-framing styles (vignettes, interrogations, interludes, and ensembles) to tell meaningful stories about characters in crisis.

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players. The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

195377.name: The Secrets of the Taskshaper (13th Age)
195377.description:
From publisher blurb:

Change yourself to meet the need.

This new base class for the 13th Age Roleplaying Game is designed to allow you to imitate and emulate the forms and abilities of both friend and foe; From a treasure chest to a dragon, from a lowly peasant to the high king, or from a holy paladin to a dastardly rogue. This class can be easily introduced into any high fantasy campaign setting with a simple plug and play first person introduction.

195378.name: Underbelly Extra Issue #1
195378.description:
From publisher blurb:

Across the world, there exists a darker side to the world of superhumans. Called the Underbelly, it's a world of Covert Ops units, superhuman serial killers, vigilantes and more.

The Brotherhood of the Black Lotus

Started by Mongolian Monks who studied at Shaolin Temple, the Brotherhood has evolved into a criminal syndicate of some influence. Led by the Black Lama, they have spread out from Hong Kong across Asian and North America.

Nightdevil

Michael Drake lost his regular sight, but gained the power of Infrared Sight. Recruited by the Nemesis Foundation (who revealed his father was killed by the Brotherhood), Nightdevil wages a one man war against the Black Lotus

For those who own Search & Destroy, the Black Lotus organization is statted out using the rules from that supplement.

195380.name: Search & Destroy
195380.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Redhawk to Citadel. Come in Citadel. The situation is worse than we imagined..."

The world of action heroes is full of fearless agents, secretive organizations, and deranged villains. Search & Destroy gives you and your players the opportunity to step into that world, find evil, and stop it. This toolkit, for use with SUPERS Revised by Hazard Studios, expands on the core rules, giving you options, resources, and guidance for an all-out action campaign.

Herein you will find:

Rules modifications for the "action hero scale" of adventure.
Operative templates based on classic archetypes
Expanded rules for weapons, equipment, and special gadgets.
Special rules for conducting intense chase scenes and competitions.
New options for intriguing social interactions.
A campaign subsystem for pitting organizations against each other.
A setting section with ready-to-play organizations and non-player characters.

195381.name: Heroes of the Advent Imperiax
195381.description:
From publisher blurb:

Come, if you dare, to the Advent Imperiax!

Play as dhosari, erkunae, femanx, half-orc, human or squole!
Visit the amazing alien cities of Myxhadriax the Supreme, Yhadri-Fhas the Technological Wonder, and Yhadri-Izhaaf the Decadent! .
Train as a faceless agent (prestige class), LostHome Outrider or Order of the Imperiax (cavalier), machine spirit shaman, metaphysical rogue, questioner (dread), primeval rager (barbarian) or sworn guardian (brawler).
Select from 25 amazing new feats- psionic, racial and others!
Marvel over a dozen new herbal remedies, drugs and poisons,
Select from even more psionic powers, alien weaponry of the femanx, and a bewildering array of special technological armor, weapons, gear, and powerful vehicles!
Check out the shops extensive equipment lists and make sure you pick up your ampule of zortaphen.
And a full set of 7 NPCs, the most important people in the Imperiax, deadly, powerful, and important to know!




There are adventurer tools for everyone in the Advent Imperiax, if you are willing to risk it all.

195382.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 5, Issue 6 - Bridey Ross)
195382.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This week: A new ally to aid your heroes, this one can heal them after that super brawl.

195383.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 5, Issue 10 - Finch)
195383.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This week: A new hero to play or add as an NPC to your super game.

195384.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 5, Issue 11 - Super Start)
195384.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This week: Want to get a game going but don’t want to start out at a low level, let Super Start get you into the game. This issue also comes with some great villain figure flats.

195385.name: Five Rogue Weapons
195385.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need some great magic items for your Pathfinder game? Avalon Games is here to help! Each issue of the Avalon’s Mystic Treasures series will focus on five new magical items for any Pathfinder games. Each item comes with a full description, powers, and cost, as well as history and adventure hooks. All you need to do is drop them into your game and watch your players squeal with delight.

Each issue will showcase news items and new treasures, so get each and every issue and add to your magical collection.
