195386.description:
Overwatch features squad-based combat with two opposing teams of six players each. Players choose one of several hero characters, each with their own unique abilities and role classes. The four character roles include: offense characters with high speed and attack but low defense, defense characters meant to form choke points for enemies, support characters that provide buffs and debuffs for their allies and enemies respectively (such as healing or speed alterations), and tank characters that have a large amount of armor and hit points to withstand enemy attacks and draw fire away from teammates.

Source: Wikipedia, "Overwatch (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195387.name: The Hand of God (2005)
195387.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are all knights on various quests. Characters have a dice pool of 7d6 where dice of different colors represents different attributes. Red and white dice represent the wine and bread of the Catholic Eucharist, respectively, and combined comprise the category of Heaven. Purple and Green represent royalty and nature, respective, and combined comprise the category of Earth. Throughout play, knights struggle with questions of morality and various combinations of the dice pool are called upon to determine whether the knight remains true to their various vows or falter due to sinful nature.

195389.name: Doomtown: Reloaded – The Curtain Rises
195389.description:
Description from the publisher:

Some new allies have helped Sheriff Grothe uncover secrets that point to something amiss in the Fourth Ring circus, prompting the Law Dogs to make their move. But is it too little, too late to save Gomorra?

Doomtown: Reloaded – The Curtain Rises is the tenth Saddlebag expansion for Doomtown: Reloaded.

195390.name: See You, Space Hobo
195390.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game have four Attributes - Victimizer, Martyr, Fighter, Collaborator. Each Attribute has an associated dice pool. Action resolution utilizes a fascinating implementation of the c.f. "Prisoner's Dilemma". In another interesting meta-game implementation, players (not characters) may attempt to convey their characters' intended strategy using a minimal type of live-action play (clenching fists, etc.). The outcome is based on an interaction of the two strategies (further complicating things, the declared intended strategy need not be followed in play).

195391.name: So You've Never Played an RPG?
195391.description:
User summary:

This brief introduction covers the concept of roleplaying games, gives a concise history of the games and culture, and provides a basic idea of what new players should expect during their first few sessions. The document also gives a few tips on how to find other people who want to roleplay.

195392.name: My First Character
195392.description:
From the introduction:

So you’ve decided to play a Role-Playing Game, maybe you have even played your first game using a character handed to you like some arcane mystery on a scrappy piece of paper - a treasured map to adventure. Whichever applies, the time has come when you are ready to take that big step and create a character of your own, making your mark on the campaign world with your own unique creation, but where do you begin?

User summary:

The process described remains system and genre neutral, though the document does assume the game system will use experience points to track character progress.

195393.name: The Snake and the Hawk
195393.description:
From the introduction:

The city of Hawksview stands as the second city of Atrelios, and has for over three hundred years, ever since Goron III conquered the city and brought it into the kingdom. The petty king Kaelethos was slain and his young son, Haestos placed upon a puppet throne as Duke Hawksview. The city stood then, as it does now, on the might escarpment known to all as the Rockwall. From the walls of Hawksview a man may look out upon the lowlands of eastern Atrelios and experience a small portion of what it must be like to fly. Indeed, each year there are a small number who are overwhelmed by the sight and die reminding themselves that they are, in fact, not birds. This is your city, your home, and it needs your help.

User summary:

This adventures uses the "Combat Happy" rules subset of the obSESSION system.

195394.name: The Temple of War
195394.description:
From the introduction:

Many Orcs are primitive and superstitious creatures and their depredations are often carried out in order to appease their dark gods. This temple is part place of worship, part military outpost.

195395.name: Appletree Caves
195395.description:
From the introduction:

Appletree Caves take their name from the second entrance, which recently opened in a nearby orchard. The second entrance may have been caused by a minor earth tremor or sinkhole, or possibly a local fell through the weakened ground and opened up the cave that way.

195396.name: Myrmidon (2005)
195396.description:
User summary:

Myrmidon is a peculiar and very complex roleplaying game that combines "no generation" characters, stylized hand gestures that convey meaning, and a central card game that drives the narrative action and resolves conflict. The game was published in a series of forum posts as a competition entry. Access to the rules is complicated because numerous posts revise rules from previous posts, and no "final" version of the game was offered. Also, several references were made to offsite card files (the cards containing information needed for play) that are no longer available.

The card game itself - the core of the roleplaying game - is quite complex and involves numerous special types of cards, each with their own rules for play.

195397.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Thunder Alley: Crew Chief Expansion brings Thunder Alley to a new level of play by enabling players to set Crew Chief strategies in each segment of the game.

This expansion introduces optional rules, star drivers, season play, Crew Chief Cards and Track Cards all allowing players more control and more strategy in each game.

Call the right strategies and you may find yourself in Victory Lane.

The Thunder Alley: Crew Chief Expansion consists of eight 12-card decks of Crew Chief Cards (one for each player), 4 Lap Cards to extend the length of any race, 24 Track Cards with special rules and special scoring to make each race a new experience and a rule book with numerous modules to allow for variations in your play.
195397.name: Thunder Alley: Crew Chief Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 74 - Watson & Holmes
Quick Reviews and GrandCon - Episode 046

195398.name: Jackals and Hounds
195398.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game exist in three distinct time and dimension locations and, during phased play, travel between them. These three settings are defined. Characters have a separate "avatar" in each locale. The avatar is the character component that interacts with the game world. Avatars inherit some base abilities and attributes from the character and also gain time-and-space appropriate Skills. The game's premise is that character actions in time influence other times; and that character actions in place influence other places. Action resolution uses a d4, sometimes leading to a series of d4 rolls, with often complicated outcomes.

195399.name: In a Grove (2005)
195399.description:
User Summary:

This game is played with exactly four players and no game master. The players are defined roles including the infamous bandit Tajomaru, a wife, a woodcutter, and a dead husband (a samurai whose spirit is channeled by a psychic). After distributing characters a d4 roll secretly is made by each player (except the woodcutter) to determine which other player they blame for the murder of the husband. Play then proceeds in one turn with each player making narrative statements which must be congruous with all previously established facts. Players take their turn in an established order.

195400.name: Epic PVP: Fantasy Expansion 2
195400.description:
Description from the publisher:

What do halflings, cat folk, clerics, and dark knights have in common? Well, nothing aside from the fact they're about to enter the arena and help you achieve mastery over your opponents in battle. Each of the new decks in Epic PVP: Fantasy Expansion 2 is playable on its own, but is also compatible with those in Epic PVP: Fantasy and Epic PVP: Fantasy Expansion 1, allowing you to create unique and powerful combinations for your battles.

This expansion contains two 20-card character decks and two 20-card race decks as well as a board for each deck.

195401.name: Children of Rhyme and Reason
195401.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game have three Attributes with numeric Ranks, purchased from a points pool. Each Attribute has two associated skills:


Physical: Athletics and Toughness
Mental: Academics and Magic
Social: Deception and Diplomacy


Characters also may have additional Traits that yield special in game benefits such as the ability to use a rudimentary form of magic. The game uses wound levels for characters, though the focus is not on combat.

Action resolution uses a process of establishing a target number of successes. All players have a bag of tokens (colored marbles are suggested). The game master then performs a token draw; the player then performs a token drawn and the results are compared. Tokens are aligned in color pairs from each draw, each pairing counting as one success. Tokens are subsequently returned to their respective bags.

195402.name: Schizonauts: The Mnemonic Conspiracy
195402.description:
User summary:

This highly idiosyncratic and unusual game utilizes character pairs that are in some ways the "same" person and in other ways two distinct people. Each character sheet has an Agent and a Thief - the two people - and they intersect in the middle third of the sheet in a zone called the "mnemonic overlap". Each character in the pair has three Attributes (Intimacy, Violence, and Knowledge) with numeric ratings distributed from a standard array. The Attribute ratings vary between the members of the character pair. Each character in the pair also has various distinct Traits, or narrative tags.

The game is played in phases and utilizes a complicated combination of specialized cards and fairly large dice pools. Much of the action (but certainly not all) involves the character pairs attempting to manage their shared "mnemonic overlap".

195403.name: Schizonauts: Cards
195403.description:
User summary:

The game requires the use of a fairly large number of specialized cards. These cards are presented in this item as print-and-play components, formatted and ready for printing. Each page has eight cards; each card is unique.

195404.name: Schizonauts: Character Sheet
195404.description:
User summary:

The character sheet for the game is very unusual because of the dual nature of characters in the game. Aside from the layout and shared middle zone, the sheet is simple in concept.

It is provided as a print-and-play component.

195405.description:
Minifig Melee is a miniature-based board game with fun set-up, fast game-play, and awesome miniatures.

In Minifig Melee, players lead teams of minifig heroes in an epic battle, facing off against the other players and the various dangers & monsters controlled by the game.

Players attempt to gain victory points by gathering treasures & items as well as defeating the other player's heroes while navigating obstacles and completing missions.

Players build teams, manage actions, roll dice, and execute on strategies & tactics.
195405.name: Minifig Melee

195406.name: Enforcer: Police Crime Action
195406.description:
User Summary

Live as a cop and enforce the law.

195407.name: 22ra
195407.description:
22ra (translated “to 22” points) is a card-driven game that simulates basque hand-pelota games between 2 players, or 4 players when playing doubles. The objective is to score 22 points by playing cards, so that the opponent cannot or does not want to reach the ball or makes a foul when hitting the ball.

The game consists of three separate decks of cards:

The Player Trait’s cards, consisting of
Movement cards (Mugimendu)
Force cards (Indar), and
Skill cards (Abilezia)

The Serve Deck (Sake), with
Normal serve cards (Arrunta) and
Risky serve cards (Ausarta)

The Hit Deck, which consists of three Subdecks:
The Bounce Back cards (Botez Atzera), the ball is hit after it bounces
The Defence Volley cards (Airez Defentsa), the ball is hit before it bounces
The Good-play cards (Jokaldia), with different special hits and plays.






The board represents the fronton, divided in 7 squares (A1, A2, B1, B2, D, F and R), contains also a scoring track and 5 Timeout spaces for each player (Atsedenaldiak).

Each player chooses seven Player Trait cards, at least 4 Movement cards. Then each player is dealt 4 Good-play cards. A start player is chosen randomly (the server in the first point) and the game can begin: the server chooses a Serve card. If the serve is good, the receiver must hit it back either after the ball bounces (from the same square where the ball is, using a Bounce Back card) or before the ball bounces (from the square directly in front of the ball, using a Defence Volley card). Play continues until one player fails to hit the ball (cannot/does not want to hit or hits a ball badly), therefore losing the point (Falta) or the other player makes a great hit, directly winning the point (Tanto). After each point, the players recover a Player Trait card and replenish their hand of Good-play cards (up to 4 cards). The first player reaching 22 points wins immediately the game.

In double games, the teams are formed by a Forward and a Defender, and the games are also played to 22 points. The rules are the same, except that each player chooses 4 Player Trait cards (at least 2 Movement cards) and that they can exchange the Good-play cards before the start of each point.

195408.name: Transcendent's Edge
195408.description:
From the publishers webpage:

In the depths of the Earth, something is hidden. Nurtured. Growing. And when it’s unleashed, will anyone be able to stop it?!

Hidden beneath Alcatraz Federal Penitentiary is a massive, secret Project Rising Spirit facility. Powered by unknown energies, it can morph and transform itself at will to keep horrific villains, creatures, and alien entities trapped within, while allowing endless experimentation. But rumors of the facility’s existence and its most prized possession have leaked, and the Valiant Universe’s most powerful organizations — the Harbinger Foundation, the Sect, the Abettors, and many more — are taking an interest. And the world may never be the same…

Transcendent’s Edge is a campaign book for the Valiant Universe RPG that’ll unleash a new set of adventures on any gaming table!

This book includes:
• San Francisco: A look at the history, politics, and geography of San Francisco as seen through the lens of the Valiant Universe. Also includes a breakdown of San Francisco’s power brokers and their agendas surrounding the City by the Bay. The leaked information of a secret PRS facility under Alcatraz could tip the balance of power and attract the eyes of world shakers…
• Rules & Characters: Additional rules and a slew of new Player and Non-Player Characters continue to fill the tool-box for making adventures in Valiant all the more enjoyable.
• The Facility: This campaign lets players decide how their adventure will progress as they burrow deep beneath Alcatraz, and different difficulty tracks allow for quick games or longer, more in-depth games. With over forty Event Briefs, no two game sessions inside the Facility will be the same!

195409.name: Vampire Hunter$
195409.description:
Character creation is incredibly simple: you have 10 dice to put into your Talents (which cover both skills and statistics) or hit points. You get five Knacks, which are aptitudes for a Talent that fall short of actual training. You take a Fault, and you can take up to two more Faults, gaining two extra Talent dice for each Fault.

Resolving a task is a little more complicated. First, you take two dice (Vampire Hunter$ uses 6-sided dice exclusively)--you always get 2 dice--add any dice for your Talent, roll them and add them. If any dice came up matching, you reroll them and add them, continuing if they match again.

195410.name: The Unspoken
195410.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arcane master of horror from beyond sanity… The Unspoken!

A Power Level 16 Rogue, The Unspoken is a diminutive being of unspeakable power. The Unspoken is an iconic character in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

The Unspoken’s file is designated “Black" to indicate his mastery of supernatural, eldritch forces. With an alien mindset and lust for chaos, The Unspoken is eager to torment those who would stand in his way. An epic-scale villain who can pose a threat to even the most potent mystics, he crosses into the material world from places beyond to inflict madness and suffering wherever he goes. Mystics in particular know he poses a threat to the fabric of reality, but any hero worth their cape will be driven to stop his reign of terror. But can they discover the secret of his latest invasion of their world before his plans come to their awful conclusion?

195411.name: Cults of the Sundered Kingdoms (Swords & Wizardry)
195411.description:
From publisher blurb:

First introduced with the Lost City of Barakus Kickstarter, the Sinnar Coast region map detailed thousands of square miles of territory stretching from Rappan Athuk in the north all the way to the Domain of Hawkmoon far to the south. While many locations on the map are familiar from old Necromancer Games titles and more recent Frog God Games products, the map itself did little to tell the story of this region and even less to answer questions that it raised: Who rules beyond the Gaelon River? What hazards and ruins await south of the well-known dungeons of Rappan Athuk and Barakus? And, what has led to this land becoming known as the Sundered Kingdoms?

As part of the ongoing strategy of Frog God Games to take older and hard-to-find Necromancer Games products and update them not only to new Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and Swords & Wizardry Complete rules but also to incorporate them into the Lost Lands setting as a way to introduce them to fans old and new alike, Cults of the Sundered Kingdoms takes three classic Necromancer Games adventures: Patrick Lawinger’s Morrick Mansion, Casey W. Christofferson’s Aberrations, and Dave Brohman’s Crystal Skull and integrates them into a continuous plot for an adventure path that takes PCs from level 3 to 15+, perfect for the party that has finished exploring the dungeons beneath Barakus and is looking for the next road to adventure.

But Cults of the Sundered Kingdoms is much more than just an update of those three previously published adventures. To the adventure path it adds three new original adventures written by Greg A. Vaughan called The Beast Within, Shades of Yellow, and Vengeance in the Hollow Hills that both tie in with the three older adventures and also move the plot from one to the next to create the continuity of the adventure path. While you could play any or all of the six adventures as standalone sessions, you can also use them as a single contiguous campaign to explore a large region of the Lost Lands.

195412.name: Arcane Traditions - Alternatives to Bloodlines
195412.description:
From publisher blurb:

An original concept by Adam Matherly, arcane traditions are similar to the sorcerer's bloodlines but built upon the eight schools of magic. These traditions may be used in place of a bloodline for aspiring sorcerers. New feats are also included to build upon these traditions.

195413.name: I Loot the Druid's Body
195413.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventurers are always looting the bodies of their vanquished foes. Often the GM simply reads off the villain’s equipment list and the players move on. In this situation, beyond armour, weapons, magic items and some coin most foes never seem to carry anything of minor interest. This doesn’t help the GM diligently trying to breathe life and verisimilitude into his campaign.

Enter I Loot the Druid's Body. Within, find three tables packed full of flavoursome druid outfits and other accoutrements along with the random things found in a druid’s pouch. Use them to enliven the looting in your campaign today!

195414.name: I Loot the Druid's Body
195414.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventurers are always looting the bodies of their vanquished foes. Often the GM simply reads off the villain’s equipment list and the players move on. In this situation, beyond armour, weapons, magic items and some coin most foes never seem to carry anything of minor interest. This doesn’t help the GM diligently trying to breathe life and verisimilitude into his campaign.

Enter I Loot the Druid's Body. Within, find three tables packed full of flavoursome druid outfits and other accoutrements along with the random things found in a druid’s pouch. Use them to enliven the looting in your campaign today!

195415.name: Swashbuckler
195415.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Call me a knave? Demand a Duel? Could you be anymore backward and uncultured? No-one does that any more. It’s boorish and what’s more, it is beneath me. Now beg for my forgiveness before I remove your eye from your head”

The Masked Swashbuckler

Features feats for the Slayer, the stylish combination of ranger and rogue which together will make it a bad day for their chosen target.

Daring Attack - Whilst having Panache you do more damage
Dramatic Escape - Negate damage but at a cost
Flair for the dramatic - Retake shots that you miss
Greater Panache - Your charisma is treated as if it is higher in certain circumstances
Impressive Reflexes - Retake Reflexe saving throws
Improved Nimble - Whilst you have Panache, your armor is improved
Legendary Swashbuckler - You are treated as if you one level higher
Skilful Swashbuckler - You can trade Panache for a bonus to your skills
Superior Deeds - You may re-roll any dice roll related to Deeds
Swashbucklers Charm - Social rolls are now a bit easier

195416.name: Warpriest
195416.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Yes my homeland is what you call a frozen wasteland. But to me it is a land of power, of strength, of courage and most importantly, to me at least, it is the home of my gods and they are full of wrath which they will unleash if you don’t let me pass… ”

Flegar Wolfsson,
Grand Warpriest of the North

Features feats for the Warpriest, the potent combination of cleric and fighter.

Divine Aim - Sacred Weapon can now be improved if you sacrifice energy
Divine Armour - Sacrifice a spell for a bonus to your AC
Divine Attack - Sacrifice a spell to gain a bonus to your minimum damage
Divine Luck - Give up a spell for a general bonus yo your dice rolls
Divine Power - You gain +1 to your effective level for determining level based effects
Divine Rage - Gain a bonus to certai damage and attack rolls
Greater Blessings - Gain a bonus to your Blessings when you sacrifice a spell
Greater Channel Energy - Gain a bonus to damage or healing when using channel energy
Sacred Protection - Sacrifice a spell for a bonus to a saving throw.
Warface - Those attacking you suffer a penalty

195417.name: The Salvager Menace
195417.description:
From publisher blurb:

Invading from inside Evangless, the salvagers are autonomous invaders, leaking out of Solari and waging a war against its host. Built to create the perfect society, they have decided to do exactly that: and humans have no place in that vision.

This PDF expansion brings to you 23 pages on the salvager territory, 4 new salvager generals, and tons of great adventure hooks to throw them into your Tephra saga.

195418.name: Onero: City of Sins
195418.description:
From publisher blurb:

Onero. City of Sins.

A place where lost souls can sink deeper into depravity

This book contains:

A history of the city of Onero
Detailed description of all seven districts: from the well-lit Northbank to the delicious aromas of the Food Court, from the exclusve Celis Park to the brothels of Lecher's Ward.
Sixteen NPCs that can help or sink visitors
Adventure locations and plot hooks
A new, unique monster to Onero: the prickle
A city that will be used extensively for the Legacies Organized Play Campaign




Content of this book is usable for the Tyrants of Saggakar, but can be used in any campaign using the 3rd edition of the world’s oldest role-playing game or Pathfinder Role-Playing Game. However, it is mostly system-agnostic and its content could be easily adapted to any game system.

195419.description: This promo packs adds new twists to JurassAttack! with the addition of 8 new cards including: Herbivores, Meteors, and Rotten Eggs.
195419.name: JurassAttack!: Promo Pack

195420.name: Maps of the Ninth World 2
195420.description:
From the publisher blurb:

Numenera is a game of discovery and exploration, and the Ninth World is a setting replete with mystery. The Ninth World Guidebook is illustrated with dozens of maps covering a staggering variety of regions, cities, and settlements. Maps of the Ninth World 2 brings these glorious maps together in a single, handy resource that’s optimized for printing and mobile viewing.

Explore Izaltu’s Needle, head into the Frozen South, brave the Rayskel Cays, and venture into the Lands of the Dawn. These are included, along with the Ninth World supercontinent and all of the other major areas from the Ninth World Guidebook, in maps by renowned fantasy cartographer Christopher West. Each map is presented both with tags and without, for use both by the GM and as player handouts. They’re presented in a high-resolution format, with one map per page, perfect for zooming in on all the little details, showing off at the gaming table, or printing!

Maps of the Ninth World 2 is a perfect companion to the original Maps of the Ninth World, which includes all the regional maps from the Numenera corebook.

195421.description:
Four wanderers search for the Last Ruin, a city that legends say contains an artifact that will grant the greatest desires of the heart. A lost love, redemption, acceptance, a family rejoined-- these are the fires that fuel the wanderers' journeys, but can they overcome their own greed and inner demons on the way?

In Near and Far, you and up to three friends explore many different maps in a search for the Last Ruin, recruiting adventurers, hunting for treasure, and competing to be the most storied traveler. You must collect food and equipment at town for long journeys to mysterious locales, making sure not to forget enough weapons to fight off bandits, living statues, and rusty robots! Sometimes in your travels you'll run into something unique and one of your friends will read what happens to you from a book of stories, giving you a choice of how to react, creating a new and memorable tale each time you play.

Near and Far is a sequel to Above and Below and includes a book of encounters. This time players read over ten game sessions to reach the end of the story. Each chapter is played on a completely new map with unique art and adventures.

Answer the call of the ruins and begin your journey.
195421.name: Near and Far
boardgamepodcastepisode: 15. Devon Dice podcast - Pokemon, Carson City, Near and Far
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 024 – Top 10 iOS Games
Episode 46 :: SaltCon Recap - The Grimm Forest Kickstarter Preview
The WDYPTW Conversation Thing with Ryan Laukat ep 85.06

195422.name: Battle for the Undercity
rpgissuearticle: The Best of the Dungeon Masters Guild
195422.description:
From the introduction:

Battle for the Undercity is a D&D 5th Edition adventure designed for a DM’s use in any Forgotten Realms campaign. This adventure includes three, separate three-to-four hour long missions that can be run in any order, depending upon the needs and composition of your party members. While this was designed as a Level 8 adventure module to be run in the recommended time, you will find notes to adjust the missions to increase or decrease their difficulty and length

A three-part adventure for 7th- to 9th-level characters

195423.description:
Vortium is a collectible card game in an alien science fiction Universe. You are one of the Eternal, immortal and powerful beings that influence entire civilizations, and use them in their struggle with other Eternal to decide the fate of the Universe. You will open vortex in space, and through them you'll bring beings, devices, relics, ships, or use the energy to play actions, changing the course of the battle. Choose your allies between Shyr (reptilian fighters), Atlantis (aquatic humanoids), Meraq (gray geneticists), Al-Tuban (draconian conquerors), Tzabekh (humanoids) or the mysterious Nishtya.

You build two decks from your collection of cards: One of 50 cards, containing beings, devices, relics, ships, and actions from different civilizations, and another with 15 nexus cards, which you will use to open and enlarge vortex to different civilizations that will allow you to play the other cards.

Summon from their homeworlds different beings, enhance them with devices, or have them to pilot spaceships. Use relics from the Eternal to change the battlefield. You can attack your opponent's vortex with your beings and ships, trying to close them. Shut down all your opponent's vortex and you'll win the game!
195423.name: Vortium

195424.name: The Guardian: A Fighter Archetype
195424.description:
From the introduction:

This document presents a fighter archetype for D&D focused on protecting others and controlling the battlefield.

User summary:

Provides three fighting styles and four archetype abilities.

195425.description: Enemigos ancestrales is the first expansion for Vortium CCG. Here you will find 195 new cards, new mechanics, many more draconians, the new civilization of Tzabekh and the first glimpse at the vidians from Nishtya.
195425.name: Enemigos ancestrales

195428.name: Handbook: House Kurita
rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG
195428.description:
Publisher Blurb:

For almost a millennium, the symbol of the Dragon has struck fear into the rest of the Inner Sphere. The fearless dedication of its warriors, the devotion of its people, and the awesome ambitions of its Coordinator: House Kurita has been more reviled than any other power. Yet a new leader has arisen in the last decades, bringing about a host of reforms and reigning in the realm's most rapacious desires. Such rebirth comes at a price, as various shadowy influencers fix their eyes on reigniting the Dragon's glorious past. Only time will tell which path the Dragon will follow.... Handbook: House Kurita cover the pivotal history, politics and cultures of the Inner Sphere's most feared Great Houses. Not just a sourcebook, Handbook: House Kurita covers rules for both BattleTech and A Time of War game play, including such areas as personal equipment, support vehicles, creatures and more.

195430.name: AXE: Play Sheets
195430.description:
User summary:

AXE is distributed with a variety of single-page PDF documents that are intended to be used as print-and-play accessories. Typically these are placed in a ZIP archive. The available sheets include:


Challenge Sheet - tracking meters/boxes for session play
Character Sheet - standard format character sheet
Character Sheet - alternate format character sheet
Tracking Sheet - character abstracts for game master
Realms - high resolution color map of the setting (JPG)

195431.name: AXE: Welcome
195431.description:
User summary:

This item provides an overview and "quick start" abstraction of the complete rules. The document content allows for rapid introductory gaming but is probably insufficient for even a full single session. With an experience game master, this item probably would be sufficient to get new players up and running.

195432.name: The Mohray House
195432.description:
From the introduction:

Something strange is happening in the Mohray House. About four months ago old Lady Mohray passed on, though nobody knows exactly when since she had obviously been dead for some time when her body was found. Father Kamryn, of the Shrine of Selinay, buried the old eccentric in the wild remnants of the garden behind her manor-house and, since she had no relatives closer than Waterford, the dilapidated old house has stood empty since. Now though, strange noises have been heard from the house and the people of Lamber's Market have started saying that the house is haunted but nobody has quite had the nerve to investigate... until now.

User summary:

The PDF typically is distributed in a ZIP archive that also includes a one-page JPG file presenting a map of the entire structure.

195433.name: AXE: Core Rules
195433.description:
User summary:

The core rules of the game are distributed in a ZIP archive that contains four PDF files:


Rules
Combat
Magic
Threat Encounters Bonus Dice


Generally, these documents include what you would expect from their titles. The Rules document presents character creation and the dice pool mechanic. The game intriguingly collapses a character's performance dice pool with their health status--wounds remove dice from the active pool; healing restores them.

While the design goal of the game was provide a simple, easily-accessible system that sacrifices realism for playability, the actual dice pool mechanic is quite complex and has numerous special-case rules. The Threat Encounters Bonus Dice document provides an additional series of variants to the already complicated dice pool rules.

195434.name: Fallout 4 - Automatron
195434.description:
In Automatron, the mysterious Mechanist has unleashed a horde of evil robots into the Commonwealth, including the devious Robobrain. Hunt them down and harvest their parts to build and mod your own custom robot companions. Choose from hundreds of mods; mixing limbs, armor, abilities, and weapons such as the all-new lightning chain gun. Even customize their paint schemes and choose their voices!

Source: The Developer Website.

195435.name: SET SAILS FOR GLORY: A Solitaire Game of Naval Adventure during the Age of Nelson.
195435.description:
INTRODUCTION
The year is 1795 and France is gathering their Forces for their Armies and Navy in a grand attempt to conquer Europe. It is also a time of revolutions, imperialism, piracy and political intrigue. In this game, you start out as a young Officer serving in the Royal Navy. As you complete missions, you will gain experience, honor and hopefully promotions. In time, you may have a command of your own.

OBJECTIVE
SET SAILS FOR GLORY is a solitaire game where the Player creates a Player Officer (PO) Character, starting out as a young Naval Officer in the hopes of a long and glorious career in the Royal Navy. During play, your Player Officer (PO) will be posted to various Ships an assigned a variety of missions to carry out for the King. Your Player Officer will be called on to perform a number of challenges and participate in many battles in order to collect Merit Points that are necessary for being promoted. The Player determines the number of Game Turns to play (10 for a short game, 15 for a moderate game or 20 for a long game) with the goal of reaching the highest rank within that time frame. The Player will then compare his PO’s rank with the Career Success Table to determine how well his PO did? TO GLORY WE SAIL may be played with up to 4 Players if desired (see Multiplayer Rules at the end of these rules).

GAME FEATURES
SET SAILS FOR GLORY is filled with Napoleonic Naval Themes and Actions. Included in the game are many colorful game counters and Ship Cards. Combat features Ship to Ship Combat, Naval Attacks on Ports and Skirmishes and Battles on Land. This Game was inspired by many Napoleonic Naval Fiction Series including Horatio Hornblower, Richard Bolitho and Alan Lewrie, to name a few, and tries to capture the key elements of a young Naval Officer serving in the British Navy during that time.

SET SAILS FOR GLORY can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net

195436.name: Glory for France!: A Solitaire Game of the Napoleonic Wars (1803-1815).
195436.description:
BACKGROUND: GLORY FOR FRANCE is semi-historical simulation of the Napoleonic Wars at the dawn of the 19th Century. The Game begins in 1803, shortly after Napoleon Bonaparte seized power from the French Directory. The French are building up their forces and gathering their fleets in order to expand their Empire and spread the glory of France to neighboring Territories. In the meantime, those neighboring Territories are forming various Coalitions to halt the French Invasions.

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of the French Naval and Land Forces, you must gather your Army and Naval Forces to conquer the surrounding Territories. Territories are conquered by capturing all of their Key Settlements. Each Territory has a Victory Point (VP) Value if Conquered. The Player must attempt to conquer as many Territories as possible before the last Campaign Card is Played.

GAME FEATURES: GLORY FOR FRANCE includes many, many colorful Game Counters for both Army and Naval Forces. All the Key Arms of a Napoleonic Army are featured including Infantry, Artillery, Grenadiers, Dragoons, Hussars and Cuirassiers. Naval Forces feature 1st, 2nd, 3rd and 4th Rate Ships of the Line. Combat includes Land Battles, Attacks on Forts and Naval Battles.

GLORY FOR FRANCE can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net

195437.name: Fallout 4 - Far Harbor
195437.description:
A new case from Valentine’s Detective Agency leads you on a search for a young woman and a secret colony of synths. Travel off the coast of Maine to the mysterious island of Far Harbor, where higher levels of radiation have created a more feral world. Navigate through the growing conflict between the synths, the Children of Atom, and the local townspeople. Will you work towards bringing peace to Far Harbor, and at what cost? Far Harbor features the largest landmass for an add-on that we’ve ever created, filled with new faction quests, settlements, lethal creatures and dungeons. Become more powerful with new, higher-level armor and weapons. The choices are all yours.

Source: The Developer Website.

195438.name: Fallout 4 - Wasteland Workshop
195438.description:
With the Wasteland Workshop, design and set cages to capture live creatures – from raiders to Deathclaws! Tame them or have them face off in battle, even against your fellow settlers. The Wasteland Workshop also includes a suite of new design options for your settlements like nixie tube lighting, letter kits, taxidermy and more!

Source: The Developer Website.

195439.name: The Bottom of the Well
195439.description:
A visual novel where Alice steps into a different kind of wonderland. In The Bottom of the Well, you play as Alice who has just had an unsettingly life-like dream about the end of the world. She retells her experience to her friend in a huge, branching narrative. Although a single play-through might take as little as 20 minutes, experiencing all the possible paths Alice can take through the ruins of her city will take you many hours.

Source: The Publisher Website.

195441.name: Wiekslag
195441.description:
Wiekslag is a abstract tactical game for two till five players. The goal is to place three pawns in a straight row, a so called wiekslag. If a player makes a wiekslag, he may remove one pawn from his opponent. If played with three or more players there are two variants: making a wiekslag (1) you may remove one pawn from one opponent or (2) you may remove one pawn from all other players. The ultimate goal is to stay as the last player on the board.

The players start turnbased placing pawns on the board. After all pawns are placed, the players may move one pawn to an adjacent spot on their turn. When someone creates a wiekslag he removes one (or more) pawns permanently from the game. It's not allowed to remove pawns from an existing wiekslag.

When a player has only three pawns left, he is allowed to jump with his pawns to any free spot on the board. When a player with three pawns left, loses another pawn, he or she is elliminated from the game. The game ends when there is only one player left on the board.

195442.name: Lanka Light Ekranoplan
195442.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is a light Ekranoplan in two slight different versions, one to ransport cargo, the other to transport troops.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as an illustration.

195443.name: Microlite75 Basic Edition
195443.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Microlite75 Basic rules are based on three little booklets found in the boxed set of the 1974 original edition (0e) of the world’s most popular tabletop fantasy roleplaying game. The rules are not intended to be a clone of the 0e rules, but rather a conversion of them to a rules-lite D20-based system that encourages old-school play without strictly old-school rules. Microlite75 Basic is based on the third edition of the original Microlite74 rules, modified to use advancement and experience systems closer to those of the original game and including some of more popular systems from Microlite74 Extended (e.g. Body Points and Backgrounds).

Although the Microlite75 Basic rules are complete, they are fairly basic. There are only three classes (Fighters, Magic-Users, and Clerics) -- however, backgrounds allow a great deal of easy character customization. Spells are limited and character levels top out at 12 to 14. Microlite75 Standard and Microlite75 Extended provide more classes and other options.

This book contains the complete rules for Microlite75 Basic. This book includes:

Simple Character Creation Rules: Roll 4 attributes and select a race, class, background, and (optionally) alignment.
Limited Classes as in original 0e boxed set: Fighter, Magic-User, and Cleric.
Backgrounds provide a simple and fast way to factor in a character's culture and non-class-related abilities.
Simple and fast-playing combat system that tracks physical damage (aka body points) separately from luck/skill/fatigue (aka hit point) damage.
Hit points recover with a night’s rest. Spells cost hit points to cast. Actual wounds recover more slowly.
Rules for hirelings; monster reactions (not every monster wants to fight); morale (not every monster fights to the death); strongholds; magical research; dungeon, wilderness and ocean exploration; and more.
A complete list of spells, monsters, and treasure.
Compatible with most other 0e based games and adventures.

195444.name: Black Sheep NPC Codex
195444.description:
From publisher blurb:

"After all, the wool of the Black Sheep is just as warm" - Ernest Lehman

Black Sheep NPC Codex Provide 6 NPCs with brief backstories for use in any Pathfinder Role Playing Game. What makes the Black Sheep interesting is that they play against their normal type. Meet a troll that's also a giant slayer, a shadow demon that hunts evil, and a tag team aboleth and water elemental that adventure on land. Each Black Sheep also has an associated boon, so if PCs can help the NPC, they can earn a unique reward for their efforts.

195445.name: Occult Feats I
195445.description:
From publisher blurb:

Occult Feats I is the first Mythic Mini devoted to exploring the weird word of the occult, from psychic spells to stranger tides on the mental and esoteric planes. If your character likes dabbling in the occult, she can explore new heights and depths of inner actualization with feats from Alter Binary Mindscape and Psychic Healing to Chakra Adept and Lucid Dreamer!

195447.description:
WWII ETO grand strategic boardgame for 3 players playable in 3-4 hours.

A Point-to-Point map where the locations (nodes), the routes (links) and the air/naval supremacy (inner areas) interrelate.

3 personal decks of 24 cards representing the quality and ability of their forces, and a common deck of 75 cards comprising activable events, units and production places from the WWII in Europe.

Battles and supremacies are solved by the unit factors shown in each card and the type of attack made on the map, so the players can improve their personal deck depending on their future strategy.

A different take on the WWII. Engaging but simple enough.
195447.name: Never Surrender
boardgamepodcastepisode: ET104: Episodio VII: El Despertar de los Sans-culottes

195448.name: Towers of Conquest
195448.description:
Towers of Conquest plays similar to a Real Time Strategy (RTS) Game, where you start off with a very small force, and try to expand and build an empire while competing with others.
Take Settlers of Catan and mix it up with Heroscape and Risk, and then take the aspects from App games like Game of War and Clash of Clans, and PC games like Starcraft, Original Warcraft, and Old School Dune, then you get this board game.

Object of the game: Expand, Build and Conquer. Winner is the First to get a total of 30 Conquest Points. Or Play Optional World Domination, and End the game when you are the last one standing!
Conquest Points are gained by building your own structures, summoning troops and by destroying your opponent’s structures and troops.
Structure Progression: The type of structure owned determines the type of troops that may be summoned. Your settlements can be upgraded to a Fortress and then a Fortress may then be upgraded to a Tower. Ultimate Champions, Titans and Monsters may be summoned when you upgrade to a Tower!
Resource Cards are used to purchase structures, upgrade structures and summon troops. Resource cards are collected by pathfinders and structures occupying resource hexes.
A rune dice is rolled on each players turn to determine which resource is collected. All players collect the corresponding resource that is rolled.
Player Turn Sequence:
1. Roll a six sided Rune Die that determines which resource is collected. All players with a settlement or a pathfinder occupying a hex corresponding to that resource will collect resource cards. (1) resource card for each pathfinder and (1) for each settlement. (2) for each fortress, and (3) for each tower.
2. Move any or all of your troops
3. Attack or use a special ability for any or all of your troops
4. Buy/ Summon Phase: purchase new settlements; upgrade a settlement to a fortresses, or fortress to a tower. And summon forces corresponding to your structure tier.
5. End Player Turn

195450.name: Ships of the Line: Trafalgar 1805
195450.description:
Ships of the Line is a naval combat system that simulates battles between 1740 and 1815 at the tactical level. "Trafalgar 1805" recreates the clash between the British fleet - commanded by Admiral Nelson - and the Spanish-French combined force - led by Admirals Villeneuve and Gravina - that took place on October 21st, 1805.

The plastic pieces represent the actual ships that fought the biggest pre WWII battle, excluding Lepanto. The game is meant for 2 to 3 players: one player always takes the British side while the combined Spanish-French force can be played by another one or split in two, with each player taking command of one of the nationalities. It can also be played by any number of players, giving them command of just some of one side's ships. Before starting the game, players should agree on wether they will use any optional rules.

SEQUENCE OF PLAY

After setting up the scenario by the playbook, play proceeds in turns. Each turn consists of the following phases:

INITIATIVE PHASE:
Players determine initiative. Initially, it is held by the British side.

COMBAT PHASE:
1.- The initiative player fires his cannons, any hits are not applied yet.
2.- The non-initiative player fires.
3.- Any damaged caused by both sides is now applied simultaneously.

MOVEMENT PHASE:
1.- The non-initiative player moves his units.
1.- The initiative player moves his.

CREW ACTIONS PHASE:
Played simultaneously, the initiative player executes his actions first.

1.- Grapple and grapple disengagement attempts.
2.- Boarding attempts. Require previous successful grapple.
3.- Rigging and fallen masts removal.
4.- Put out fires.
5.- Check for sinking ships.
6.- Check for surrendering ships.

After turn 24 is completed, calculate victory points for sunk, captured or damaged ships and determine the winner.

COMPONENTS:
1 Playboard, made up of 5 DIN A3 sections.
60 ships miniatures.
180 detachable masts.
60 ship cards.
1 stickers sheet.
2 markers sheets.
1 combat table sheet.
1 miscellaneous tables sheet.
1 player aid.
2 fleet setup sheets.
6 six sided dice.
1 rulebook.
1 Volume I Trafalgar booklet.

195451.name: Granblue Fantasy
195451.description:
The game plays as a role-playing video game with turn-based battles. The game also contains summons and a class system that alters the main character's move-set and growth. Characters gain levels and abilities by accruing experience; summons and weapons equipped also confer characters with bonuses on attack power and HP.

Source: Wikipedia, "Granblue Fantasy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195452.description:
Swinging Jivecat Voodoo Lounge — Bonus Promo Cards are five additional Trend Cards for use in Swinging Jivecat Voodoo Lounge.

The five additional Trend Cards include: Montezuma's Revenge, Dia De Los Muertos, Circus Circus, Artsy Fartsy, and A Pirate's Life For Me.
195452.name: Swinging Jivecat Voodoo Lounge: Bonus Promo Cards

195453.name: Slave Pits of Sippar
195453.description:
From the introduction:

Enter the Slave Pits, where the wretched are sent to perish. You have stepped away from the light of life-giving Shamash; your trespasses have forced the divine eye of the heavens to dismiss you into the shadows, for if you ever met his gaze again his flaming wrath would surely strike you down.

But one day, maybe, you can win your freedom back: by hard work, by cunning or by blood in the Sun’s court.

The adventurers are thrown into the slave pits under Sippar, accused of a crime they did or didn’t commit. The adventurers' goal is to survive the slave pits and escape them. But there are secrets hidden in the shadows: both in the heart of their fellow slaves and in the dark soil they tirelessly tunnel.

User summary:

The product is distributed as two PDF files: a single-page "cover" file and a 28-page document.

195454.name: NUT
195454.description: Collect acorns and store them in trees in your playing area. You my count each color only once and you'll need squirrels to multiply your sets for big points. You'll go nuts for this tiny set collecting card game!

195455.description: Players create squares with 4 dots of their secret color in this fast playing. tile-laying, strategy game. The bigger the square, the greater the points! Play alone or in teams and win the most points! Simply complex!
195455.name: BOX

195456.name: SPY
195456.description: SPY is a 'TABLE-FREE' game of hand management and deduction. Use your spy's position to investigate your opponent's hand, but be careful not to expose too much about you own hand. The goal: Crack your opponent's safe, then find their top secret file within before they reveal yours...or worse yet...you're blown to pieces by a bomb! Covert, action-packed fun!

195457.name: NEON STRUCT
195457.description:
You are Jillian Cleary: an ex-spy on the run, framed for treason and hunted by your former agency. You must move in secret, survive off the grid, and find a way to clear your name. Old friends and new allies will lend their support; but with the eyes of the world upon you, who can you trust

Source: The Game Website.

195458.description:
Stacks on Stacks is a card and dice dexterity game of making stacks on top of stacks.

After setup of the the base card, each player will draw a base card, roll a die, place the die on the corresponding segment on the card, and then attempt to stack the card/die on top of the stack. After successful placement of the base card, the player may attempt to place their cubes on any non adjacent segment of the card. You can win by getting rid of all your dice or all your cubes. If a player knocks over the stack, the player who placed the most dice wins the game.
195458.name: Stacks on Stacks

195459.name: Byzantine Nights
195459.description:
From the introduction:

The Palace is Your World.
Stagnation threatens to bring down its towers.
Chaos threatens to crumble its walls.
The cast-offs rot the floors from below.
And the art of politics and warfare distract from the true danger.
And yet, these four are your only weapons to save the Palace.

User summary:

Characters have four Attributes, each with an associated dice pool (the number of dice is distributed from a point pool at creation). The character has varying strengths associated with specific Attributes, such that different types of dice (e.g. d4, d6, d8) are used in the pool for different Attributes. Characters also select a Guild to which they belong, that gives access to various Traits (in game abilities or resources) as well as determining their social capabilities. The game is heavily depended on the well-developed and unusual setting.

195460.name: Defunct
videogamehonor: 2014 Swedish Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
195460.description:
Defunct is an adventure game with a focus on flow, speed and an engaging world. You are a broken robot that accidentally falls out of a giant cargo ship onto a post-human earth, now inhabited by robots. You have to get back to your ship before it’s too late!

Gameplay:

The gravitize engine is used to create a separate gravity around yourself, this is the main source of your speed. Use this in downhills to accelerate. But be careful, using it uphill will slow you down. In addition to this the world is full of different speed boosts such as Enerjuice which you can pick up and use to go faster.
These tools enables you to drive through the world, meet strange robots, fly through junkyards and boost your way back to your ship.

Source: The Developer Website.

195462.name: Mage's Supremacy
195462.description:
Play as greedy sorcerers attempting to gain the most treasure. Summon monster from the nether and cast forbidden spell to fight for your rightful treasure. Gather and play your cards to gain supremacy.

The game is played by drawing from two decks, The Nether deck and the town deck. The Nether contains spells which can be played during a player's turn against other players and Monsters that claim treasure for their master.

Once the town deck has been drained the game ends and the player with the most treasure wins.

195463.name: The Joke's End
195463.description: The Joke's End is a card-game where you play cards, tell a piece of a story using whatever is on the card and follow what is written on the card. Everyone draws and plays one card each turn and goes along with the game, making up pieces of the story on the fly. However, whenever someone draws the Joker Card, drawing cards is disabled, even if cards says so and whoever depletes their hand first and then endures one more round afterwards, wins.

195464.name: Farmland
195464.description:
Your farm is in big trouble, predator animals are rooming in the nearby woods. They have you and your neighbors farm animals insight, try to be the last farmer standing.

Each player will start of with four animals, these are the players life. The starting player will draw three cards from the pile of cards in the middle of the game, all the cards have to be played. These cards mostly focuses on killing of the opponents animals or steal their animals. The goal of the game is to get rid of every other player's animals.

195465.name: Duplexer
195465.description:
User Summary

Duplexer is an abstract puzzle game with platforming mechanics. The player manipulates the room they are in which is built with cubes. They can move the cubes around to change the layout of the room and allow them to complete tasks and reach their objective.

195466.name: Epic Explorers
195466.description:
From the publisher:

There's an ancient relic used to be occupied by 3 groups of creature. Today, sons of the great legend have returned. Reclaim the legacy of ancestors and capture the relic, you'll be the legend!
Players are required to place 8 District cards at least on the table to win the game. Each player has to draw cards at the beginning of the turn and there's only one District card can be played each turn. Everyone can either play a Attack card to destroy District of others' or play a Trap/Spell card to protect the District card.

195467.name: The Syrak Catacombs: Level, the First
195467.description:
User summary:

Set in an ancient, razed monastery, this adventure can be used with nearly any fantasy genre system. It especially is suitable for "old school" style gaming with any of the various "retro-clones" available. In addition to the keyed adventure areas several types of maps are provided, including an annotated map for the dungeon master and a player's handout map.

The product presents the first level of the catacombs and suggests deeper levels exist (but must be created by the dungeon master.

195468.name: League and Fathom
195468.description:
User summary:

Each pre-generated character has a print-and-play character sheet included in the rules. Players name their characters and may take notes, but everything else is already established for their role. The game does not use dice but states they may be used if the players find it helpful to generate ideas.

The game is resolved entirely through narration and there is no opposed action resolution mechanism provided. As the characters are all crew on the same ship, presumably they will share the same basic goals - whatever those may be.

195469.description:
Heir to the Throne (HT3) is a 2-4 player card game of treachery and sabotage where players compete to build noble families and fight each other for the throne of King Graham, the aged ruler of Wysteria. Each player is responsible for building their lineage and defending their family members from rival families.

This is done through a family tree style playing field. Players begin the game with a Noble House Card that shows both a Lord and Lady. From there, players use Court Drama Cards to arrange marriages and have children and thereby grow their family tree. Each character can play two Court Drama Cards on their turn to maintain and develop their own family tree, or attack their rivals.

In addition to helping characters wed and have children, some Court Drama Cards also let players make others illegitimate or infertile, preventing them from winning the throne. Likewise, other Court Drama Cards allow players to remove these negative effects and to restore themselves to their former glory.

In order to win the throne, a noble family must produce at least one great-grandson that is of age and neither illegitimate nor infertile.
195469.name: Heir to the Throne

195470.name: Oddpool
195470.description:
From the introduction:

A glimpse of a ruined city
...
About Oddpool:


An abandoned city across the river where sensible people refuse to go
Strangefolk & creatures dwell there
No-one knows what made it Odd


User summary:

Provided in two formats; an A7 version for "standard" printing and a pocketmod version (print and fold).

195471.name: Lost Paradigm Game System
195471.description:
User summary:

The game is intended to provide a universal, generic system that can support any genre of roleplaying. The presentation is concise but dense and probably is not a good fit for inexperienced players.

Characters have ten Attributes with values assigned from a point pool at creation. The Attribute value in turn yields a modifier that is used during the game. Characters have a variety of derived Statistics that are used in play; none of these are well defined in the game but should be apparent to experienced players. Characters have four Skills which may be defined at creation. Action resolution uses a modified d20 against a difficulty level. Characters gain experience points and levels, which improves overall performance.

195472.name: The Adventuring Company
195472.description:
User summary:

Welcome to The Adventuring Company. The generic setting for the Lost Paradigm Game System. This book contains the information that you need to begin playing in a generic high fantasy game. Classic dungeon crawls, princesses locked in towers, rampaging dragons are what you can expect from your GM in this setting.

This book includes all of the player options for a generic fantasy setting. In addition this book offers advice in the creation of monsters and foes for you to battle. But, this book is not a campaign setting in its own right. It has no information about a larger world other than the character choices and monster making instructions.

195473.name: Tarnhelm's Terrible Tome
195473.description:
House Rules for 0e Games

From the introduction:

This booklet is full of house rules – modern versions of the house rules I first used in my 0e campaigns in the 1970s and still use today. While each GM may certainly pick and choose which rules will be used in their campaigns, many of the rules sections assume that other rules in this tome are being used.

User summary:

While the rules formatting and presentation formally follows the Swords & Wizardry "old school" game, the item is compatible with any of the various "retro clone" products available. Most of the house rules are modular and fairly simple to implement; some have much greater scope.

195474.description:
Political Suicide! is a card game of brutal and heart-pounding political carnage, where players struggle to avoid the greatest suicides of our time while bringing down the political opposition.

Each player starts with three political suicides that must be protected at all costs, either by swaying public opinion, conjuring political defences, or attacking the opposition.

In the game, players take turns until someone plays a preparation card - such as wire tapping the President’s office - at which point all hell breaks loose! All other players must then race to throw down either an attack or distract card. When an attack card is played the victim of the attack must be able to defend against the accusation or reveal one of their life-threatening suicide cards.

It combines elements of Snap, 500, and Shithead; while offering players the chance to re-live the most exciting moments in history from the viewpoint of the world’s most suicidal politicians.
195474.name: Political Suicide!
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games

195475.name: There's Poop In My Soup
195475.description:
User Summary

Play as a child flinging feces onto people.

195476.name: Master Thief
195476.description:
Master Thieves begin every turn by stealing items from the Museum. Museum Cards are designed with way-finding to guide your actions throughout the game. Action Cards represent what you’re up to in the darkness of the Museum, like sneaking, swiping, stashing and stealing. But while you're collecting loot, remember to keep a close eye on the remaining time and the alerted Security to plan the perfect getaway. Escape from the Museum with the most valuable works of art, and pull off the grandest heist of all time!

What’s Different about Master Thief?

When designing the functions of Master Thief we used probability matrices to craft the most variety and build the most tension. The game is meant to incite visceral emotion from its players and even a few arguments.

Some combinations of cards and items offer interesting strategies that are purposefully left vague, this allows for what we’re calling The Jury of Thieves. In a Jury of Thieves players are given the chance to decide the fate of their opponents and their actions by majority vote. This is a great way to earn your opponents’ trust and an even better way to make enemies.

In the museum you’ll also be able to steal charmed items. Charms provide new and exciting ways to manipulate the functions of the game. We’re very excited about these in particular, because they have allowed us the opportunity to explore the use of specialty printing with AdMagic. Standard items in the museum will give the illusion of a dark and stealthy heist, but the Charmed items will shimmer with a golden hue using holofoil applications.

195477.description:
In Madness At Midnight you control a gang of deranged cultists trying to summon their Lovecraftian god of choice.

You use action dice to visit different places in Arkham, activate location abilities, and initiate fights with the other players. Your aim is to fulfil sinister plots, defeat the feared investigators, and/or control key locations in order to gain Victory Points. The first player to reach 13 Victory Points wins the game and gets to end the world.

The core of the game is the custom action dice you use to move your cultists and to do stuff in Arkham; learn spells, corrupt the citizens, upgrade your cultists, and more. And the farther you get into the game, and the madder your cultists get, the less chance you have of the dice actually showing the results you need. Madness may be a stepping stone, but it’s also an obstacle you somehow have to manage if you want to be the best cult in Arkham.
195477.name: Madness At Midnight
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 029 – Why Jam Improves Your Game

195478.name: Dicelantis
boardgameimplementation: Beyond the Gates of Antares: The Dice Game
195478.description:
Dicelantis uses 18 dice and a cup. No pads or score sheets are needed. Six dice are rolled and re-rolled until a player decides to stop, or "busts".

The dice are split into 3 types. Six “sea” dice are used for the initial rolls, this is where players try to rescue survivors; 9 “Dicelantis” dice form an island in the middle of the table; and 3 “Treachery” dice provide a take-that mechanism to spoil the plans of other players

The Dicelantis dice act as a countdown mechanism in the game. As the game progresses the island of Dicelantis is washed away by the tide and these dice are claimed in front of players.

Players try to collect as many survivors as they can from the roiling seas surrounding Dicelantis. As it sinks beneath the waves, the Dicelantis dice also give the players the option of claiming Treachery dice. By claiming these black dice, players can keep hold of them for end game points, or add them to an opponent’s cup, bringing catastrophe to the target player and seizing an exciting victory!

195479.name: Le due piramidi
195479.description:
The old pharaoh Ah-ledria-anar is going to deal with Anubis and his kingdom, he already knows, will be disputed by his old sons Saèl-ke-speta and Esarian-ka-ora.

"Who will build me the best pyramid, following the absurd canons that soon I will tell you (apt to make work the little game that would avoid bloodshed in my people), he will be rewarded my throne and all the troubles associated with it!"

Players will be Saèl-ke-speta and Esarian-ka-ora and they will build their pyramid contending and placing, in each round, the 5 boulders that his father will provide them from his royal cave. When the pyramids are completed each candidate to the pharaohness will have to choose 2 colors and score them. The player with the highest score will, of course, win the challenge.

195480.name: Sparafurmiis
195480.description:
“Honey, what's inside the sandwiches? I think the roastbeef is trying to flee away.”
“WHAT? You are kidding me! … What?” “ANTS! FURMIIIIIIIIIIS!”

Sparafurmiis is a game for 2 – 4 players inspired by the messy arrival of a little gang of bugs viciously attacking an unaware family out for a Sunday's pic-nic. Take command of the ant soldiers assisted with a siege catapult, made of ice cream sticks, and supported by mobile spiders and birds that hunt the opponent spiders. Get as many crumbs as you can before your opponent!
A dexterity and tactical game for all the family, mixing ballistic coordination with movement on the chess-style tablecloth.

195481.name: Civì: La Terra delle Grandi Opportunità
195481.description:
CiVi is a game for 2-6 players for frantic and exhilarating job search. Will you find the job of your dreams? There will be those looking for a permanent job, those on their own business, those trying to become an expert in their field and those who are always looking for clever and “very Italian” shortcuts to fame and success. Each player will use a card representing a candidate, with his knowledge, his strengths and weaknesses while trying to achieve one possible winning goals.
Players take turns, representing two weeks of real life, during which, while the candidate acts with his "magheggio" (cheat) or "lucky" cards, opponents will try to hinder his efforts using a myriad of Event Cards really .... "unlucky"!

195482.name: Crazy Brother
195482.description:
There are many sudden events we never consider possible that could happen to us. There are as well many realities that we ignore or perceive far away from us. But this is not how life works, and in this game you are going to discover it.
Moving to another city it's always a big change – to someone it can be more stressful than to others. You, as part of the Fonte family, are going to face events that will change your life.
Living a quite normal, if not lucky, life, Eric is a model student. Member of the football and the astronomy club, Eric is going to start college soon after family relocation in Arlington.
Looking at him and his sister Emily, it seems it's her who is going to have the most problems, moving during high school and leaving all her friends. Everyone has great expectations out of him, but then again nobody knows what can happen.
Many unexpected things will happen along the way, and only standing together and focusing on Eric's wellbeing you will all be able to reach the final goal: start a new life again in where Eric’s disturb will be accepted and lived with, giving you a new vision of life.
Together with the other family's member you'll help Eric to go through the discovery of his own schizophrenia, watching him and all of you react and adapt to the situation.
It's not a simple task, but life never is.
Put to test your family relationship and chemistry and discover what you are capable of.

AIM OF THE GAME
Your aim is to prevent Eric's stress exceed the value 10. You'll also have to avoid all characters to be in Recovery at the same time(see Recovery Phase).
If one of these conditions occurs, the game ends immediately with players defeat; if otherwise you are able to reach the eleventh turn of the game, you win (see End of the game). Crazy Brother is a cooperative game, meaning that if you win, everybody wins. If you lose, you'll share the defeat.

The game unfolds in turns, up to eleven. Each turn is made up of four phases:

1. Events and Accidents Phase

2. Actions Phase - made up of three under-phases
2.1 selection of the Action Cards
2.2 resolution of the Action Cards
2.3 discard of the Action Cards

3. Eric Phase

4. Recovery Phase

195484.description:
1864, Ominus Valley, Egypt — a hoard of 6,000-year-old game cubes is found. No one knows how to play this mysterious game — until now when this ancient game is reborn as Ominoes.

In this abstract strategy/tactical game, 2-4 players want to collect their favored gods — Horus, Ra, Apep, and Khepri — in groups to earn points. They do this by rolling custom dice that both determine actions and are placed on the game board to count as a piece of the player's color. On a turn, the active player does the following:


Roll: Take a die and roll it.
Move: Move a die on the board that matches the rolled color exactly three spaces.
Place: Placing the die just rolled on the board, possibly scoring a group.


The dice have four faces matching the players colors, with unused colors in a two- or three-player game being scorable by anyone. The other two faces — "Yay-Ra" and "Ominotep" — allow the player to move or reroll any die, respectively, and they count as wild once on the board. Groups of four (or more) dice of a color are scored immediately and give their player points equal to their number. The first player to 13 points (or 21 points in a two-player game wins!
195484.name: Ominoes
