Episode 15: Knightmare Live, Legends Untold and Mansions of Madness
The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 63 - UK Games Expo 2016
The Game Pit: Episode 65 - Short Games with Mark Johnson
The Polyhedron Collider Cast Episode 5

195485.name: Blood & Bronze: Character Compendium and Quick-start Rules
195485.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blood & Bronze is a fantasy game of high adventure and role-playing set in Mesopotamia during a legendary Bronze Age. Assuming the roles of daring adventurers, you and your friends set out on perilous quests to find riches and glory, battle monsters and uncover hidden mysteries.

This free compendium contains all the rules needed to make a character.

195486.name: The Lump Hag
195486.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Monster of the Week product line takes its inspiration from the television trope of the same name: a convention by which a weekly television production might introduce a new freak, villain, or beastie in every episode, allowing the episode’s themes and topics to revolve around the latest “big bad.” Monster of the Week aims to arm GMs with creatures and villains perfect for such a role. Whether you’re looking to populate a memorable encounter or a villainous story arc, our Monster of the Week is made for maximum creepfactor and memorable “wow” power!

Within this installment’s pages you will find the true and terrible description of the lump hag – a twisted crone with tragic origins. Disquieting and gruesome in the extreme, the lump hag makes an excellent choice for horror-themed adventures and encounters, as well as those designed to illicit feelings of uneasiness in your players. The lump hag might also serve well for certain sorts of mystery adventure, as each hag might incorporate elements of local history into the truth of her own origins. Take a seat by the fire and read on, my friends, and hear the tale of a once-lovely lass turned mindlessly-miserable, hunchbacked old crone; a tragic hag whose doom she inherited from her equally-monstrous mother…

195488.name: Relic Hunters Zero
195488.description:
User Summary

You shoot enemies, getting ammo and weapons while looking for relics.

195489.description:
It is 21st century America--a place where money talks and politicians listen. In this game, you are a member of the uber-wealthy class and you use your fortune to bribe and influence law makers.

The game is a 2-player revision of Slush Fund. While it has similar mechanics and ideas, there are important rule changes that make it quite a different game. In the game, players use money cards to bribe 5 different politicians in an effort to score Victory Points for having the highest bribes on politicians at game end. The politicians start with a base value of VPs, but these may change during the game.

On a turn, a player draws 3 cards from the deck, chooses 2 of them to play, and places 1 in the Slush Fund (a face-up pile of presently unused cards). If there are at least 3 cards in the Slush Fund, the player may choose to take 3 cards from the Slush Fund instead of drawing from the deck. In this case, however, the player can use all 3 cards. In addition to money cards, there are special cards, such as the Investigator, Journalist, Larcenist, and Accountant. Each of these provides a unique special power.

The game contains 54 cards and is packaged in a tuck box for ease of portability.
195489.name: Slush Fund 2

195490.name: Monsters Under the Bed
195490.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wanting a Glass of Water is the Least of Your Problems!

In conjunction with d20PFSRD.com and Rogue Genius Games, the Four Horsemen bring you horrifying new options!

Running games for children is often more difficult than it sounds, but can be an incredibly rewarding experience. Unfortunately, the vast majority of monsters available for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game are terrifying foes for adults, and few responsible parents would set a mohrg or succubus against players under the age of eight. Beyond that, the base game assumes a foe is generally defeated through battle, which isn’t always the best lesson for impressionable young minds.

Monsters Under the Bed is here to help! The Four Horsemen believe RPGs should be enjoyed by gamers of all ages, so we’ve both put together templates to make any existing monsters more child-friendly (from potentially adorable Baby Monsters to the cowardly or thorn-in-it’s paw Weakened monster), and specific creatures (closet creature, candy golem, boogren gremlin, haunted house, and white hag).

We also provide plot hooks for each template and monster, to help spark ideas for family-friendly adventures!

So get ready for all-ages adventure. There IS something under your bed!

195491.name: Typhon
195491.description:
From publisher blurb:

Among the powerful being known as Inphinites, none is more powerful – or more feared – than Typhon (PL 15). His flock spans the galaxy, his power bolster by destroying and absorbing his own Dynasty, Typhon seeks the Astral Forge. With its power, he can become a true god, and rule as the omnipotent deity of the universe!

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

195492.name: Dark Queen's Gambit
195492.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Witchmarked heroes discover a village in the Outlands destroyed by banes harboring a lone survivor. They must uncover the cause of the damage, rescue any other survivors, and try to put a stop to the banes responsible. In the process, they may uncover a new plot that the Dark Queen, Hecate, has already put into motion.

Dark Queen's Gambit is a 1-Sheet style scenario that focuses on the adventures of a band of Witchmarked heroes in the Accursed game setting. The adventure may be played as a standalone, or it may be used with the Plot Point Campaign included in Accursed. The adventure features brief scene descriptions, with necessary game mechanics and opportunity for tasks that can be resolved in a variety of ways.

195493.name: The Weavers' Daughters
195493.description:
User summary:

This idiosyncratic game combines many elements of standard tabletop roleplaying with a highly distinctive implementation. The game is structured in execution but fairly freeform in play. Characters are "normal women" with an exceptional ability. Character creation is informal and involves primarily selecting a narrative description. The game's core mechanic uses an assortment of "rune tiles" that are selected and played. The game provides a list of the tiles and describes how they could be constructed (e.g., as cards) but a formatted print-and-play solution is not provided in the document. Game play can be a single session or a campaign.

195494.name: NIP'AJIN Shots Vol. II
195494.description:
Volume II in the NIP'AJIN Shot series offers 4 short adventures (playable in 2 hours), a solitaire adventure and the NIP'AJIN rules.

The adventures are
- Turnier in Nottingham (Tournament in Nottingham)
- Hanami
- Der etwas andere Banküberfall (the slightly different bank robbery)
- Sonnenfinsternis auf Rimol (Solar eclipse on Rimol)
- Selfie Quest

Created for the Gratisrollenspieltag (the German Free RPG Day) 2016.

195495.name: Habitus
195495.description:
User Summary

A sidescrolling platformer. You try to collect golden eggs, and kill animals for meat. You can build fires for cooking and can farm. Game offers two player local co-op.

195496.name: Lego Ninjago Trading Card Game: Master of Spinjitzu
boardgameimplementation: Lego Nexo Knights Trading Card Game
boardgamepublisher: Burda Publishing Polska sp. z o.o.
195496.description:
Trading Card Game based on the LEGO Ninjago franchise. Two players select decks from a card pool of 180 character, action and vehicle cards and face off each other.

Offers a basic and advanced rules. Gameplay consists of players alternately placing one character on a playing field containing 3x3 spaces (base game) or 4x4 spaces (advanced game). Character cards feature numerical values on each of the four card edges. After a character is placed next to at least one opponent's character, one or more duels are fought by comparing adjacent numerical values. The character with the higher value wins the duel, and the losing character is turned by 180°, indicating a change of control. Action and vehicle cards provide boosts to character stats or have other effects. The game ends when all spaces of the playing field are filled with a character, and the player who controls the majority of characters wins.

Game is sold in booster packs containing 5 cards.

195497.name: Pitstop Challenge
195497.description:
User Summary

Control the pitcrew. Select your crew. Gain experience to improve your mechanics and get them to work faster and more accurately and deal better with stress. When the car comes in change the tires add fuel then car drives off and you prepare for the next ptistop.

195499.name: Legends of the Ancient World: Upon the Wind
195499.description:
Upon the Wind is a programmed adventure using Dark City Games Legends of the Ancient World rule set. These rules provide gameplay very similar to that of Melee and Wizard from Metagaming. This adventure is compatible with those games as well.

Battles are fought with counters on a hex map that is included with the game.

From the publisher:
"...You surmise that you have been transported to none other than the fabled Ships Graveyard, the place where the wrecks of ships lost in the air are said to go..."

195500.name: Stitch (2007)
195500.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are members of a skilled team of problem solvers that are sent through time. Much of the game focuses on the nature of time travel - how it works, how it doesn't work, and how the characters can utilize the time travel paradox to disrupt reality in (mostly) predictable ways. The Stitch of the title refers to the stitch the characters make, or attempt to make, in the thread of time.
